SOME BACKGROUND INFORMATION:
Art Day Celebration is a program for Diakonos International 501(c)(3), that offers a fresh and dynamic approach to help confront the orphan and homeless crisis in Haiti through the creation of a Family Home called “KOMINOTE TI FANMI NOU de DIAKONOS” (meaning “Our small Community of Family”). The home provides a safe family haven for orphans, abandoned, homeless and rejected children where they can play, learn, grow and develop into healthy, happy, educated and productive adults who will become the next generation of Haitian citizens.  Located in a rural town of Port-au-Prince called Carrefour and residence to well over 20 children, the home is at the heart of our mission. 
Diakonos’ pioneer Wilfrid Longchamp had been a Diaspora living in California as a Computer programmer and after being diagnosed with an autoimmune disease, he decided to move to Haiti by the encouragement of his sister Martine Longchamp, Co-Founder of Diakonos. There he saw the need to provide the street children with access to a quality life. Unfortunately, Wilfrid did not live to see the full fruition of his vision as he perished in the 2010 Earthquake while establishing the Diakonos Orphanage. His body has not been recovered. But his legacy will live through Diakonos International  and Art Day Celebration.
 
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP NOW: 
Art is a tool that can help rebuild a community and can have a major impact in a child’s life. The children who participated last year keep asking when ADC is coming back. The program is in need of funding to cover the costs of  the logistics of operating the “Art on Canvas”- 2013 workshop.  Our exhibit/fundriasing efforts has raised over $700 towards the participating children's education but not enough for the continutation of this years 'Art on Canvas'. We desperately need your help:
Your financial contribution will help enable us to:
Purchase Art Kits for 150 orphans (water color paint, acrylic paint, brushes, canvas paper, pallattes)- A Reeves box set for each child to keep
Cover the cost of Food and Water to feed all children participants and volunteers throughout the duration the art program.
Cover the rental costs of location, chairs, and tables for the lcoation the art workshop
Lodging, transportation on the ground and air for supplies and ADC volunteer artists, and participants
Shipment costs of Artwork being brough to the U.S for preparation of showcasing exhibit
Framing costs of selected Artwork to showcase
Your contribution will also go to cover other necessary costs, such as:
Preparation for our next quarterly workshop in the Art of Dance, with a professional notable choreographer
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Please spread the word to continue the support for our art program! 
Become a sponsor and donate towards our creative art workshops on a monthly basis.
Interested in teaching your creative talent within the Arts? We are always looking for qualified volunteers to help facilitate workshops for ADC in Haiti
Please find more information about us:
Our website: http://artdaycelebration.org
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ArtDayCelebration

story:
Overview

The DutchMill is an interactive public art piece that will represent the people, culture and art of the Netherlands at the Black Rock Arts Festival (aka Burning Man) as part of the Circle of Regional Effigies, or C.O.R.E. The project seeks to create one of the most familiar symbols of the Netherlands by errecting a large Windmill on the Playa and we feel very proud to have been accepted as a CORE project by the Black Rock Arts Foundation and given an initial grant to get started.

However, the amount of the grant is not enough to make this project and our dream come true! We need funding from people like you
to help make this unique art piece happen.

Details of the Project

When people think of the Netherlands one of the most frequent symbols of the country is the windmill. The Dutch people have been embracing man of the 10 Principles of Burning Man such as Radical Inclusion, Community/Civic Responsibility, and Immediacy through working together to reclaim their country from the sea for hundreds of years. As such we feel that a Dutch Mill is the perfect representation of the Dutch Burners and a great fit for our first (of hopefully many) CORE projects.

The project will be designed and built through a collaboration of local Burners and Artists with the actual construction done in the US and will use donated recycled wood as much as possible. We have already partnered with the Reno CORE project and they have graciously offered to allow us to work along side them in Reno with their tools and workshop space. Additionally, they will be able to help us in purchasing the wood and transporting it to the festival.

Appearance

Our project will be a very unique piece on the Playa not only in that it will be a collobartion of work done in two countries, but also in the overall appearance of the piece. Rising out of the baren salt flat dessert will be a structure that is covered in brilliant colors and vibrant lights at night. The outside of the piece will be covered in fabric and be strikingly different from the cutout wood and painted pieces that tradditionally mark CORE projects. This innovative decoration style will not only be unique but serves to solve one of the biggest problems of the project. How can we allow all the artists and participants in our project in the Netherlands help in decorating a piece built in the US? The fabric pieces will allow the art to be done locally and then added to the piece during assembly. Artists will paint on large sheets of cloth and these sheets will be stretched across the panels of the base of the mill as well as the geodesic dome top.

The structure itself will have an octagon shaped base in tradditonal style. The front three panels of the door, and two adjacent sides will be painted in a large abstract mural by Daniella Rubinovitz (http://www.daniellarubinovitz.com/). Next two these panels on opposite sides will be two panels with the flag for Amsterdam and the Netherlands painted at the top. During our fundraising parties and decoration events we will invite all attendees to complete the phrase, "When I think of the Netherlands/Amsterdam, I think of..." All the thoughts and feelings captured will then be shared with the participants on Playa. Additionally, the bottom half of these panels will be left blank so that they can be filled in by participants at the festival. The next two panels will be decorated by local artists in the Netherlands. Finally the last panel (opposite the door) will not be a white fabric covering but will be a huge flag made out of shiny metallic fabric that will shine bright in the sun of the desert during the day and our LED flood lights at night.

Beautiful Inside and Out

Our project is not just beautiful on the ouside, but meant to be a place of sanctuary and museum to Dutch art and culture. The inside will be open with a couple of benches so that people can sit and relax with local music played through a very small sound system. This music would include classical (Willem Pijper), traditional Dutch (folk) music, Jazz (Han Bennink), as well as modern dance music from our world famous DJs such as DJ Tiesto, Paul Van Dyke, etc.

In addition to the music inside, we hope to have pieces of art from artists displayed that help to capture the culture and history of the Netherlands. Paintings, Photography, small sculptures, whatever an artist wants to donate to the project that helps to share their vision of the Netherlands will gladly be shared inside (and returned if wanted).

Lastly, we will are playing with the idea of having neon colored string inside that is stretched in intrique patterns around the walls. These will glow brilliantly with black light inside the piece and can be rearranged easily by visitors to form their own shapes and designs.

Shining Bright in the Night

One of the most amazing aspects of Burning Man is the vivid colors and lights at night. Our project will be radicially illuminated in a few ways. First, each of the blades will be brightly illuminated in a softly changing flood or color by a strip of LEDs down the entire length. Second, the entire outside will be illuminated with soft white flood lights shining off the colorful fabric sides. Finally, the inside will be lit with black light and glowing objects inside. If extra funds are available we would like to have a laser shoot out of the top of the project as well.

How your Donation will help!

In order for our project and vision to happen we need help funding it. There are many pieces of the design that will be quite expensive. Here is a quick run-down of the expected costs:

  • Wood for construction - €500
  • Lighting and illumination - €300
  • Sound / music - €200
  • Fabric / markers / paint - €200
  • Transporation costs - €400
  • Interior decorations / materials - €400
  • Clean up / tools - €200
  • Contingency - €200
  • Fundraising gifts - €100

TOTAL ESTIMATE - €2500 (about $3300 USD)

Additionally, many of the people involved in this project will be paying for their own costs to arrive in the United States and stay there for many weeks to build the project. These people are DONATING THEIR OWN TIME AND MONEY and we are not asking you to fund their airfare or time away from their family and friends to make this happen.

What do you get for your donations?

Well in addition to helping make this project happen and sharing it with tens of thousands of festival goers, you will get the following commemorative momentos for various support levels.  NOTE- Donations are accepted in EUROS and DOLLARS, we choose to go with US Dollars for our campaign because it has less fees and doesn't require a PayPal account.

TOTAL ESTIMATE - €2500 (about $3300 USD)
Additionally, many of the people involved in this project will be paying for their own costs to arrive in the United States and stay there for many weeks to build the project. story:
FEAST PART 2 - The Dress Shadow Show

The Dress show is the second installment of our monthly performance series called FEAST. The entire show will take place under, through, and around a giant dress worn by someone suspended from the ceiling. It will include music, dance, giant puppets, shadow burlesque, snacks, and interactive elements. 

This performance will take place on January 29th, 2015 at Bushwick Bizarre. doors at 9pm show starts at 10pm!


What We Need 

1 bolt of satin fabric for dress skirt- $100

1 bolt of black-out fabric for dress skirt- $100

1 bolt of lace- $70

1 climbing harness- $60

climbing rope$ 120

90 ft. pvc pipe and connectors- $141

dress costumes for performers- $70

1x12x10ft wood for pedestal- $25

casters for pedestal- $25

heat gun to bend pvc to form skit frame- $35

shadow light- $20

PUPPET MATERIALS

chicken wire- $22

dowels-$30

paint- $30

OTHER

food-$50


If you donate $10 or more you get free admission to the show!


Risks & Challenges

hanging from tall heights

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have any of the supplies on our list that you are willing to donate or that we can borrow please let us know!


THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU! YOU ARE THE BEST!!!!!

story:
I believe in the creation and distribution of sensual artistic films, which is why I started my website  [ http://fuckart.xxx ], but soon realized I need more bandwidth, support for editing [new machine/drives] and thus, funding.
When my laptop isn't crashing or freezing during the editing process, the website is.
I need new gear to keep this going.
This campaign is also to help fund the [re]launch of my website because at the moment, it is being hosted on my father's private server and crashes about once a week.  

When it's not crashing, it only allows for one video to stream at a time because of the low bandwidth.




The money from this campaign will go to //


20% funding more bandwidth for the website, less time buffering, less of the site being down

+

60% editing an already shot short film

+

20% pre-production of my next performance

story:
Projects2k, leader in local art and science classroom programs for both children and university students, fuses performance, education, arts and ecology to present...

TERRA TRACTUS: The Earth Moves

"Truly a life-changing phenomenon of art and theater, unlike anything you have ever witnessed before..."


Projects2k celebrates its 20th Anniversary of providing spectacular, thought provoking and educational programming with TERRA TRACTUS: The Earth Moves, June 19-22, 2014! 

Against the cavernous backdrop of the historical Stony Creek Quarry, TERRA TRACTUS is a spectacle of light, lasers, projections, fog, pyrotechnics, music and climbing dancers, recounting the geological history of Earth, Connecticut, and the Quarry itself.  

Meet P2k

Our Art/Science/Environmental not-for-profit is well known for collaborating with artists, scientists, geologists and environmentalists, inspiring generations to the wonders of nature and history through the arts. We kindle audience's imaginations through dynamic multi-media marvels that combine light, music, theater, dance and more. Children and adults of all ages experience a deeper connection to the beauty and fragility of the natural world through our educational programming.

Read bios of the team members that make it all happen HERE, including internationally renowned sculptor and environmental artist Joy Wulke, Jamie Burnett of acclaimed Luminous Environments LLC, composer and Fulbright scholar Istvan B’racz, dramaturg Tom Burnett, invaluable makers and coordinators Margret Carl, Robin Comey and more!

For more on the history and mission of P2k, and how we have been inspiring audiences of all ages over the past two decades, click HERE.

Why we need you…

Producing a highly technical project requires state-of-the-art equipment and top rate professionals, all of which are VERY expensive. Your tax-deductible donations will go to:

- LASERS, LIGHTING & PYRO EQUIPMENT
State of the art lasers, environmentally friendly LED theatrical lighting, moving lighting equipment, pyrotechnic equipment, lighting control equipment and lighted prop construction.

- THEATRICAL & CLIMBING EQUIPMENT & PERFORMERS
Rigging and climbing gear, run crew, puppeteer crew and puppet construction.

- SOUND EQUIPMENT & PERFORMERS
Rental, set-up and break-down of a concert outdoor sound system with live-mixed soundtrack.

- VIDEO EQUIPMENT & PRODUCTION

- DESIGN TEAM

P2k Projects . Videos . Accolades . Press

Check out our past projects and events HERE, including past Quarry projects Terra Mirabila, Terra Alchemica, Terra Lumina, Terra Continuum and A Visualization of Time.

Check out our videos on YouTube, including a short video about the mission behind P2k, our 20 Years in 10 Minutes video, and our past quarry promos HERE, HERE and HERE!

Projects2k has received Artistic Excellence Awards from the Connecticut Commission on Culture & Tourism in 1996, 1998 and 2000-2006, as well as Partnership Awards from the Connecticut Commission of the Arts in 1995, 1997 and 1999.  Founder Joy Wulke received the 2009 Women of Innovation in the Community Award from the Connecticut Technology Council.  Projects2k has also been awarded numerous prestigious grants.

The works of Projects2k and its founder have been featured in the New York Times twice! Read all about it HERE and HERE.

Take their word for it!

P2k explores the ancient and modern worlds in wildly creative ways, creating the most interesting environmental installations you will ever see. -- Faith Middleton, Connecticut Public Radio

Projects for a New Millennium has impressed and engaged me since my first association...I applaud their efforts to build new connections between art and science. -- Dava Sobel, Author of Longitude, Galileo's Daughter, The Planets & A More Perfect Heaven

Projects2k is the best in artist-driven cultural interventions into the public sphere. -- Michael Rush, Director, Eli and Edythe Broad Art Museum, Michigan State University. Author of New Media in Art

The Event

TERRA TRACTUS: The Earth Moves continues the Projects2k tradition of tremendous and multifaceted performance making. This year we look at the geological history of the Earth, and the Stony Creek Quarry itself, as they evolve through ancient history to our projected future through elemental, tectonic, and man-made affects.

The 4-day run will include onsite food trucks for pre-performance dining; VIP tickets with gourmet dinner and premium seating; and corporate sponsorship evenings with a tour of the quarry, dinner, and a private showing of the performance. More information and tickets available by calling 203-415-5613 or 203-215-2227, emailing wulkestudio@juno.com, and visiting Projects2k.org.


Help us bring this once-in-a-lifetime show to life....

Please donate today, and we hope you enjoy TERRA TRACTUS: The Earth Moves!

story:
Who am I-

I am the owner and operator of Morticia's Mermaid Tails. We are very big on supporting and encouraging children, or anyone for that matter, that they can be and do anything they put their mind to. It is our goal to make them think, and to believe that there are greater things than what they are told. I have a tattoo that has very personal meaning, and I entirely stand behind what it says. It says, "Never be afraid to be you". This might come as a shock to some, especially adults, when I say that I AM a Mermaid.

This summer, I was able to attend a Pirate event known as Seadog Nights and Gypsy Carnival. Myself and a few others brought a pool and we set up a mermaid lagoon. It went over AMAZINGLY well. I brought joy and wonder to the lives of children, adults, and even the elderly. Some problems we had, some children were so small, and the pool was so tall, that they could not see inside. They either tried to climb on the pool (yikes!), or had to be lifted.

What we need-

After the event was over, we started planning for next year. Our plans included a more realistic tail, and a clear sided swim tank. Any funding recieved for this program will go directly towards the purchase of the tank, which due to the size will be custom built, and the trailer for it to be transported on. The tank will be aproximately 8'x4'x4', which will make it just large enough to perform in. And having it clear sided will allow for all ages to see the mermaid swimming inside. 

We have found a local business, Pioneer Plastics in Albany OR, to commission the tank from, thus giving more back to the local community. The tank will be used free of charge to the events that it is intended to be used at, including numerous Pacific Northwest Events (which consist of pirate fairs, ren fairs, and gatherings).

Even if we do not meet our goal, all funding will go towards the purchase of the tank. If we should happen to get more than our goal, the excess will be put towards paying off a small portion of the Realistic tail that I have been making payments on since May. 

There will be many perks/rewards available to those who donate. They will start out small, and increase in worth. Ranging from Pictures with the mermaid, to a personal visit from the mermaid.

The Impact-

This will have a greater impact that one might think. There will be an impact on children, and adults of all ages. It will make them think, imagine, and most importantly- Dream. Some of the greatest people in our history were dreamers. We volunteer our time to be at these events, no one pays us to be there (9 times out of 10, WE pay to be there).

And this project wont only affect local people, people come from all over the states to attend events here in the Pacific North West. From all overs of the US, Maine to Florida, to Cali, and even to the British Columbie.

Other Ways You Can Help-

There are dozens of other ways you can help out. The most important one being- Help us get the word out! That will help our project reach further, and reach more people willing to donate to a cause. This is not about us, it is about raising the imaginations, and childrens abilities to dream.

"Thinking outside the box might be facilitated by having a somewhat less intact box" ~Fredrik Ullén
story_txt:
Who am I-
I am the owner and operator of Morticia's Mermaid Tails. We are very big on supporting and encouraging children, or anyone for that matter, that they can be and do anything they put their mind to. It is our goal to make them think, and to believe that there are greater things than what they are told. I have a tattoo that has very personal meaning, and I entirely stand behind what it says. It says, "Never be afraid to be you". This might come as a shock to some, especially adults, when I say that I AM a Mermaid.
This summer, I was able to attend a Pirate event known as Seadog Nights and Gypsy Carnival. Myself and a few others brought a pool and we set up a mermaid lagoon. It went over AMAZINGLY well. I brought joy and wonder to the lives of children, adults, and even the elderly. Some problems we had, some children were so small, and the pool was so tall, that they could not see inside. They either tried to climb on the pool (yikes!), or had to be lifted.
What we need-
After the event was over, we started planning for next year. Our plans included a more realistic tail, and a clear sided swim tank. Any funding recieved for this program will go directly towards the purchase of the tank, which due to the size will be custom built, and the trailer for it to be transported on. The tank will be aproximately 8'x4'x4', which will make it just large enough to perform in. And having it clear sided will allow for all ages to see the mermaid swimming inside. 
We have found a local business, Pioneer Plastics in Albany OR, to commission the tank from, thus giving more back to the local community. The tank will be used free of charge to the events that it is intended to be used at, including numerous Pacific Northwest Events (which consist of pirate fairs, ren fairs, and gatherings).


Even if we do not meet our goal, all funding will go towards the purchase of the tank. If we should happen to get more than our goal, the excess will be put towards paying off a small portion of the Realistic tail that I have been making payments on since May. 
There will be many perks/rewards available to those who donate. They will start out small, and increase in worth. Ranging from Pictures with the mermaid, to a personal visit from the mermaid.


The Impact-
This will have a greater impact that one might think. There will be an impact on children, and adults of all ages. It will make them think, imagine, and most importantly- Dream. Some of the greatest people in our history were dreamers. We volunteer our time to be at these events, no one pays us to be there (9 times out of 10, WE pay to be there).
And this project wont only affect local people, people come from all over the states to attend events here in the Pacific North West. From all overs of the US, Maine to Florida, to Cali, and even to the British Columbie.


Other Ways You Can Help-
There are dozens of other ways you can help out. The most important one being- Help us get the word out! That will help our project reach further, and reach more people willing to donate to a cause. This is not about us, it is about raising the imaginations, and childrens abilities to dream.
"Thinking outside the box might be facilitated by having a somewhat less intact box" ~Fredrik Ullén

story:
What have I got planned?

MotherSoulProject will take still shots this year to and from my journey - away from routine suburban motherhood - to and from Burning Man at Black Rock City, NV to benefit women and children globally THIS WEEK :)  Images gathered will be exhibited and gallery sold with the goal of awakening the spirit of art and beauty and with the hope of passing along the indelible aspects of trust, integrity and gratitude.  50% of proceeds from approved image sales will be donated equally to Peaks Foundation and Global Watch Children's House - to benefit children in Africa/Asia/South America and India, respectively.  In return, I am looking for help to travel to location, and making a promise aloud to donate locally as well.  What's this got to do with you? Well, if it awakens even a few more people into knowing they can be adventurous and help someone besides themselves, it is surely worth it.

Both at home, and globally, (our) children are watching and the time's come to overtly exemplify how to care for our fellow humans, near and far; I'd like to help share the vitality of art and gratitude wrapped up in one great project and am hoping this will be the first of many projects to do so.

What is MotherSoulProject?

The MotherSoulProject is for all to share and know that each and every one of us is entitled to wander, run or jump outside of what often seems like overbearing mediocrity and a prescribed experience… Turn on the tv, go to work, come home, cyberrelate, consume.  It's an "iLife" for most but guessing if you've read this far, you know there exists more to life than the hamster wheel.

MotherSoulProject began as a thought, then a brief blog and hopes to evolve into formal not-for-profit work with women and children combining the spirit of adventure and giving.  MotherSoulProject loves the power of one’s intention and how far it can bring someone!  Through writing, image gathering, sharing and purposeful adventuring, I want to inspire women and girls to use their imagination, as well as their hearts to travel through meditation, writing, imagery, art and/or by actually leaving the routine for something valuable and inspirational every now and then!

I thought of the MotherSoul concept while folding laundry a few years ago and wondering how "it" was all going to get done (procuring, cleaning, cooking, picking-up, studying, giving, teaching, exercising, loving, decompressing, etc.) with bells on.  I was actually frightened of failing at all this "stuff"...I breathed deeply, a few yoga breathes and the stress dissipated.  Afterward I focused on how truly lucky I was to have these issues.  I also realized that part of the reason for so much stress about these basics was that I felt I was squandering my efforts that might be bigger and better...Ahh, the plight of women in the modern world.  (In truth, it is ALL important!) After that turning point, I began to focus energy differently and dialed into a vitality I didn't know I had.  I found focus that encouraged venturing out of the routine.  Feeling lucky, I took the time to learn more about how I might help others along the way. MotherSoulProject emerged, and I felt an intense need not to squander my efforts to idle stress or unjustified discontent.

Burning Man Backstory - I need a Wonkavator...

In thinking of what to do this Autumn, I considered hiking with Peaks Foundation in Nepal to raise funds for Classroom in the Clouds.  Amongst charity races and donation drives, it felt like a big trip would be a wonderful accent to efforts my family made this year, but alas neither schedule not budget would yield to my desire for extended travel to Asia.  A number of other things came up but none seemed to jibe.  In conversation one day I asked a friend about Burning Man and whether or not she felt it was a transformative experience...whether it helped her or the human race in any way...she was convinced it did, if only for helping to push the envelope on ideas of love, art and self-reliance.

Interestingly, a few weeks later another friend offered me their 2012 ticket. (Well, actually he asked that I pay him for it, and I did.)  And once that check was written, it felt like I had won the golden ticket to Charlie's Chocolate Factory where I might find wisdom in unlikely, bedazzled places should I dare take the first step in...sign the contract and ride the Wonkavator, so to speak.  A massive 180 from the last days of summer in New England.

I've procured a camera, some basics for the event and the wavering permission of husband, kids, boss, friends... but need assistance with two big ticket items for the trip - airfare and rental car (or a Wonkavator.) My campaign request is for these two items.  I have the other costs (food, bicycle - to be cleaned and donated upon leaving Reno - water and lemonade to be shared with those on the playa, and gallery image preparation) covered! 

Who will benefit?

The promise is that images gathered will be hung at a gallery in CT for sale this Autumn with 50% of proceeds being offered to charity.  As mentioned, there are 2 organizations I have keen interest in - one is the Peaks Foundation (www.peaksfoundation.org) based in Africa - but helping women and girls in Africa, Asia and South America.  And the Global Watch Children's Home based in Tamil Nadu, India that pulls at my heartstrings:  (http://globalwatchfoundationchildrenshome.org/Welcome.html)  I visited Tiruvannamalai last year and walked hand in hand with a small group of beautiful children who I know will benefit from bicycles, clean water, education and health care - just as we all do.  The indelibility of small gestures, donations and a thread of love in their direction makes incredible difference.  At home, my daughter and I have agreed to make more frequent donations to the women's shelter as well.

To summarize my reasons for all of this...

My daughter SEES everything. I'd like to exemplify to her and her peers that helping others can be easy.

Thanks for considering this concept for MotherSoulProject.  I will send every donor a poetic postcard.  And will make wishes for all of us that we make the best of this whole ride.

 

 

If you would like to help, but have no funds perhaps you can think of a creative way to help someone else.  Seriously, it all begins with an intention. :)

story:
Putting heART into our ART

We are Cat on a Leash Creations, and we want to celebrate Valentines Day the only way we know how: By gathering artists from across the province into a historic building  to perform, create, and explore all that's weird, wonderful and unwanted about love.

The event is HeARTvark, and the goal is to gather community into one house so they may view love through the eyes of others (and enjoy a few drinks and some weird and wild art at the same time). We will be using the historic John Snow House in Calgary, AB to be home for a variety of artists for 3 nights in February. In each room there will be a different performance or installation that celebrates the ongoing mystery that is love and coupling. 

But we need your help to aid in this project!

Tell Them What They Get!

Like all wonderful public events, producing HeARTvark comes with operational costs. It is our aim to hand over our door sales to the many wonderful artists involved. Our artists are dedicated, passionate individuals who are bringing talent, experience, and what they can find in the back seat of their cars to this eclectic event. With your help, we can offer these important members of our community a bit of cash to pay for their time and talent.

The money raised will go to:

-Operational costs like publicity, liquor licence and supplies.

-Purchasing materials for the artists

-Rental, which goes to The New Gallery of Calgary who maintain the historic home, it's archives and the antique printing press.

And anything else to make this a Valentines experience you can not pass up.

We also have special packages for various amounts donated!

Your Impact

Whether it's $10, or $30, we are thankful for any funds that you can spare. As artists, we understand the value of a dollar which is why we would be so thankful for any contribution that can help HeARTvark really take off. 

By bringing all mediums of art together into one home, we hope to remind people of the feeling of community, creativity, and of course love. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

But hey, if you can't afford the cost, just spread the word! Tell your friends, family, lovers, acquaintences, and frenemies about HeARTvark. Don't hesitate to stop on by for the performances at 7:30 PM on February 14th-16th at the Historic John Snow House.

story:
Background:
SHIFT is formed by five students from The Design School at Arizona State University. To complete our required internship over the summer of 2012, we chose to venture outside of our familiar surroundings to gain new experiences while accomplishing our goals.

We're excited to share our stories, but we're even more excited to inspire and serve as resources to those who will soon be embarking on adventures of their own.

The Exhibition:
We're working hard to put together an exhibition that will help push students to recognize their full potential. On display will be a collection of posters designed by all five participants as well as a presentation of the work we completed at each of our internships, tied together with the idea that, with hard work and perseverance, anything is possible. We will be making a zine-style publication containing stories and photographs from our summer experiences, as well as detailing the full process behind putting on the show. This exhibition will be on display in The Design School during the first week of March, with a reception taking place on the evening of Friday, March 8th.

Risks & Challenges:
The only possible challenge we could foresee is delays in the production process. Most of the funds will go toward printing the necessary materials to display during the exhibition. We have numerous trustworthy local printers on hand, and will work with them to ensure our materials are ready.

story:
Summary

Next spring, take part in a unique art and film event at the Hollywood Theater in Dormont (Pittsburgh).  For our second event, bust out your shoulder pads, leg warmers, and acid-washed jeans as we are going back to the 1980′s!  We’ll once again be mashing up Pittsburgh-based artists and a cult classic film (this time, from the 80′s)… and we’ll be following up the evening with a month long display of the work at the Most Wanted Fine Art Gallery.

The movie will remain a secret, the art under wraps, but a ticket will gain you access to the film screening, a limited edition signed/numbered movie poster of the “secret” film, access to the work of local artists, raffle giveaways, free food/drink, and local entertainment.

Our featured artist, Matt Ryan Tobin, will be creating an officially licensed, 24x36" poster of the "secret" film being screened.

This event is set up to be not-for-profit.  All proceeds will be donated to Friends of the Hollywood Theater and the Toonseum.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to put on a successful event, we need to raise money for the following:
  • Theater rental and film licensing
  • Artist commission and printing costs
  • Food/drink
  • Insurance
  • Advertising

Your donations are instrumental in helping us put on this event and raise money for local businesses!  The film is rated R... 17 and over to join, 21 and over to drink!

Recognition levels:

  • $10 - Can't make the event? Consider a donation...
  • $15 - One (1) General Admission (GA) ticket to the event
  • $35 - One (1) GA ticket that includes a poster from our featured artist
  • $45 - Two (2) GA tickets to the event and one poster
  • $50 - Two (2) GA tickets to the event, one poster, and some bonus goodies!
  • $150 - Sponsorship, logo recognition on all of our social media platforms and official event flyer - includes 4 GA tickets.

Thanks to our sponsors: Flat Rock Brewing Company, Chemistry, House of the Dead Pittsburgh, Whole Foods Market, The Saloon of Mt. Lebanon, Print Tech, and Eat'n Park

story:
Surplus Space is currently crowd-sourcing funds using Indiegogo to create grants to offer to individuals interested in developing their own exhibition projects. 

Portland in the last several years has lost a number of alternative spaces including Appendix Project Space, Breeze Block, Half/Dozen, H. Klum, Golden Rule, ΜΕΣ(s)Α Project Space, Place, RECESS (now roving), Tractor, and Vestibule to name a few. As Portland becomes more and more gentrified, the availability of artist-run spaces has been greatly reduced. Focusing on resident-based exhibition projects is a way to respond to our city’s rapidly changing landscape. 

Your help is needed!

We're seeking $4700 to create five $900 grants to offer to new resident-based project spaces. All donations will go directly to help fund the Neighborhood Gallery Grant. The additional $200 is to cover the 4% Indiegogo fee.

A panel made up of current directors of alternative spaces will make the final decisions on who will receive a grant. 

Each grantee will receive:
$900
A how-to handbook for opening an exhibition space
25 hrs of the Surplus Space Team's labor
Any additional consultation, if desired, from the Surplus Space Team

Eligibility: 
Each project must exist in a lived-in environment.
Perks:
Ok, so our Perks are a little weird. Our goals is to simply redistribute your donations to create new exhibition projects we hope you'll find engaging and meaningful. Our Perks reflect the costs associated with creating an exhibition/project space and we feel the true benefits of your donation will be felt well beyond any individualized material gift we could offer. New spaces means new discourse, which is one the best perks we could ever imagine. 
We understand the economic strain of developing curatorial projects and want to demonstrate how to fully utilize the only asset some of us have, our living space. Utilizing one’s home is one of the most sustainable exhibition practices because there are not additional space based costs. Creating projects that do not accrue additional debt is vital for sustainability and it also demonstrates the endless possibilities when we decide to not defer to larger institutions to generate discourse. 

Applications close March 7th, 2015.

If you're interested in applying for a grant follow the link below:

Neighborhood Gallery Grant Application

A huge thank you to Ryan Woodring for creating such an incredible video!

__________________________________________________

Surplus Space is an alternative, artist run project space located inside a small Portland, Oregon home. Surplus Space offers interdisciplinary artists an opportunity to produce and show work that is in direct dialogue with current, unfolding issues of social, and political significance.

Surplus Space is a three part project. Part one is to create an active exhibition project utilizing multiple spaces within a home. Part two has two components. A.) Is creating a handbook based on a survey we sent out to current and former directors of alternative spaces on their process. B.) Is to crowd-source funds to create several new home-based spaces. Part three is a citywide juried exhibition partnering with multiple home-based project spaces in October of 2015, we're calling it The Home and Garden Show. 

Surplus Space is funded in part by The Andy Warhol Foundation of the Visual Arts and Calligram Foundation/Allie Furlotti via Portland Institute for Contemporary Art's Precipice Fund.

story:
Here is a link to our event opening:
https://www.facebook.com/events/816696758378311/
We hope to see everyone there! Thank you so much!



March 1st, 2015

Hello Everyone,

Bridget and I have been working non-stop in order to complete the gallery exhibition we have planned. The shooting has been wonderfully fantastic. Each time we go into the studio we walk out with stunning works. We are incredibly exited to give you the first look at what our series will look like. We realize it might have been a hard sell without anything to show so here they are. We have selected a few images to share that will give the best sense of the direction we are headed. The show will have a number of poster-sized prints adorning the walls of Room 202, the gallery space provided by the University of Central Florida.

We are going to make this; but only just. We currently have raised enough to cover the printing expenses and we are running out of time. We know that many of our friends are poor artists like the two of us so we only ask you to share our campaign. Please if you could either pass on a few dollars, for which you will receive a beautiful print from our series, or share this with someone who can. Bridget and I are relying on our fans. We need your help.

We only have a few days left. Don’t delay!

Thank you for the love of art,

And thank you to our fans.

-Bridget K. Hall

-John Paul Barratt








**we will be posting updates regularly. Check back often for up to date information** 
 Feb 1, 2015
Hello Everyone,

Is your Amazon Prime queue filled with the Walking Dead, Mad Max, 28 Days Later, 12 Monkeys, all four Terminators, and a backlist of similar sci-fi and thriller B-movies? Do you read every new dystopian young adult novel that hits the shelves? Do you have a zombie survival plan? Does it involve fashionable yet protective, multi-functional clothing?

Perfect! We have the crowdfunded campaign for you! This spring Bridget Hall, winner of the 2014 Departures Jurors’ Choice Award, and John Paul Barratt, a graduating UCF senior with over ten years of photography experience, are collaborating to create a gallery exhibition series portraying images of this caliber. The series will exhibit 10 or more large photographic prints that mix vintage fashion and pop art with a post-apocalyptic theme. Think Richard Avedon meets Mad Max.  We will capture the attitude and attire of a culture on the fringe after a global catastrophic event.


The images in this campaign are examples of our past work. To see a few examples of our work please look under the gallery tab.  You can expect the images in this show to supersede the quality of our prior work. This is a culmination of our skills and talent to create our best work ever. 

We have a beautiful space made available through UCF and we want to display artwork that is created by the help of others in our community. Together we will create a series of fine art images to be hung in Gallery 202. To photograph, print, hang and open a gallery we need money for things like


-Printing pager

-Frame and mount supplies

-Models

-Makeup

-Costumes

-Props

-Promotional Materials

-Catering for the opening



In order for us to accomplish our goals we need help from everyone. Remember, your donations are supporting two local artists who are creative, ambitious college students building their portfolios and credentials. We are offering a list of perks for the people who contribute. (If you don’t want any of our perks we will still gladly take your money.) If you don’t have any money you can still help! Share this with your friends, family, coworkers, the mailman, or anyone that will listen. The more people that know about us, the more likely we will be able to reach our goal in time. It is super easy to share; there are several buttons that let you automatically share our page to your Facebook and Twitter.  You can share multiple times! Don’t be shy, press that share button.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Catherine Page Harris and I teach Art & Ecology and Landscape Architecture at the University of New Mexico.  I was invited to create a project at the LandShape Land Art Symposium in North Jutland, Northern Denmark in June 2015.  I proposed Trans-species Repast - a project beginning at the Symposium,and continuing for 400 km riding bicycles and sharing meals with animals and people along the way.  I have been pulling funding for this project from every corner of the University and my family, but I still need help.

Your contributions to this project will not only fund this project, an embodied experience of sharing the planet with both human and non-human lives -- but will also generate connections for my students in the world of Land Art which they will explore for years to come.


What We Need & What You Get

Trans-species Repast Family Dinner needs funding for transportation and lodging in Northern Europe as we contact collaborators and collect bicycles.  We need funding for food, plane and train fare and publication of this project.

In total we need $6,423. With many frequent flier miles donated by my loving family and my own credit card from many years ago, we will fly all of us from Albuquerque to London. The majority of the airfare is from Albuquerque to New York City which is $1700 for the four of us. We will stay overnight in London, ($400), fly  from London to Geneva, and Geneva to Copenhagen, ($94) where we will stay for four days ($375) to buy second hand bicycles, figure out food, and tighten up our gear and buy local maritime grass plugs and seed. A Eurail pass for the four of us ($310) gets us to Hanstholm with our bicycles. We spend four days participating in the LandShape Symposium, with fees, lodging and food ($750). For two weeks from June 7-22, we will ride bicycles about 20 miles every day, from Hanstholm to Grenaa along the North Sea Trail, camp in different locations and share meals with the people and animals we meet at the Symposium, and some more we meet along the way. (camping fees $100, food $1000)  Where possible, we will build tables from sand on the beach and plant them with local dune grasses to encourage shoreline stabilization. (grass plugs $400) On June 23, we will leave from Grenaa on the east side of the North Jutland Peninsula and use our Eurrail pass to return to Copenhagen, where we will spend a night ($100) and then fly to Edinburgh.  At the beginning and end of this trip, I have created opportunities to meet with colleagues in Landscape Architecture, Art & Ecology and Art at the University of Art and Design in Geneva, and the Edinburgh College of Art.  Those expenses are not in this campaign as they should be funded by UNM. 

Everyone who reads this gets eternal gratitude and if you want you can read our blog. If you fund this project, you will receive postcards along our way, of the animals we meet and the foods we serve.  If you really fund us, we will send you audio and video clips along the way.  If you really really fund us, we will send you a cook book.  If you really really really fund us, we will make you a custom table and ship it to you. If you really really really really fund us, we will come make a dinner for you and your animals and leave a custom table.


If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still do this project.  The frequent flier miles tickets have already been purchased getting us to Europe.  We don't have the tickets to get to New York City, but you can make that possible!  We will start with those tickets and then move to the other pieces of travel that make the project possible.

    The Impact

    This project is about understanding how all biotic life can be "at the same table" in the face of difficult times for our planet and our cultures.  In more ways than ever we are linked across distances, across time.  This project seeks to build on that connection through the medium of the family dinner.  The dinner allows us to engage with the landscape as a common medium.  

    I believe in this project.  The experience of sharing meals with animals for me has been transforming. I really see the world differently when we are interacting at the same table. I enjoy finding out where their tastes and mine overlap.  My perception of time shifts and changes. We all recognize a different pace of life in the biotic forms around us.  I want to open this experience to many people.  The LandShape Symposium will be publishing this project along with the 10 winners of their competition and it is a wonderful opportunity to be recognized and have this work be visible.

    In creating bonds to other programs, this project will also benefit students of the University of New Mexico as I create more ties to cultures and experiences they can experience through trips and study abroad opportunities.

    Risks & Challenges

    There are some very real risks in this project. We could get stranded.  Someone could get hurt cycling. We could run out of money. I think we will rely on the kindness of strangers, as we all do, if any of these things happen.  We will keep our children and the children of others safe.  That is the most important promise I can make to you if you fund this project.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute money, we understand utterly.  We wouldn't be asking for money if we didn't need it.  If you could share this campaign, that would help immensely.  If just one more person sees this who might be touched to contribute that is so valuable.

story:
Hello Wind Charmers from Dunstable and around the world!

We need your help to keep this beautiful new tradition alive, created in Dunstable, and now in its third year.

Your donation, no matter how small, will help us to put the infrastructure in place to make this another magical community moment, create some props for people coming on the day, and buy materials for a flying sculpture to carry your wishes in to the Dunstable sky.

To spread the word, please share a video of yourself in the wind (real or artificial), and nominate 4 people to do the same. You can see some here.

Follow us on Facebook for more information and inspiration!

And see you on Sunday 30th August on the Dunstable Downs.


More information on the artist's website.

Huffington Post article about Dunstable Wind Charming Day.

Bedford Creative Arts article about Dunstable Wind Charming Day 2014.

story:
About the Exhibition

Surface to Structure: Folded Forms is an exhibition of origami artwork that will bring together the work of 88 artists from 17 countries.  It will include over 130 contemporary origami creations folded using a broad spectrum of styles and techniques.

Surface to Structure will take place at The Cooper Union, located at 41 Cooper Square, New York, NY, 10003. The exhibition will be free and open to the public from June 19 – July 4, 2014.

The Cooper Union was the site of the 1959 exhibition Plane Geometry and Fancy Figures: the first origami exhibition in the United States.  One of its primary contributors was Lillian Oppenheimer, founder of The Origami Center, which later evolved into OrigamiUSA.  The exhibition included the works of Akira Yoshizawa, Giuseppe Baggi, Ligia Montoya, Robert Harbin, Robert Neale, and other notable artists.

For the first time in 55 years, origami will be brought back to The Cooper Union in the Surface to Structure exhibition.  In addition to presenting a small number of pieces folded by the same artists in the 1959 exhibition, the folded forms on display will show origami’s transformation,  including sculptures that push the boundaries of this artform beyond its traditional perceptions.  The exhibition will feature the work of established artists as well as up and coming artists and communicate the range and complexity of origami styles.


Why We Need Your Help:

We will be receiving over 120 works of art, most of which are from artists overseas, and we need to cover the cost of round trip shipping for all of the artwork.  To protect the artwork against loss or damage, we will provide insurance for all the pieces.  Your donations will also enable us to hire technicians to aid in the installation process.  Funding will go toward the purchase and construction of pedestals, shelves, or frames to display the origami, as well as protective casing.  To ensure that there is proper security during this exhibition, we are hiring a security personnel to be present at all times the gallery is open.  Your donations will help cover printing costs for information labels about the artwork accompanying each piece, and signs with information about the different genres of origami showcased.  We are hiring a photographer to take pictures of every work exhibited in the gallery, and these photos will all be printed in the catalog to document the show. 


Perks for Donating

Note: All images are concepts only and do not necessarily depict the final product.

Happy Dance ($5):

Our love, appreciation, a virtual hug, and a shout out tweet.


Virtual Love ($10):

A full resolution wallpaper for your desktop, and a video with digital diagrams for how to fold the Rose Auditorium, designed by Uyen Nguyen.


Good Morning ($15):

A coffee mug printed with your pick from one of the four crease patterns below.


A Folded Year ($15):

One full-color 12-month calendar for the year 2015.  Each month will feature a high-resolution photo of origami artwork from Surface to Structure .

                                         



Surface to Structure T-shirt ($25):

A super-awesome origami-themed T-shirt, with your choice of one from three designs!


Exhibition Catalog ($30 - $35):

The official catalog of Surface to Structure: Folded Forms, with over 150 pages containing full-color, high-resolution photographs of every work from the exhibition and an essay written by Peter Engel.


Coffee Break ($40):

Full set of four coffee mugs, featuring each of the four available crease patterns.

Bundle of Joy ($50):

You get "Virtual Love" (desktop wallpaper and digital diagrams), a T-Shirt of your choice, and the exhibition catalog.


T-shirt Bundle ($60):

Surface to Structure T-shirts in all three designs!  Or you can mix and match!


Bundle of Awesome ($100):

"T-shirt Bundle," "Virtual Love," an exhibition catalog, one mug, and one 16 GB origami USB flash drive!


The Art of Paul Frasco ($200)

Artist Paul Frasco has donated two of his sculptures, Dragon Whelp and Timber Wolf, to offer as donation incentives.  Comes with a laser-engraved base with the crease pattern and one exhibition catalog.


OCD: Origami Collector's Dream ($225):

"Bundle of Awesome" but instead of one mug, you get the full set of four and the calendar.  The flash drive will also come with a digital version of the catalog.


Rose Auditorium ($250):

This origami model was designed by the curator, Uyen Nguyen and will be folded from Italian stardream paper. The finished model is 5" x 5" x 5" and comes with an acrylic base plate laser engraved with the crease pattern of the Rose Auditorium module. Your choice of 1, 3, or 6 different colors from the palette below. Autograph optional.



LED-lit Rose Auditorium ($300):

The Rose Auditorium will be wired with LEDs inside each of the roses to give it a soft glow.  The model will come with a battery pack for portability, but can also be plugged into a wall outlet for long-term use.  The finished model is 5" x 5" x 5" and comes with an acrylic base plate laser engraved with the crease pattern of the Rose Auditorium module.  Autograph optional.


The Art of Víctor Coeurjoly ($400)


Artist Víctor Coeurjoly from Spain has donated Embarazada, which will be displayed in the exhibition, to offer as a donation incentive.  Comes with one exhibition catalog.  Will not be delivered until the exhibition has closed.

             

(Photo: Christopher Bierlein)

Private Lesson ($400):

A 2-hour private lesson on how to fold the Rose Auditorium and light it up with LEDs.  Must be able to travel to NYC.  If you can't make it to NYC, we will ship you an LED-lit Rose Auditorium folded by Uyen, autograph optional.  We'll also send you a printed catalog and an origami USB with a digital version of the catalog and Rose Auditorium diagrams.


Personalized Origami ($750):

Custom one-of-a-kind origami Spikes model folded by Uyen Nguyen, with a laser engraved personal message of your choice, such as "Surface to Structure: thanks <your name> for support."  Due to the nature of the Spikes design, each will turn out differently.  You will be contacted privately to discuss details.  Autograph optional.



Origami Quilt 1: Sokki Bloom ($2500):

Sokki Bloom is an original artwork designed and folded by Uyen Nguyen.  This wall hanging measures 33" x 15.5" and can be mounted on the wall with no frame.


Origami Quilt 2: Resistant Prism ($3000):

Resistant Prism is an original artwork designed and folded by Uyen Nguyen, based on the Rose Auditorium.  This wall hanging measures 31.25" x 31.25" and is mounted in a frame for display.


Stretch Goals!

If we break $35,000, Uyen Nguyen will create diagrams of her Azulet design and assembly instructions.  Every contributor will be sent these diagrams in .pdf format for free!

                                       



If we break $40,000, Uyen Nguyen will create diagrams of her Sokki Module design, and assembly instructions for its different configurations.  Every contributor will be sent these diagrams in .pdf format for free!  

                                      


The extra funding will go towards a higher quality production of the catalog.

Any additional funding raised will go towards future exhibitions and other origami outreach endeavors.


Please spread the word about this project to help us get as many contributors as possible. You can Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.

Visit our website, surfacetostructure.com, to learn more.


Photographs of artwork are by their respective artists.

Origami Quilt 1: Sokki Bloom ($2500):
Sokki Bloom is an original artwork designed and folded by Uyen Nguyen.  This wall hanging measures 33" x 15.5" and can be mounted on the wall with no frame.







Origami Quilt 2: Resistant Prism ($3000):
Resistant Prism is an original artwork designed and folded by Uyen Nguyen, based on the Rose Auditorium.  This wall hanging measures 31.25" x 31.25" and is mounted in a frame for display.






Stretch Goals!
If we break $35,000, Uyen Nguyen will create diagrams of her Azulet design and assembly instructions.  Every contributor will be sent these diagrams in .pdf format for free!

                                       


If we break $40,000, Uyen Nguyen will create diagrams of her Sokki Module design, and assembly instructions for its different configurations.  Every contributor will be sent these diagrams in .pdf format for free!  

                                      

The extra funding will go towards a higher quality production of the catalog.Any additional funding raised will go towards future exhibitions and other origami outreach endeavors.
Please spread the word about this project to help us get as many contributors as possible. You can Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.
Visit our website, surfacetostructure.com, to learn more.

Photographs of artwork are by their respective artists.

story:
My photography business has been really gaining traction the last few months.

So much so, in fact, that I've ran my computer into the ground. I have been dealing with the dreaded Blue Screen of Death for the better part of a month now, and every day my computer becomes a little more sluggish and unresponsive. It's getting to the point where an hour's worth of work will sometimes take me three or four hours. I can't edit videos. I can barely load my program to try.

This is a huge problem because it's almost impossible to keep up with my work. This has come at one of the absolute worst times possible (isn't that how it always goes?), and I can't even begin to fix the problem myself because I need my computer to get work done.

I am only going to do a 30 day campaign because I'm convinced that's about as long as this computer is going to last. I appreciate any kind of help you can muster, and thanks if you've even taken the time to read this diatribe.

Love,

-Cody

story:
THIS GOT TO BE BANNED.

UPDATE 13.11.2014:

AUFGRUND DER BISHER SCHON ERZIELTEN SUMME VON 1410 EURO, HABEN WIR NUN DIE MÖGLICHKEIT AUF EINE HÖHERE AUFLAGE IM OFF-SET DRUCK HINZUARBEITEN. EURE WEITERE UNTERSTÜTZUNG WIRD ALSO EINE HÖHERE AUFLAGE ERMÖGLICHEN! WIR BEDANKEN UNS JETZT SCHON SEHR BEI DEN GROßARTIGEN MENSCHEN, DIE SICH HIER MIT UNS ENGAGIEREN, TEILEN UND GESPANNT SIND! 

____


Für den Druck eines Künstlerbuches/Kataloges des Malers, Maurycy Lozinski suchen wir Unterstützung.

In Zusammenarbeit mit der Initiative, Polnisch Deutsche Freundschaft (PDF) sollen 50 Exemplare des Buches/Kataloges entstehen und als greifbare Alternative zum Kunstwerk auf Leinwand geschaffen werden.

Ob als Sammlerstück im Schrank oder Einzelseite an der Wand, dass gewählte Format des Zeitungsdrucks in der Größe 32,5 cm x 52 cm bietet eine hochwertige Kunstsammlung im kompakten Format.




What you give & what you get.

Der Künstler hat sich bewusst für die Finanzierung, Erscheinungsform und die dadurch resultierende nähe zum Betrachter entschieden. Durch das Zeitungsformat und die lose Bindung der Einzelseiten überlässt Maurycy seine Kunst dem Zufall. Eine Zeitung kann von Vorne nach Hinten oder von Hinten nach Vorne, aus der Mitte zum Ende und vom Ende zum Anfang betrachtet werden. Es bleibt so jedem Einzelnen überlassen, wie er seine Sammlung sehen möchte.

Die Druckkosten der ersten 50 Exemplare belaufen sich auf einen Gesamtbetrag von 600 Euro. Weitere Produktionskosten wie Editorial, Layout, Probedruck belaufen sich auf einen Betrag von etwa 300 Euro. Ein Gesamtbetrag von 900 Euro ist für diese Kampagne zu erreichen.


Als Anreiz vergibt der Künstler seltene Skizzen, Zeichnungen und Malereien.



 about..Maurycy Lozinski.

Maurycy wurde am 27. Juni 1980 in Jelenia Gora/Polen geboren. Im Alter von 9 Jahren emigrierte er nach Wuppertal/Deutschland wo er noch heute lebt und als freischaffender Künstler tätig ist. Bewegt von einem Zeitungsartikel über Max Ernst und fasziniert von der Abbildung des Hausengels, besucht Maurycy 2002 ein Düsseldorfer Museum um oben genanntes Gemälde im Original zu sehen. Manisch und ungehemmt beginnt er zu malen. Die darauffolgende unaufhaltsame Entwicklung und Vielfalt seiner expressionistischen Werke, verdankt der Autodidakt ab 2004 auch zu einem großen Teil seinem Atelierkollegen, dem Musiker und Typografen Hans Reichel. Es entsteht nicht nur eine tiefe Freundschaft, sie manifestieren gemeinsam ihr bedingungsloses Vertrauen mit der für Maurycy bisher wichtigsten Ausstellung in der Stadtsparkasse Wuppertal unter dem Titel „Hans Reichel ft. Maurycy“.



What if..?

Für den Künstler und die Polnisch-Deutsche Freundschaft steht das Ziel im Vordergrund, herausragende künstlerische Arbeit zu präsentieren. Risiken gibt es keine. Die Finanzierung des Projektes durch die Initiative "PDF - Polnisch-Deutsche Freundschaft", unterliegt einer völligen Transparenz und keinerelei gewinnorientierter Handlung. 

Der erzielte Betrag wird ausschließlich für Produktionskosten aufgewandt und dient dazu, den Künstler Maurycy in einer neuen Erscheinungsform zu präsentieren. Sollte der Betrag erreicht werden, steht einer Veröffentlichung des Kataloges zum 06. Dezember kaum noch etwas im Wege.

Die Erstausgabe würde im Rahmen der Veranstaltung "Polnisch-Deutscher Freundschaftsabend", am 06. Dezember 2014 erscheinen.

https://www.facebook.com/events/302932629890132/

PDF | 06.12 | 19 Uhr | Sophienstr.4 | Wuppertal

Arbeiten von Maurycy Lozinski sind auf folgenden Seiten einsehbar:


https://www.facebook.com/maurycy.lozinski

oder


www.maurycy.de


Helfen Sie uns diesen außergewöhnlichen Künstler in Serie zu bannen und die Interpretation seiner Werke aus dem Ausstellungskontext und Internet in die Hände eines jeden Interessierten zu bringen.

story:
Our Story

My name is Greta Bach and I am an MFA student in Chicago.  This project is the final project for one of my classes.  Below is the artist statement for the project:

 

I use art to investigate, educate, and inform.  Life is about connections, person to person and thought to thought. It is an unending web, a puzzle to untangle.  While my interests and art travel divergent paths that fork, twist, and turn, they do converge again a little later in the journey.  The thread that ties my areas of interest together is investigation.  After scrutinizing something to my satisfaction I then use my knowledge to inform, edify, or engage the viewer. 

 

I use my work to explore connections, convolutions of thought, and private things made public. The human mind is expansive and fascinating. I explore the cracks, crannies, and cobwebbed corners and I try to find ways to connect with and bring viewers into these spaces between thoughts.  The essential purpose of many of my projects is to give the subject as well as viewers a “peek inside one’s head” and perhaps create some self-awareness. 

 

I have been intensely fascinated by psychology and the workings of the human mind as well as its connection to brain structure and chemistry for years.  Recently I have become interested in divination and chance operations.  This proposed project will tie my interest in psychology to my interest in divination/chance operations. 

 

It is currently untitled, but the premise is a divination set based on an ancient Taiwanese method of fortunetelling and the Myers Briggs archetypes.  Each set will be letterpress printed using photo-polymer plates, and will contain 15 “sticks” with symbols which correspond to a haiku in the accompanying book.  The sets will also contain instructions for use, and three cowry shells.  These will be placed in handmade boxes featuring the wax seal of the artist on the cover. 

 

There are sixteen Myers Briggs archetypes and I have written a haiku for the top fifteen traits of each type.  Each of the 240 haikus is unique, so those archetypes with overlapping traits have individual haikus.  The tailoring of the “answers” (or haikus) to each personality archetype puts the response of the “forces that be” into language that the querent can easily understand.  They also draw attention to personality traits that may help or hinder the querent in the situation in question.  Again, creating self-awareness and offering another perspective for the viewer or participant.

 

The larger project will be the 16 divination sets, one for each archetype (though there will be multiples of each type).  The smaller “giveaways” portion of the project will be small pamphlets with seven or eight haikus from each archetype—a “sampling” for each archetype. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Component Cost Quantity needed Total  
Films for photopolymer process $5.00 18 $90.00  
A3 sized photopolymer plates $18.17 18 $327.06  
shipping and handling for plates and adhesive $20.00 1 $20.00  
plate adhesive $2.00 18 $36.00  
paper $5.00 25 $125.00  
      $598.06  
         
         

 

This is the budget for "speaking in tongues".  I need help paying for the supplies to do this project.  The goal is $600.  If i do not meet this goal, I will beg, borrow, and/or steal the remainder.  However, by doing things this way, I am opening it up for others to get involved.  So, get involved!  There are fantastic perks for doing so, including:

 

$10--A handwritten letter of gratitude with a myers briggs haiku (you can specify the archetype if you wish)

 

$20--A "Casting Lots" divination set.  Based on a hoodoo divination ritual this set includes 4 shells, letterpress printed instructions, and a pressure printed image

 

$100--A "Speaking in Tongues" haiku pamphlet.  It will include 8 letterpress printed haikus handbound in a pamphlet (you can specify the archetype for this as well!)

 

$200--A "speaking in tongues" set.  The finished piece!  Specify your archetype and you will receive 3 cowry shells, 15 "sticks", a handbound book of haikus, and instructions (all of which will be letterpress printed) in a handmade box with the wax seal of the artist on the lid.

 


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, or family, or colleagues, or even people you dont like very much!  Tell anyone who would be interested in a project like this.  Words have power, use yours!

story:
The Artist Emerges: A 90 Day Journey To Higher Creativity and Healing.

Hello my name is Correna Carleen Smith and I am so excited to present to you my project The Artist Emerges: A 90 Day Journey To Higher Creativity and Healing.  I believe that people can heal through art.  This has certainly been true for me in my life.  Let me tell you a little bit about how this project was created.  About two and a half years ago I was having a difficult time dealing with the pain of my abusive childhood.  A friend gave me the number of a counselor.  At my first appointment with this counselor she put a can of crayons in my hand and said "put color to your emotions."  I wasn't really sure what that meant, however I began to color.  The emotional release that I experienced from that was amazing to me.  I went and bought a set of paints the next day.  At that time in my life I had never painted and knew nothing about it, except that It made me feel good when I would do it.  As time went on I began to heal through painting and art.  I began to work with an amazing artist and teacher named Elizabeth Preston and through painting and creative journaling I began to heal and I found what I believe is my life's purpose. To help others heal through art. Essentially art therapy.   The Artist Emerges is a 90 day journey in which I will use the tools and teachings laid out in the Artist's Way book by Julia Cameron, to discover and recover my creative self fully.  Each week I will commit to daily morning pages, to weekly reading, a weekly artist date, and completing weekly tasks.  I will also paint one original painting to represent the breakthroughs, insights, healing, or spiritual growth that occurs through this process, as well as one painting at the completion of the 90 day's to represent the entire journey.  Once this journey is complete I will have thirteen original paintings that I will use to hold my first solo art show called "The Artist Emerges."  With the proceeds from that show I will enroll in school to get my degree in Art Therapy and begin helping the world heal and grow through art.


What is needed to make this dream a reality?

To be able to make this dream a reality I need commitment, a lot of determination, a little faith, belief in myself, support from you, and $6,500.00 in contributions.

While I have some of the art supplies needed I do not have nearly enough.  Your contributions will pay for the canvases, paint, brushes, Gesso, gas to and from artist dates, studio rent, the cost and distribution of the perks my partners will receive, as well as the expenses for the show itself.  If I raise more than my goal I will donate 20% of the excess to another project on this site with the rest going to my education expenses to become an art therapist. 


How will your contributions impact me and the world?

Your contributions will directly impact the course of my life.  It will allow me the time necessary to do the Artist's Way program, time to create the paintings, and time to take the steps to get back into school.  I am only 30 credits away from my AA in psychology, so I am part of the way there all ready.  At the end of this journey I will be starting a "Creative Cluster" in my home town of Mt. Baldy Ca, where I can share my experience with other artists and support them in reaching higher creativity and healing in their own lives.  I also create an after school art program for kids so that one day a week they will have a creative outlet for their emotions.  Through painting and creative journaling I have gone from "an abused child" to now being a survivor of child abuse and an advocate for other abused children.  It is my mission to heal the world through art and this is the first step in that mission.


How much time do we have to raise money?

I would like to start the 90 day journey on July 1st 2014.  I will be sending out weekly updates to all of my partners so you can watch the dream become a reality.  At the end of the 90 days I will hold "The Artist Emerges" art show in the month of October.  I have created some amazing perks to say thank you for your support.  I will be creating and sending them out in the month of november no later than november 30th.  That means that time is of the essence.  We have 25 days to reach our goal.  That is not a lot of time, however with your support in getting the word out I believe that we can make it happen.  


There are several ways you can help.

This project is a life changing project and a huge undertaking and to be honest with you I am a little scared, but Julia Cameron says "leap and the net will appear."  I am trusting that is true.  There a several ways that you can partner with me to make this dream a reality. 

  • The first way is by making a financial contribution through this site. 
  • The second way is to send this link to your friends and family and share it on your social networking sites. You can use the links provided through this site.
  • The third way is to actively talk to everyone you know about "The Artist Emerges" project and ask them to partner with us.  Talk to your church, social groups, employers, basically anyone that would like to make a difference in the world or would like to pay it forward. 
  •  The Fourth way is to send me your prayers, good vibes, sweet thoughts, and send words of encouragement.

I would like to thank all of you for taking the time to look at my project and for your continued love and support.  I have never been as inspired and passionate about a project as I am about this one.  I believe that with your support I am going to be able to make a positive impact in the world.  Thank you.

Lovingly,
Correna Carleen Smith

Baldy Ca, where I can share my experience with other artists and support them in reaching higher creativity and healing in their own lives.  I also create an after school art program for kids so that one day a week they will have a creative outlet for their emotions.  Through painting and creative journaling I have gone from "an abused child" to now being a survivor of child abuse and an advocate for other abused children.  It is my mission to heal the world through art and this is the first step in that mission.How much time do we have to raise money?I would like to start the 90 day journey on July 1st 2014.  I will be sending out weekly updates to all of my partners so you can watch the dream become a reality.  At the end of the 90 days I will hold "The Artist Emerges" art show in the month of October.  I have created some amazing perks to say thank you for your support.  I will be creating and sending them out in the month of november no later than november 30th.  That means that time is of the essence.  We have 25 days to reach our goal.  That is not a lot of time, however with your support in getting the word out I believe that we can make it happen.  There are several ways you can help.This project is a life changing project and a huge undertaking and to be honest with you I am a little scared, but Julia Cameron says "leap and the net will appear."  I am trusting that is true.  There a several ways that you can partner with me to make this dream a reality. 


The first way is by making a financial contribution through this site. 


The second way is to send this link to your friends and family and share it on your social networking sites. You can use the links provided through this site.


The third way is to actively talk to everyone you know about "The Artist Emerges" project and ask them to partner with us.  Talk to your church, social groups, employers, basically anyone that would like to make a difference in the world or would like to pay it forward. 

 The Fourth way is to send me your prayers, good vibes, sweet thoughts, and send words of encouragement.


I would like to thank all of you for taking the time to look at my project and for your continued love and support.  I have never been as inspired and passionate about a project as I am about this one.  I believe that with your support I am going to be able to make a positive impact in the world.  Thank you.


Lovingly,Correna Carleen Smith

story:
Top spoken word poets battled with piercing literary devices to win their place on the 2014 UrbSLAM touring team at UrbSLAM Final Stage held at Legacy Books and Café. Chris Ware took the top prize as UrbSLAM champion, beating out five other contestants for the distinction. The team will tour Greenville, South Carolina; Houston, Texas; and Oakland, California this summer, which marks St. Louis’s return to national competition since 2009. 

Check out a recent interview with the team.

SUPPORT THE TEAM'S NATIONAL COMPETITION EXPENSES BY DONATING & SHARING THE LINK TODAY. 

Additional Plans
Several students from high schools and youth organizations will experience the 2014 UrbSLAM team in mid-May. UrbSLAM slammaster MK Stallings plans to visit the schools of recent VerbQuake Youth Poetry Slam Champions Gateway STEM and K-Word of Kirkwood High School among other schools. High schools can sign up for the May or fall tour by visiting UrbArts.org.

UrbSLAM completed its third season of competition with 8 slams held at Legacy Books and Café. UrbSLAM is sponsored and administered by UrbArts, a 501 (c) (3) nonprofit organization founded in Missouri and located in St. Louis City whose mission is to create platforms and platform creatives for youth development and betterment of community. UrbSLAM’s goal is to cultivate and promote spoken word poetry in the region through competition, workshops, and touring. 

UrbSLAM is the only Poetry Slam, Inc certified venue in the city, which provides poets local poets with an opportunity to perform at National Poetry Slam, Individual World Poetry Slam, and Women of the World Poetry Slam. MK Stallings serves as the slammaster and coach for UrbSLAM. The 4th season of UrbSLAM will begin on the last Saturday of August, the 26th, in its new Crown Square location in the Old North St. Louis neighborhood. Saturday Night Slam will open its doors a 7:00 pm with a music spin from DJ Fred aka Smoooth. The competition will begin at 8:00. MK Stallings hosts. The audience judges. An award of $50 will be given to the top poet. For more information, visit UrbArts.org.

Get to Know the Team: 

James “JayLuvve” Watford is 25 years old and a St. Louisan since birth.. This is his 3rd year as a member of the UrbSlam team and was the UrbSLAM champ in 2012. JayLuvve has been writing for 9 years and performing for 4 years. He also serves as an instructor/coach for Verbquake Youth Poetry Slam, an UrbArts program.

Salena “Poeticslang” Burch was born and raised in St. Louis MO. Involved in the community, Slang uses her talents as a writer of poetry, music, plays and prose for youth programs and engagement. She does not enjoy long walks on the beach but give her three minutes on stage, and she’ll show you who she is.

Chris Ware is a powerhouse of a performer who was born and raised in the city of St. Louis, Mo. At age 20, Chris Ware joined the United States Marine Corps and served 4 years on active duty before being honorably discharged in March of 2010. Upon his return to St. Louis, he taught himself how to play guitar and hopes to inspire those who feel out of place or awkward to accept and love themselves and be comfortable in their own skin.

Freeman Word is a 2013 graduate of Washington University in St. Louis. Freeman earned a B.A. in Philosophy with a minor of Psychology. He works with the 7th Grade Poetry Foundation as Program Coordinator and IT Advisor, is a CDJO at the Family Court of St. Louis County and was a proud 2014 instructor of VerbQuake. During his time at Washington University, he was the 2012 WU-Slam Grand Slam Champion, the recipient of the 2012 Langston Hughes award for artistic accomplishment in the black community and the 2012 Helen Davis Humanitarian award for his work with disadvantaged high school students in St. Louis. 

DONATE & SPREAD THE WORD TODAY.
