Curators: Amelie von Harrach & Arturo Galansino (V&A, Royal Academy of Arts, National Gallery, Science Museum, British Museum)
Designer: Nova Collective (London Olympic Games, BBC, Disney Media, Ferrari, Shell)
Light Designer: Jonny Milmer Light Design (Land Rover, Canon, Battersea Power Station, Ford, BT Tower)
Video Producers: Stoke&Dagger (Barclays, Red Bull, Yahoo, Virgin Atlantic, National Geographic) 
Marketing & PR: TBurnsArts (Poetry Society, Blain Southern, Possitive View Foundation)

as well as art consultants, financial consultants, architects, marketing specialists, blog contributors and fundraising manager.
LONDON AS A HUMAN BODY:Brief of 'Infinite London' for the Artists:London is like a human body and I am one of its organs. We can’t live without each other, we can’t live separately. Humans are like little blood cells traveling through the artificial veins and arteries that are the streets and underground tunnels keeping the city alive and growing. I want to express my feelings and emotions towards this relationship through artwork. I act as the pulse of creativity that keeps the culture system flowing. I need to emphasise my importance in our coexistence.As artists living in London, we are all in one way or another influenced by the city. It shapes our behaviour, our way of thinking, our everyday existence. It thus has an impact on the works of art we produce, whether the imagery and content are directly related to it or not. We are a part of London, and London is intrinsically connected to ourselves and our creative output.
There will be a selection of the best artworks depicting the emotions and inner feelings inspired by being part of London. LoVArts will encourage artists to ‘bare all’ in their artistic entries; we want refined but vibrant entries to be representative of the artists’ particular London experience, and how they wish to ‘give back’ creatively to the city’s atmosphere and life. 
A professional panel of curators (with cumulative experience across some of London’s most prestigious institutes, including V&A, the British Museum, the Science Museum and the Royal Academy of Arts) will choose the best artworks. 
FUTURE OF 'INFINITE LONDON''Infinite London' is planed to be the annual art event that takes place in London every October. We are also aiming at presenting the show abroad, including Dubai and New York. Each time the exhibition will be different, however, it will always expose artworks of the London based artists only. You can help us to make 'Infinite London' an event of the year!ABOUT LOVARTS LoVArts - London Visual Arts is a non-profit organisation that functions as a promotional and networking platform for emerging visual artists based in London. 
We want to impact positively on the careers and aspirations of emerging artists through: regular networking meetings, seminars and promotional events curated by professionals. 
In terms of our public presence, we operate as a promotional and networking platform specifically designed to support emerging artists by promoting events that can help further their careers and aspirations. Through our regular networking meetings and seminars, every visual artist will have the right to voice their opinion and share their work in a friendly environment and will also have the opportunity to apply for our exhibitions, organised and curated by a team of professionals from the London art scene. Its purpose is simple, we hope to build a bridge between established artists represented by agents and galleries, and emerging artists by providing them with an alternative channel to show their work. Promotion through LoVArts will expose these artists to public feedback on a scale that they would otherwise not have access to.
The platform not only achieves exposure for the artists on the highest possible professional level but also serves as an introductory network so that reaching their target audience is facilitated. In essence, we discover ‘unknown artists’ and present them to the world in a format that will be recognisable to buyers, collectors and the wider art-savvy public. We firmly believe that the events that artists need are those which provide a channel to obtain commissions and sales.More info: www.lovarts.co.uk WHAT WE NEED Our primary goal has been to raise 160 000 GBP. We already managed to raise 40 000 GBP in support in kind and we are looking to raise the rest of the funds through a few channels, including: crowdfunding, applying for art grants as well as private and corporate sponsorship.We need your help to raise 40 000 GBP through IndieGoGo; your support will enable Infinite London to:- Pay for the space at The Vault - We have yet to pay our deposit! We have  received amazing support from the Director of The Vaults, who loves the 'Infinite London' project. They have booked the venue for us, but we need to pay the venue fee as soon as possible. - Lighting - Our team includes a great Light Designer who will make 'Infinite London' even more spectacular. He has helped us to receive a 40% discount for all the lighting equipment rental! We need your help to raise funds for the equipment rental and installation.Any funds raised in excess of 40,000 GBP (which would be fantastic!), will be allocated towards: 
Marketing
PR
Promotional Materials (posters, invitations, catalogues, badges) 
Sound - Yes, 'Infinite London' is the exhibition for visual artists, however, you will absorb the exhibition through all of your senses. To include sound, to stimulate all of your emotions, we need to rent sound equipment.

'Infinite London' coffee book - Yes, we want to print a high quality book containing all the artwork in the exhibition
Transport & Packaging
Professional fees (accountants, lawyer)

Admin fees (insurance, registrations, portal hire)
Catering
Staff Costs - Although right now almost all of us work voluntarily, we still need to pay some people who will help us in tasks that we cannot take on
Other unexpected costs
WHAT YOU GETWe truly believe that your positive energy will come back to you, and we offer  every donator good karma :)
We also offer various goodies as moments of 'Infinite London' Most importantly, however, we offer two tickets to 'Infinite London' for everyone who supports us with at least 10 GBP! We would love to see all of our donators at the show in October! You are one of us!THE IMPACTWe believe that 'Infinite London' will be a turning point in the artists' career. We have been working on this project since July 2013 and we feel that we are ready to give emerging artists significant exposure to the London art scene. It is also very important to remember that participation in 'Infinite London' has very low costs for artists. We want to make sure that we present the best artists, not only those who can afford to exhibit in the centre of London; this will all be  thanks to you!  SPREAD THE WORD!If you can't support us financially, don't worry! We would love you to spread the word about 'Infinite London'. Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any questions. We will answer them all as soon as we can. The more people who know about our campaign, the more successful it will be. We need your support in any and all forms. Here are few ways you can help 'Infinite London':
Click that "Share" button and post our campaign to your social media pages!
Send our campaign page to your friends using the email link!
Have a blog? Please consider mentioning us in a post!
Tweet about us! 
If you love this project, you can also support us in kind (helping with thousands of tasks we have to take on). If you would like to get involved give us a shout on info@lovarts.co.uk. Thank you!!!We are looking forward to seeing you at 'Infinite London' in October!#InfiniteLondonDiscover. Be Discovered.

story:
Short Summary

SHOUT! is a program presented by Naked Mind Theatre Group (soon to be Naked Mind) devoted to helping children and teens emotionally heal through performance art. 

We lend our time and resources to non-profit (501c3's) organizations dedicated to helping children i.e. The Mourning Star Center, YMCA, etc. and set up a week long program, with a volunteer to child ratio of 2:1, for kids and teens to come in during the day and talk about what it is they are going through, and by the end of the week the children put on an original play written and performed by them in a local theater.
The first ever SHOUT! program will be held at The Mourning Star Center in Palm Desert, California from June 22nd - June 28th 2014.

What We Need 

In order to make SHOUT! a reality, we need your help! Your donations will fund:

  • Housing and Transportation for Volunteers
  • Lunch for the Children and Volunteers during working hours
  • Costumes and Props
  • A Performance Space
  • A Donation to The Mourning Star Center for their Time and Resources

The Impact

Theatre changes lives. When a child experiences a devastating loss, the theatre has the power to help them put themselves back together again. With your help, we will provide an outlet for children and teens to express themselves through performance art, helping them heal in a safe, fun, artistic way. 
Your donations will ensure the success of the SHOUT! program now and in the future, where we hope to bring SHOUT! to various non-profit organizations on a yearly basis, enriching the lives of children, their families, and the communities where they live. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the Word
  • Volunteer for SHOUT!
  • Volunteer for The Mourning Star Center
  • Like and Share on Social Media
On behalf of all of us at Naked Mind Theatre Group,
Thank you!

story:
About the Campaign

The mission of this campaign is to help financially disadvantaged graffiti artists begin careers as professional artists.  The funds raised through this campaign are going to purchase painting kits for ten artists in the New York City area. 

Many graffiti artists are extremely talented artists.  They have the ability to create a beautiful image, while conveying an important message.  They have the ability to create an intricate an detailed image, while working on what is essentially a building sized canvas.

These artists create their work without ever getting paid a dollar.  They create their works for the enjoyment of others, as well as personal reasons.  With the help of this campaign, my colleagues, and myself, would like to help take these artists off of the street and into the studio.  We'd like to teach these artists to hone some of their talent on a canvas with oil paints (or whichever medium they prefer), instead of on a building side with a spray can.  We'd also like to teach these artists some of the business skills required to sell and display their works, so that they can create art for a living.

My two colleagues, which are helping with the program, have many years of experience in "the art world".  One of my colleagues is a fine arts professor at a local university; the other manages a small art gallery.  While, I can't promise that any of the artists in this program will become wildly famous; I can promise that my colleagues, and myself, will provide the best teaching experience that we can for the participants.

Ideally, we'd like to find gifted artists that have a severe financial hardship, they'll be considered first and foremost, but all who demonstrate a talent and desire to become professional artists will be considered. 

Additional Notes:

As soon as this campaign ends: I will purchase the painting kits, start contacting the artists that applied, and get the program under way.  Ideally, I would like to get the kits to each artist by December 10, 2013, and start working with them shortly thereafter.

There are absolutely no costs to the artists of this program.  My colleagues, and myself, are not receiving any money for our time put into this program.

Also, the artists won't have to use their own supplies, for the campaign perk paintings.

About Me

My name is Troy Alex Stephens.  I live in New York City.  As a profession, I’m a freelance writer.  I write for a few small local publications.  As a hobby, I enjoy painting and sculpting. 

What We Need

The goal of this campaign is to raise $5000.  The funds raised will go towards purchasing a painting kit for ten artists that are participating in the program. 

Included in each kit will be:

·  Easel (portable) $125

·  Set of paints $175

·  Brushes $50

·  Canvas/Paper $100

·  Cleaning and other supplies $50

Total $500 / per kit

If more than $5000 is raised, we will add a participant for each additional $500 contributed.  Ideally though, We’d like to keep the program fairly small, in order to provide individualized attention for each artist.

What You Get / Perks

The Matisse Perk:

For a $10 contribution, you will receive a postcard of one of the artist's works, with a warm thank you. 

The Picasso Perk:

For a $25 contribution, you will receive a set of three A4 sized prints from the artists participating in the program.

The Basquiat Perk:

For a $100 contribution, you will receive a small original painting from one of the artists participating in the program.

The Monet Perk:

For a $250 contribution, you will receive an original painting from one of the artists participating in the program.

All contributors will also get listed on our Twitter and Facebook pages.

story:
About Me

I am a painter. The meaning of the term "painter" has changed for me through the years. It started as a way to escape from the world. It was an ear for listening, a shoulder for resting and a means to a beautiful beginning. Now, it is more than a passion, more than a hobby or time passer. Painting has grown to be my career path, my life. I find reason and meaning to life's popular ponders such as "why are we here" or "what is our purpose?" We as humans are here to dream, our purpose is to create. My name is Devin Laster and I am a painter.

"E=mc2 ;) " Acrylic on canvas 32" x 15"


"Edward" Acrylic on canvas 38" x 22"


Personal Attractions 2

Personal Attractions part 2 is a continuation of giving my thoughts, feelings and inside look on…me. I am able to visually display my personal feelings and ideas accurately through my craft, my passion. This show will feature over one hundred brand new works of art that ranges from actors to films, animals, clothing attire and even my own family members. I am reaching new heights, escalating to new grounds, experimenting heavily and touching new skies. My artistic abilities can only grow from expanding my mind and individual visions, this can only happen by getting the necessary financial assistance to make this the biggest, boldest and best show thus far. Thank you in advance for your consideration.

"The Beetle" Acrylic on canvas 40" x 24"

The visual interpretation of progression.

The picture below is a painting of Ray Charles that I did six years ago, it's one of the first ten paintings I created. The painting below that was done earlier this year and it stands as the 142nd painting I created. This is an example of not only what has occurred but what is to come. Your financial assistance will allow me to continue this journey, this path of creating and speaking through my passion; in the near future there will be a third picture that I will be comparing with others to exemplify my progress.

"Ray" Acrylic on canvas 24" x 20"


"Ray Plays" Acrylic on canvas 26" x 28"


Below is another visual interpretation of progression, the painting below is of Martin Luther King and Malcolm X that I did six years ago, it's one of the first ten paintings I created. The painting below that one was done one year ago and it's the 119th painting I created. 

"Martin & Malcolm" Acrylic on canvas 24" x 20"


"The King with an X" Acrylic on canvas 42" x 24"


"Mom" "Since the beginning of the craft a seemingly small but grand goal was to wow you. The moment was monumental when you looked at a painting for the PA1 show and was shocked." Acrylic on canvas 24" x 30"


"Fearless" Acrylic on canvas 32" x 30"


"Marilyn" Acrylic ink on paper 8" x 10"

"Iron" Acrylic on canvas 30" x 35"


"Marilyn2" Sharpie on paper 8" x 10"

"He" Acrylic on canvas 24" x 20"


Every Little Bit Helps

If you can't contribute financially you can still show your support by spreading the word about the campaign and using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank You So Much For Your Support!

story:
Delving In

Hello there, my name is Addison Duke. I currently work at Image Comics Inc. as a production artist doing book design and layout, but when I am not at my day job I am hard at work delving into the world of freelance genre illustration.

In the most recent months I have been gearing up for some larger personal projects that I am planning, along with a larger book with my good friend Andrew Miscisco. A large part of preparing for these projects has been all the preliminary work that occurs throughout my various sketchbooks. The goal of "Delve" is to compile all of my recent sketchbook work into one place to share with the world. Something that I can hand to someone and say "this is what I spend most my days doing".

The book itself will be a full color 40 page perfect bound softcover printed on #60 natural paper with a matte cover finish. Each page will be an artistically composed collection of all the various stages and directions of the creative process and will not only give you a window into my artistic process, but into the worlds that take shape throughout.


         

         

                             Some examples of my recent sketchbook work.


You Help Complete the Vision

To make "Delve"  reality I am asking for $2000. This amount covers the cost of printing and shipping the book as well as additional promotion.

To help reach this goal I have set up a variety of perk options:

$10 - Thank you! Your name will be printed in the "Thank You" section in the back of the book.

$20 - You will have your name printed in the "Thank You" section in the back of the book as well as receive a signed and numbered copy of the book.

$50 - You will have your name printed in the "Thank You" section in the back of the book as well as receive a signed and numbered copy of the book and an exclusive full color signed and numbered print of "The Architectural Prodigy of House Balducci" (see below) that will not be made available outside of this campaign.


                                   

                                  "Architectural Prodigy of House Balducci"


$75 - You will have your name printed in the "Thank You" section in the back of the book as well as receive a signed and numbered copy of the book with a custom sketch on the inside front cover, and the exclusive print. (10 available)

$100 - You will have your name printed in the "Thank You" section in the back of the book as well as receive a signed and numbered copy of the book. You will also receive an original character sketch done in the style seen throughout the book using you as the reference. (5 available)

$500 - You will have your name printed in the "Thank You" section in the back of the book as well as receive a signed and numbered copy of the book. You will also receive an original character sketch done in the style seen throughout the book using you as the reference and a single run print of a digital painting of that drawing. (3 available)

$1000 - You will have your name printed in the "Thank You" section in the back of the book as well as receive a signed and numbered copy of the book. You will also receive an original character sketch done in the style seen throughout the book using you as the reference and a full sized oil painting based on the drawing.              (1 available)


    Why do we Delve?

    Having worked for Image Comics for the past year and watching so many amazing creator owned project go out our doors, I finally wanted to take the skills I've fostered there and turn them towards my own visions. "Delve" is just a jumping off point and there will be many more projects to come borne from that initial leap.


      Risks & Challenges

      As soon as this campaign has launched I will start the long process of production on the book. This will consist of finalizing the pagination, composing the layouts of each page, logo design, and where necessary the creation of additional drawings to help balance out certain areas of the book.

      This will be quite the undertaking, but I feel it will be the ultimate test of everything I've learned so far.

      On the financial side of challenges, should we not reach our goal all money earned will go towards printing the necessary number of books to fulfill pledges as well as shipping of the various perks.


        Other Ways You Can Help

        I urge you share with your friends and help get the word out. Even if you can't afford to contribute a pledge, every bit of support helps!

        Oh, and be sure check back for updates as pages are completely and posted in the gallery section.

        Cheers! 

        -Addison Duke

Having worked for Image Comics for the past year and watching so many amazing creator owned project go out our doors, I finally wanted to take the skills I've fostered there and turn them towards my own visions. "Delve" is just a jumping off point and there will be many more projects to come borne from that initial leap.


  Risks & Challenges As soon as this campaign has launched I will start the long process of production on the book. This will consist of finalizing the pagination, composing the layouts of each page, logo design, and where necessary the creation of additional drawings to help balance out certain areas of the book.
This will be quite the undertaking, but I feel it will be the ultimate test of everything I've learned so far.
On the financial side of challenges, should we not reach our goal all money earned will go towards printing the necessary number of books to fulfill pledges as well as shipping of the various perks.


  Other Ways You Can Help I urge you share with your friends and help get the word out. Even if you can't afford to contribute a pledge, every bit of support helps!
Oh, and be sure check back for updates as pages are completely and posted in the gallery section.
Cheers! 
-Addison Duke

story:
We reached our first $20,000! Let's keep the momentum going all the way to $125,000. 

BEFORE SHOT 

AFTER - GRANVILLE ISLAND SIDE

AFTER - WATER SIDE 

CELEBRATING GREAT PUBLIC ART

We took the saying, “Go Big or Go Home” literally when we chose this project. Imagine a 360-degree, 70-foot (21 metre) tall outdoor mural that’s over 23,500 square feet (7,162 metres) in size. And it’s not just any mural.

This one is designed and created by OSGEMEOS, two uber-exciting Brazilian artists who happen to be identical twin brothers. OSGEMEOS, which literally means “the twins”, have taken the Contemporary art world by storm. This is their biggest project to date and their first in Canada. 

The mural will be painted on the six gigantic industrial Ocean Concrete silos on Vancouver’s Granville Island. The location attracts 10.5 million visitors a year from around the globe, so the mural is destined to become one of the most recognizable and iconic works of public art anywhere in the world. 


ARTIST STATEMENT

"Every city needs art and art has to be in the middle of the people"

“The first challenge of this project was to find a location that would fit with our idea. We did not want a conventional two-dimensional wall that we had done before - we wanted something different, special and unique. The Biennale has a strong connection with sculpture, so we decided to find a place where the painting can be transformed, creating a dialogue between the two-dimensional and three-dimensional worlds.  Another aim of this project is to bring new characters to Vancouver while sharing perspectives and cultures. The connection between water and land on Granville Island also had a lot to do with the choice of location - for us, the water acts as a vein, symbolizing life, and it is very present in our work.” - OSGEMEOS

ARTIST INTERVIEW - VISION FOR VANCOUVER 2013


"GREY CITY" MOVIE TRAILER

"1 of 15 top documentary films of the year" - Huffington Post

OUR "ASK"

Who says you have to be a gazillionaire to be a patron of the arts? 

Everyone is doing their bit to make this project possible, but we still have a little over $125,000 in hard costs to cover. Had it not been for the generosity of OSGEMEOS, Ocean Concrete and the curatorial, administrative and project management support from the Vancouver Biennale, this would have easily been a million dollar project. So we’re putting the “public” back into public art and asking the global community to help us. 

Our immediate goal is to raise $20,000 to help complete the project. Be part of the global team. Your $5, $10, $50 will get us there.  

WHO ARE WE?

The project is part of the Vancouver Biennale and personifies what our organization is all about, accessibility to great art where people live, work, play and transit. The “Be-en-ah-lay” is a registered Canadian non-profit charitable organization (Canada Revenue Agency #851954273RR0001), that exhibits museum-caliber contemporary art in public space, creating an Open Air Museum that is a catalyst for learning, community engagement and social action. 

The Vancouver Biennale has a proven track record delivering exhibitions of the highest artistic merit, in the most coveted locations. The Biennale features internationally renowned and emerging Contemporary artists that represent a diversity of cultural perspectives and artistic disciplines, including sculpture, new media, performance works and film. 

To date, 100 artists from 27 countries and 4 continents have participated in the Vancouver Biennale with 124 public art interventions. The Biennale has also facilitated the donation of $2.5 million dollars worth of public art to our host cities as a lasting legacy of our exhibitions, including the iconic A-maze-ing Laughter, which was the only work of public art nominated as one of the Greatest Places in Canada. 


DETAILED PROJECT BUDGET: CHECK OUT THE NUMBERS

  • This is a non-profit project for OSGEMEOS. 
  • Ocean Concrete has generously offered the silos at no charge and have given us considerable time, energy and expertise needed to turn an industrial site into a work of art.
  • The Vancouver Biennale is covering all curatorial costs, project management costs, promotional costs and administration costs throughout the 2-year process from curatorial vision through to the realization of the complete mural. The Biennale has also negotiated gifts-in-kind and deep discounts on most of the materials and labour required.
  • Hard costs for the project are:

             ·  Airfare (OSGEMEOS + 4 team members): $16,000
             ·  Hotel + small living stipend: $6,250
             ·  Paint and labour for prep work and base coat: $46,000 
             ·  1,400 cans of spray paint for detailed mural artwork: $21,000
             ·  Lift equipment rental: $17,000
             ·  “Plasticiens Volantis” inflatable parade: $20,000  
(Note: this is a 30-metre tall inflatable likeness of an OSGEMEOS  character that will be used for a Granville Island celebration event)

TOTAL Project Costs: $126,250

HOW YOU CAN HELP 

There are many ways to participate. Donate funds and receive one of our awesome Perks. Every dollar helps bring great art to public space.

It’s also a HUGE help if you spread the word globally among your friends, family, and co-workers by using Indiegogo’s (very neat) ‘Share Tools’. 

The more people who hear about our project, the more successful we'll be in reaching our goal. It’s as simple as that!

story:
Hi I'm KT Walsh, and I'm a painter, sculptor and community muralist living in Lawrence, Kansas.  I am currently working on a mural project with the kids at New York Elementary School in my neighborhood, which allows me to combine my three loves: East Lawrence, kids & murals!  

The East Lawrence neighborhood is where I have hung my hat now for 38 years, and my home is where I create my artwork.  In the last ten years I have worked on ten large community murals located here in Lawrence, Kansas and on the Great Mural Wall in Topeka, Kansas.  

Why a mural project, you might ask?  The usual picture of a solo artist working alone in her studio, in contrast to outdoor mural painting, are very different art methods. I want the kids to experience that contrast first-hand.  Painting outdoors stimulates all of the senses:  hearing the birds sing around you, feeling the warmth of the sun, seeing neighborhood people walking by. Sometimes passerby’s will even stop and give feedback, and that direct feedback I think the kids will enjoy. The mural images also tell a story to the whole community about what has happened in this area since 1869 when the school was first founded. And public outdoor murals bring joy and color that lightens the mood and makes people smile that wander by. 

Our mural team consists of two 4th grade classes and two 5th-grade classes led by their two art teachers, Mitch Pearson & Jacob Lewis, School Principal Nancy DeGarmo, and me.  In the past year, this mural project has already been fully integrated into their art class projects, with a walking tour of their neighborhood, historic research, drawings, and mural design prep work.  It has given them a sense of neighborhood belonging & ownership, and shown them they are an integral part of telling its story, even as it continues to unfold.  This Fall the final step of the project is when the kids actually paint the mural on a building that long-time neighborhood supporters John & Arch Naramore own across the street from the school.

Our mural project is almost halfway funded already from outside sources, and we have turned to Indiegogo to help with this fund-raising.  An Indiegogo contribution from you would help keep this project going!  Your Indiegogo contribution will give the kids a one of a kind experience they couldn’t get anywhere else: community building, working on a big project team, and creating awesome public art!  Please help us get the word out and share our campaign with your friends!

Budget: Grand Total of Mural project is around $8,000. So far we have received a $2500 grant from the Lawrence Schools Foundation and $400 from the Van Go / Color Run fund-raiser in October 2014, so we are almost half-way there. We are looking to raise the remainder of the funds from people like you through Indiegogo! If we surpass our fund-raising goal for this mural, NYE School Principal Nancy DeGarmo and I are already having discussions to add a large indoor mural for the school next year. So any extra funds will roll-over to the next mural.

Risks & Challenges: My past mural experience has taught me that poor weather will come and keep us from painting outdoors, and some kids will lose interest in the mural. That's why we have built in extra time and are working hard to keep all of the kids engaged in their art classes with the design process over the last year. Our neighborhood is under pressure from developers, so the building could potentially be purchased and torn down in the future. We are painting on cement board and attaching it to the outdoor wall, so that the mural can be moved if the building gets sold and demolished in the future.

Please help us get the word out and share our campaign with your friends!

story:
This campaign has been created in order to fund a "zine" dedicated to the 20 years Venue/Dominion/Back Door has been in business. They have been through some obvious tough times these past few years but have still managed to constantly contribute to the Richmond, VA skateboarding community throughout all of it. This is our chance to give back to them and create something special to show our appreciation. This "zine" will reflect on all those years of hard-work and talent that many people have contributed to through Venue/Dominion/Back Door with a collection of photos, interviews, board graphics and more all wrapped into this special zine. Any contribution helps greatly and will earn you a spot on the list of contributors featured in the zine. All money earned will go directly to the production costs.


- Will & Clem

story:
FOREST CITY GALLERY NEEDS A FACELIFT!

About FCG:

Forest City Gallery (FCG) is an artist-run centre that has been operating in London, Ontario for 41 years. FCG is a registered charity and is currently London’s only Artist-Run Centre.  We are devoted to exhibiting and promoting contemporary fine art, as well as dedicated to paying artists according the national payment standard (CARFAC). FCG actively pays approximately $20,000.00 per year to local artists for their exhibitions, artist talks, workshops, and projects. Every year FCG directly supports over 50 emerging artists across Canada, mainly in London, Ontario.  FCG also supports local musicians by paying approximately $3000 per year to bands for their performances at monthly music events. FCG hosts and co-hosts up to 40 events per year, reaching over 20,000 Londoners with the hopes of further strengthening our vibrant, growing arts community.

Goal:

FCG hopes to raise $1000 over the next two months to cover costs associated with much needed façade improvements to the gallery. Specifically, FCG hopes to use raised funds towards costs associated with a new street-level sign. Our current sign, now in a state of decay, only reads “FCG”. Using only our abbreviated name hinders new comers from coming into the gallery- we need our full name on our sign! This obstacle makes it difficult for us to fulfill our goal of creating a friendly, inclusive environment and welcoming new patrons into the gallery. The (new) sign, proudly displaying our full name, Forest City Gallery, will also display the font chosen by founder member Robert Fones in 1973 for FCG- 41 years of tradition! The cross-section, FCG's logo, also designed by Robert Fones, will also be proudly displayed on our window signage and A-frame.

This sign would be durable, as well as transportable in the chance that FCG may relocate in upcoming years. 

All of the money donated will be going towards rebuilding and improving FCG’s façade. No funny business - FCG really needs a new sign.

If we overshoot our goal - thank you! All donations beyond our goal will be put towards creating permanent, cement planters for the front of the gallery, again, to further improve and beautify London’s artist-run centre.

Thank you so much for donating or spreading the word about this initiative!


Thank you to our dear friend and FCG Member Clayton Windatt of North Bay's White Water Gallery for making our campaign video. Special appearance by local artist Steve deBruyn.

story:
Camino Tattoo & Fine Art merges the gap between tattoo and fine art, to provide high quality, specialized contemporary tattooing. Taking from the already rich art and culture of the Historic Mesquite Arts District, we provide space for local, national, and international artists to create fresh, contemporary work in a clean and safe environment. 

Your investment in Camino Tattoo & Fine Art will add to the legacy of the Historic Mesquite Arts District in Las Cruces. Camino Tattoo & Fine Art will provide a creative atmosphere with workshops  for writers, painters, and tattoo artists; as well as a gallery space to exhibit works.

Taking from the already rich art and culture of the Historic Mesquite Arts District, we provide space for local, national, and international artists to create fresh, contemporary work in a clean and safe environment. Your investment in Camino Tattoo & Fine Art will add to the legacy of the Historic Mesquite Arts District in Las Cruces. Camino Tattoo & Fine Art will provide a creative atmosphere with workshops  for writers, painters, and tattoo artists; as well as a gallery space to exhibit works.

story:
About me

Hi there! My name is Anna and i got two favorite things in my life: painting and surfing. I live in Bali close to the beach and I cant imagine my days with no waves. I decided to unite my hobbies and started to paint surfboards for my friends. So I got a dream now - to make the first exhibition of hand crafted boards at my beautiful island and show them around the world after.


Project of my dream

The conception of my idea is to make ten different prints dedicated to ten countries where you can find waves.




What we need and what you get

- 10 surfboards by one of the best australian shaper based in Bali

- markers and paints

- postcards

- framed posters

- iPhone 6 cases



More about my artworks here: https://ru.pinterest.com/annabronza/

story:
To view some of my work, please watch the video.


Summary

I am a visual artist working in the medium of landscape photography and sculpture. I have been invited to attend the Nes Artist Residency Program in Skagaströnd, Iceland. With your support, I will be able to create a new series of artistic work while impacting the international art scene.

Your Support Goes Towards

  • Residency fee
  • Flight to & from Iceland

The Impact

  • I will be expanding my horizons and creating new work
  • Sharing my artwork on an international level
  • Joining a larger conversation about contemporary photography & sculpture
  • Expanding my knowledge on international art
  • Collaborate with other artists from around the world
  • Mentoring a local child about photography, art, my background & more
  • Educating locals on my artistic practices

Risks & Challenges

Art is an important part of the world we live in today. It impacts lives and individuals around the world. I am challenged by the opportunity to make an impression on the international art world and join a larger conversation.

But perhaps my major challenge will be surviving the winter in Iceland! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign as well as my work through any outlet.

pictographybymargaret.com/art-photography/

facebook.com/pictographybymargaret

story:
So, what even is Visual Stickery anyway?

Well, Bryan loves to create artwork from meaty conversations, and clients & his community (that’s you guys!) alike, are often asking where they can get their hands on the artwork, in a physical form. A few of you have even gone off and made laptop stickers yourselves, and reported back how on well they’d been received at meetings and coffee shops all over! So, better late than never, we decided to choose ten of our favourite creations for this one off crowdfunding campaign.

However, the goal of this campaign isn’t to make money, just to do our part to help rid the world of corporate steely laptop greyness. In fact any surplus made from this campaign will be going straight back into wapisasa the not-for-profit I set up back in 2013. But more on that later…

 

What We Need

Our (highly scientific) guestimation, is that we’ll sell around 200 of each sticker/ pin badge. With this figure in mind, to meet our costs, we need to reach our target goal of £5000. We need to meet this target to break even, any and all surplus we raise will be going directly back to wapisasa CIC, to help fund more Rookies!


 

What You Get

Firstly, this campaign is a one-off. All of our tiers comes with a physical perk - Sticker and/or Pin Badge. Of course, we also have some EXTRA SUPER exclusive items available for the higher tiers.

All perks above £20 will come with a FREE Visual Stickery digital download wallpaper

All perks above £30 will also get a FREE sticker or pin badge (your choice) with our SUPER EXCLUSIVE mystery crowdfunder design, which Bryan is designing exclusively for our early/committed supporters.

All perks above £60 will come with all of the above, plus a hand-written thank you card from us at visual thinkery.

As it’s us, of course, it will also feature some artwork exclusively printed for this campaign.

All perks above £150 will come with all of the above, plus we’ll tweet out a thanks to you/ your company, anything above £250 and you also get your name (or your company name) in lights on the Visual Thinkery Site.

 

The Impact

Running a campaign like this requires a lot of work. Researching, organising, writing from another’s perspective, pushing and creating. This is where Eb, a wapisasa rookie, has been the star of the show. This is a learning curve, and an adventure for us all, and the great thing is that any surplus generated by this campaign will go to wapisasa, to help develop more young people like Eb.

Wapisasa CIC (Community Interest Company) aims to empower young people by giving them supported pathways into digital careers. Wapisasa work with young people who show aptitude, creativity and enthusiasm; providing them with personalised learning opportunities and mentoring to help them successfully access employment in the ever-shifting landscape of technology and communications.

 

Risks & Challenges

We’re committed to transparency, in the unfortunate event that things don't go quite as planned, whether it's a delay in the manufacturing timeline, shipping date, or something else, we promise to communicate honestly with you and work around the clock to get your stickers to you ASAP.

If we don’t reach the full goal, don’t panic! (Unless your name is Bryan Mathers...) Our aim is to fulfil any pledges made, no matter how much/little we raise. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Know someone with a naked laptop? A sticker fiend? Someone who’s decked head to toe in badges? Or simply someone who you feel our message will resonate with, if so, please pass it on!

HUGE Thank you to Dory Valentine for slaving away creating our beautiful campaign video  and The Spook School for letting us use 'Binary' as the soundtrack!
story_txt: So, what even is Visual Stickery anyway?Well, Bryan loves to create artwork from meaty conversations, and clients & his community (that’s you guys!) alike, are often asking where they can get their hands on the artwork, in a physical form. A few of you have even gone off and made laptop stickers yourselves, and reported back how on well they’d been received at meetings and coffee shops all over! So, better late than never, we decided to choose ten of our favourite creations for this one off crowdfunding campaign.However, the goal of this campaign isn’t to make money, just to do our part to help rid the world of corporate steely laptop greyness. In fact any surplus made from this campaign will be going straight back into wapisasa the not-for-profit I set up back in 2013. But more on that later… What We NeedOur (highly scientific) guestimation, is that we’ll sell around 200 of each sticker/ pin badge. With this figure in mind, to meet our costs, we need to reach our target goal of £5000. We need to meet this target to break even, any and all surplus we raise will be going directly back to wapisasa CIC, to help fund more Rookies! What You GetFirstly, this campaign is a one-off. story:
Concept


                                       No Judgment stands for the title.
                         
                            Self published stands for publishing it on my own.

                         Hand-bound stands for being made by my hands.
       
           Painted stands for original paint splatters spread along the pages.

            Poetgraphy stands for Poetry and Photography combined together.

                     Notebook stands for the availability of empty pages
                                        for you to add your own thoughts.

                                     
                                      An installation, more than a book.


Content

Going through pregnancy, divorce and single motherhood during the past couple of years took me on a quite rough but soul-nourishing journey.
"No Judgment"  showcases these personal changes.

My poetry is my feelings, my thoughts, my insights.Some are dark, some are colorful. Some explore memory, nostalgia and love.
My photographs are a fusion between the flesh and the sensitive responses.I have attempted to capture the most feminine parts of a female`s body, revealing her as a “timeless sculpture” while still showing her tactility.


The book is divided into three Chapters:


1- Celebrating Depression


                                   "A single thin line joins all moods together, 
              it is the same line that holds the emotions and the flesh ,
                                                     it is the line of the body."


   

       

2- Celebrating Womanhood

"..I woke up on my 30th birthday and suddenly found myself in the body of a woman. I've always been aware I am of a female gender; born a baby-girl, lived my childhood as a girl, faced all what teen-girls face, yet it was not until recently that I valued the fact of being born a female..."

                      

       

                        


3- Celebrating Love

"..from behind 

an unexpected grey sky
rain curtained
two dancing tails
of smoke embodying
one intensely luscious
mystifying secret..."





About Me

Flavia Juska Bechara
I am always in the search for the better side of the camera to portray my visual interpretations of scenes and ideas. 
This curiosity never failed to push me to try all sorts of jobs in the film field.

After playing the lead role in two International multi-award winning feature films (The Kite 2004 & Adam`s Wall 2009), i recently aimed to discover my skills in photography, film making and writing, which proved to be the ideal process to convey this project.

I am also interested in every aspect of being alive, in every experience life offers and in every single breath my daughters inhale.




Why do i need your help?

I need your help to fund the making and printing of this project.

“No Judgment” 
Cover: high-end raw leather
Pages: 90+ recycled papers separated by 4 transparent sheets that will have original colorful paint splatters on them as illustrations to compliment my images.



                   The Paint Splatters are done by my 2 year old daughters.

                                                       

                                                       The Little Artists                                                                                                                                                                                 
                 


Budget Covers:
 1- producing  400 "No Judgment" books
2- printing postcards 
3- printing bookmarks
4- printing large scale images
5- distritbution fees


Additional Costs:
1-  shipping and give away gifts  
2- fees of bank transfers
3- Indigogo`s cut                          
            



On the side:

I am collaborating with musicians and visual artists to present this project in a spectacle capturing multi-sensory experiences;

I will be sharing links to the upcoming visual/audio recordings with each contributor:

Examples:


One Whole Heart





Heavy Emptiness




Credits:

Lili-Marli and Elahe, Paint Splatters
Emne Mroue Houdeib, Book Layout, Co-Producer
Yara Yuri Safadi
Jean Madani, Music producer, Audio Addicts
Tina Yammout, Vocals​
Elio Tayeh, Video Editing, Video Art
Reem Atallah, Art Direction
                                         



Postcard/ framed A3 options

            #1                                                                  

                              
 


           #2
    
                            




          #3                                                                     

                     


              #4


                                           


             
             #5                                                                              

                                                              

              

​                                                            

Please share this campaign on Facebook, twitter, and other social media platforms.
                                  
                                                 Most important, Thank you all

story:
Down through the ages he wanders; cross continents and over seas. A solitary force guided by destiny, waging a one-man battle against the armies of ignorance and despair.

Introducing Jaycen Wise.... a hero ahead of his time.

If it can be done.... he can do it.

If they say it can’t be done.... he will find a way.

WHO IS JAYCEN WISE?

Jaycen Wise is an immortal warrior and scholar hailing from The Golden Ages of antiquity. He is charged with the lofty responsibility of battling the forces of ignorance and darkness, to ensure the eternal preservation of knowledge, truth and light.

Jaycen has had the luxury of sitting at the feet of innumerable masters of countless disciplines and arts on all continents down through the ages. He has had an immortal's lifetime to perfect his skills and improve upon these teachings, and is driven by an insatiable hunger for knowledge, adventure and self-mastery.

He is a dreamer, a visionary and a scholar; an unrivaled soldier, warrior and adventurer; a Renaissance Man, if you will; the perfect blend of mind, body heart, and soul.

Now YOU have the unique opportunity to help us bring Jaycen Wise to a global audience with the magic of crowd-funding and Indiegogo!!! We are aiming to raise funds (goal = $10,000) to fuel THE 3 P's (production, printing, and promotion) as we work ceaselessly to push the boundaries of creativity, and bring the perfect superhero to the world.

Through our 8-tier investment platform you can bless our efforts with your generosity, and in return receive special Jaycen Wise gifts/merchandise..... as well as the satisfaction of knowing that YOU helped in funding our mission to bring gold-standard, positive, edutainment to the global marketplace.

As is evident from the headlines on the nightly news, our youth are under attack. It is our responsibility to provide them with the tools to free their minds and build their character. Superheroes have ALWAYS served this role down through history..... but superheroes of color (and of substance) are few and far between in our society. As parents, educators and concerned citizens we have the RESPONSIBILITY to create the solution to this problem. The comic industry isn't going to do it..... Hollywood isn't going to do it. No one can do this.... but us.

Help us help our youth.... and inspire them to greatness.

HOTEP!!!

#getwise

story:
Hi, My name is Hawwa Djuned


I never thought that at a young age I would become a professional dancer.  Sure, I've always loved dance, but it wasn't something I set out to do.  I joined a group that specialized in Traditional Indonesian dance and after several years of performing, I recently began teaching.  

However, since I didn't have the pleasure of studying dance in a traditional manner, I feel like there is much more for me to learn in order to become a better teacher.  I want to give my students my absolute best and I have been graced with the opportunity to study under a Master Balinese dance teacher who has agreed to put me through a weekend long rigorous training that includes a full day of dance, theory and gamelan (Balinese Orchestra).

This workshop will allow me to give my students more and hopefully inspire them to take their individual skills to the next level and beyond!


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The total trip will cost approximately 1200.00 (flight, room and board and training).
  • Date: November 14-18th, 2013
  • Location: San Francisco, CA (Gamelan Sekar Jaya).
  • Any proceeds earned will go toward the Workshop training.
  • No amount is too little!

The Impact

Supporting the Arts is a great way to give to back to our communities.  The Arts regardless of cultural origin ignite other passions within us we might not have known existed.  It is a way to revive culture and history.

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways to help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise for me!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so very much!


Hawwa

story:
The Scoop

My name is Miriam Gabriel, known lately as Miri. I am a transdisciplinary scholar and spoken-word artist. I hold a masters in Consciousness Studies from Goddard College, and there is little I enjoy more than frequenting visits to coffee shops and college diversity centers to perform and behold performers. Most of my work and life are inspired by the way the sounds we make can transform lives and worlds. The sign, the sigh, the silence, the chanting, the speaking to one another. Transforming self, what is experienced as self, sense of body and soul, sense of community, country, and cosmic interconnectedness. I write, more than anything, but also sing, read aloud, scream, and even uncomfortably stare to notice how fully you and I and all else are here.

I recently received one strong stare back, and a nod of mutual recognition, with nothing awkward and everything affirming, by the phenomenal nation-wide Network for the Trnasformative Language Arts! Very recently, I have been approached by network founder and former instructor, the poet laureate of Kansas Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg, to be an official board member and Worlds of Change blog curator for the Network. I could not describe to you how I felt: happy, very happy, and... durable. Confident in what I do and in being counted on to do more.

What is the Transformative Language Arts Network?

The Transformative Language Arts as a new discipline brings out this sense of mutual responsiveness and collaboration from writers and artists. In a nutshell, TLA is defined on the Network's official website as "the intentional use of spoken, written, or sung word for social and personal transformation. This includes community building, ecological advocacy, social activism, personal growth and development, health and healing, and spiritual growth." It is writing, singing, speaking or listening as a way of knowing: it is a mode of discovery and creativity that casts the spells of change work in the interconnected arenas of human life on and with this planet. I want to start with my neighborhood, as well as all the neighborhoods that the TLAN can connect with nationally and abroad.

The Power of Words Conference and My Role In It

My joining of the Network came too close to their Power of Words Conference, happening in Philadelphia between October 11th and 13th, to which I have a full scholarship to attend other than the cost of my flight and possibly some (but not all!) lodging and transportation costs. At the conference, I will have a chance to directly participate in workshops on writing as a healing and culture re-building practice with nationally-renowned poets, artists and singers: such as Taina Asili, Dick Allen, Michelle Myers and Deb Hensley.

At the conference, I will I be able to jump-start my blogging role for the TLAN official blog, Worlds of Change, by covering the conference live so as to make available for free the information, tips, and experiences gained from working with the aforementioned mentors. In addition, I may even have a chance to offer a small workshop of my own! As it will be my first workshop at a major conference, I plan to share a series of writing exercises that would help create gritty, genuine and bridging dialogue between two or more seemingly rifting parts of a writer's influences or culture(s). I will use examples from my continual bridging of spiritual practice, feminist activism, Egyptian and American cultures, working-class economic awareness, and academic scholarship. This intuitive, stretching process can be challenging as it is rewarding, producing what I believe to be the most connected and important rebuilding work for communities in our time.

This is exactly the work I wish to contribute to my world with my every fiber - to Orlando, to Cairo, to readers, artists, and everyday people crossing paths in cyber space. But I am starting with a waitress' salary, for now, and am underprepared financially for the pleasant surprise of the scholarship.

The Gift Exchange

For this campaign, I chose the minimum amount of $500.00, out of which an average of $350.00 will be just enough to cover the cost of my round-trip flight from Orlando to Philadelphia and back. In addition, I would like to contribute to modifying the layout of the TLAN blog website so as to make it more user-friendly, colorful, multimedia-oriented and welcoming! According to Wordpress rates, that would average to about $75.00 for a well-designed, user-friendly layout.

Remaining Contributions Will Go Here

Any remaining financial support will be used towards a multitude of projects I have been saving up for - rhizome-like, participatory community projects that I have been planning to bring together in Orlando and now cover live for the Worlds of Change blog as examples of TLA work. Here are some examples:

- a scheduled project with the Gallery at Avalon Park in Downtown, Orlando specifically their Corridor Project, which adapts the concept of a stationary "gallery" to the moving streets, peoples and events of our city, such that everything from store fronts to moving buses become a site for artistic, locally connected performance. I am collaborating with phenomenal film maker and make-up artist Kelly Zak on my installation, a live poetry performance during which I will change clothes to represent variegated local cultures and engage passer-by reactions. I will use any additional funds toward compensating Kelly in any way I can for her generous collaboration with me and for using her equipment and make-up.

- a series of poetry-music collaborative tracks where we address the local conditions of culture creatives in Florida who tend to work hospitality-industry, low-paying jobs to be able to establish themselves as artists, educators, community organizers, holistic healers, and other self-starting careers that bring life to Orlando. I am collaborating here with best friend and bandmate, the phenomenal musician Benny Vazquez, a.k.a. Insert. So far, Benny has top-notch musical equipment and musical instruments, except for a decent mic. For his continual generosity in sharing his infinitely rich and socially-connected talent and tools, I want to contribute the mic to his studio.

- launching The Compendium with Benny, the multitalented local painter, writer and improv performer Curtis Walker and the renowned scholar and blogger Jeremy Johnson, where we will leave flash-drive collections of our work at sporadic spots in Orlando that would cover local and global topics such as the imagination, consciousness, race, spirituality, and artistic freedom. Copying into print an Orlando/Cairo zine and distributing it in both cities, bilingually written by young artists with a focus on intersections of spiritual/religious practice and queer activism. Also starting and encouraging a reading-booth project all over Orlando, setting up cardboard booths where passer-bys can choose a from a variety of books from which I will read aloud – for a penny, a smile, or a hug.

What You Receive In Return

I can't exchange a hug via cyber space, but I certainly will save a hearty sqeeze and thank you when I meet you in person. There is much more I would like to share with you for helping bring a sense of language arts that is connected, addressing, healing, and empowering to my communities, hopefully to yours as well via the information sharing I hope to curate on the TLAN blog. I would like to invite you always as a potential guest or regular blogger, whether to respond to our monthly suggested themes; interview a local artist that you feel empowers and transforms your cultural ecologies; or tell your story, bring it to the memory of others, network with fellow cultural creatives siphon it into the arteries and actions of artists, writers, singers, and everyday people and communities shape langage in ways that re-shape our world for the better.
 
In addition, based on your contribution, your name will be featured as a sponsor, you will receive a personalized short poem in e-mail, also in a snail-mail card, and an invite to be interviewed as a major contributor and sponsor for our network. Overall, I am so honored you chose to support my project as an example of collectively creating thorough, interconnected positive change through the arts. I can't thank you enough for helping me document and share stories of this empowering, engaged sense of language arts with the world - also bring methods and fruits of this artistry to more lives.

Other Ways to Show Support

But there are many other ways to contribute to this campaign, and to language as a tool of r/evolutionary change overall. I would love to read and potentiall publish your transformative stories – your video performances, your diary excerpts, your dream narration, your book reviews, your poems, your interviews. I welcome them in multiple languages and body languages, to many rhythms and off key. I welcome them embodied, ensouled, and/or spirited away. In solitude, chattery, screaming, and whispering silence that births songs. And I hope you will send them my way via my personal e-mail (temporarily) at mgabriel.miri@gmail.com.

Also, please visit the TLAN website and spread the word about us at http://www.tlanetwork.org/. To explore the Worlds of Change blog, check out http://worldsofchange.com/. Feel free to click, share, comment, write, record, upload, and be aware of how to consciously create language that is geared towards the most compassionate, visionary, transgressive, imaginary, achievable, possible, personal, political, transpersonal, and ever present ways of living and coexisting you can think of!

A Parting Note

On a final note, recognize yourself and others for the magic you manifest, the science you precise, the the rhythms you pattern together and set wildly free, with the way you pluck and arrange, plant and water, burn and bury, buy and sell, say and silence words. Bringing an intentional process to the way you relate to your words, and sharing such processes - through words and gestures and sounds - with others, we can together orient a given community towards practices that bring mastery, empathy, and mobilizing power to the way expressive language is used.

I thank you for every connection you make with this budding movement, large or small, and for taking the time to check out my campaign. For my newest private blog, feel free to visit www.mirigabriel.com. You may also find me as a guest blogger at Evolutionary Landscapes, an online hub exploring art, consciousness, everyday esotericism, and planetary post-modern culture at www.evolutionarylandscapes.net. Drop a line, and I hope to see you soon, in person or in the pixelated page!
story_txt:
The Scoop

My name is Miriam Gabriel, known lately as Miri. I am a transdisciplinary scholar and spoken-word artist. I hold a masters in Consciousness Studies from Goddard College, and there is little I enjoy more than frequenting visits to coffee shops and college diversity centers to perform and behold performers. Most of my work and life are inspired by the way the sounds we make can transform lives and worlds. The sign, the sigh, the silence, the chanting, the speaking to one another. Transforming self, what is experienced as self, sense of body and soul, sense of community, country, and cosmic interconnectedness. I write, more than anything, but also sing, read aloud, scream, and even uncomfortably stare to notice how fully you and I and all else are here.I recently received one strong stare back, and a nod of mutual recognition, with nothing awkward and everything affirming, by the phenomenal nation-wide Network for the Trnasformative Language Arts! Very recently, I have been approached by network founder and former instructor, the poet laureate of Kansas Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg, to be an official board member and Worlds of Change blog curator for the Network. I could not describe to you how I felt: happy, very happy, and... durable. Confident in what I do and in being counted on to do more.What is the Transformative Language Arts Network?The Transformative Language Arts as a new discipline brings out this sense of mutual responsiveness and collaboration from writers and artists. In a nutshell, TLA is defined on the Network's official website as "the intentional use of spoken, written, or sung word for social and personal transformation. This includes community building, ecological advocacy, social activism, personal growth and development, health and healing, and spiritual growth." It is writing, singing, speaking or listening as a way of knowing: it is a mode of discovery and creativity that casts the spells of change work in the interconnected arenas of human life on and with this planet. I want to start with my neighborhood, as well as all the neighborhoods that the TLAN can connect with nationally and abroad. The Power of Words Conference and My Role In It

My joining of the Network came too close to their Power of Words Conference, happening in Philadelphia between October 11th and 13th, to which I have a full scholarship to attend other than the cost of my flight and possibly some (but not all!) lodging and transportation costs. At the conference, I will have a chance to directly participate in workshops on writing as a healing and culture re-building practice with nationally-renowned poets, artists and singers: such as Taina Asili, Dick Allen, Michelle Myers and Deb Hensley.At the conference, I will I be able to jump-start my blogging role for the TLAN official blog, Worlds of Change, by covering the conference live so as to make available for free the information, tips, and experiences gained from working with the aforementioned mentors. In addition, I may even have a chance to offer a small workshop of my own! As it will be my first workshop at a major conference, I plan to share a series of writing exercises that would help create gritty, genuine and bridging dialogue between two or more seemingly rifting parts of a writer's influences or culture(s). I will use examples from my continual bridging of spiritual practice, feminist activism, Egyptian and American cultures, working-class economic awareness, and academic scholarship. This intuitive, stretching process can be challenging as it is rewarding, producing what I believe to be the most connected and important rebuilding work for communities in our time. This is exactly the work I wish to contribute to my world with my every fiber - to Orlando, to Cairo, to readers, artists, and everyday people crossing paths in cyber space. But I am starting with a waitress' salary, for now, and am underprepared financially for the pleasant surprise of the scholarship.The Gift Exchange
For this campaign, I chose the minimum amount of $500.00, out of which an average of $350.00 will be just enough to cover the cost of my round-trip flight from Orlando to Philadelphia and back. In addition, I would like to contribute to modifying the layout of the TLAN blog website so as to make it more user-friendly, colorful, multimedia-oriented and welcoming! According to Wordpress rates, that would average to about $75.00 for a well-designed, user-friendly layout.Remaining Contributions Will Go Here
Any remaining financial support will be used towards a multitude of projects I have been saving up for - rhizome-like, participatory community projects that I have been planning to bring together in Orlando and now cover live for the Worlds of Change blog as examples of TLA work. Here are some examples:- a scheduled project with the Gallery at Avalon Park in Downtown, Orlando specifically their Corridor Project, which adapts the concept of a stationary "gallery" to the moving streets, peoples and events of our city, such that everything from store fronts to moving buses become a site for artistic, locally connected performance. I am collaborating with phenomenal film maker and make-up artist Kelly Zak on my installation, a live poetry performance during which I will change clothes to represent variegated local cultures and engage passer-by reactions. I will use any additional funds toward compensating Kelly in any way I can for her generous collaboration with me and for using her equipment and make-up.- a series of poetry-music collaborative tracks where we address the local conditions of culture creatives in Florida who tend to work hospitality-industry, low-paying jobs to be able to establish themselves as artists, educators, community organizers, holistic healers, and other self-starting careers that bring life to Orlando. I am collaborating here with best friend and bandmate, the phenomenal musician Benny Vazquez, a.k.a. Insert. So far, Benny has top-notch musical equipment and musical instruments, except for a decent mic. For his continual generosity in sharing his infinitely rich and socially-connected talent and tools, I want to contribute the mic to his studio.- launching The Compendium with Benny, the multitalented local painter, writer and improv performer Curtis Walker and the renowned scholar and blogger Jeremy Johnson, where we will leave flash-drive collections of our work at sporadic spots in Orlando that would cover local and global topics such as the imagination, consciousness, race, spirituality, and artistic freedom. Also starting and encouraging a reading-booth project all over Orlando, setting up cardboard booths where passer-bys can choose a from a variety of books from which I will read aloud – for a penny, a smile, or a hug.

story:
Love Baseball and Save the Art of Detroit

I don't know if many of you have heard about what's happening in Detroit and how city officials are considering auctioning off the art in their museum (primarily donated by and/or paid for by donations and held in the public trust) to pay off Detroit's debts – but it's kind of heartbreaking. (www.nytimes.com/2013/10/03/arts/design/detroit-...)

Since Oakland and Detroit are currently battling it out on the baseball field – my neighbor had this great idea – what if Oakland A's fans, in the spirit of good sportsmanship – donated $1 to help save Detroit's art if we win. So I made this indiegogo.

Maybe the fans of the brawn can help save the heart of the our fellow city.

Please consider donating or sharing the link. Thanks.

Donations:
  • I will collect the money through this campaign and donate all of it to the Detroit Institute of Arts. (www.DIA.org)
  • I will ask the museum for an E-Receipt for full transparency
  • Donations will be made in the name of 'Oakland Athletic Fans Who Love Detroit'
  • FYI - I have to collect the $ and donate it personally in order to name it as from all of us - this is why I'm not using the 'donate directly to the non-profit' function.

story:
Short Summary

In 2012 Aria Chittenden opened her dream of an open based art studio that promotes art freedom!  We turned restaurant salad bars into art bars in which children can load up trays with endless supplies.  We are anti structured art and instead encourage children to create their individual ideas of artistic expression.  We make art accessible to all families by providing low income discounts and military discounts EVERY BUSINESS DAY!  We even award one family per month with a scholarship for endless play.  We support local artists and local businesses/non profits by doing cross promotions, offering space for events/classes and hanging local artists work to showcase them!

What We Need & What You Get

We could really use a tech upgrade to help grow our business to the next level.  We would LOVE Microsoft Office for Mac in order to design our own fliers and marketing materials.  We would also like to have an IPAD to be able to use on mobile events, accept credit cards and to sign up for perka and supportland (two other local businesses we can support and marketing avenues that will help us in turn).  We desperately need a new ability to play music through out the rooms of the studio!  Our CD player is breaking, skipping and only plays in one room!

We are also working on getting a wheelchair ramp with an additional fund raiser and any left over funds from this campaign we will add to that total!

The Impact

The more we can grow as a business the more we can offer the community.  If we are able to go mobile with our projects and technology we can reach more public schools.  The more we are able to obtain up to date marketing resources, the more we can get our name out and grow as a business.  

We would like to be able to get our business to a point where we can afford to let non profits use our space for free and provide even more discounts for families in need.

If we have extra money left over it will roll over to the other fund raiser started to help us add a wheel chair ramp!!  Which will help bring even more special needs families through the door!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute any amounts.  (Though even one dollar can help).  

You may also help by sharing this campaign on your social media sites, asking friends to  contribute.

We also accept art supply donations which also helps us cut costs and continue to offer low rates, discounts and scholarships.

story:
Hello, we made a magazine.

Our names are Lauren Dulay and Nicole Hennessy. We've been coming up with ridiculous ideas together for about 12 years. This is the best one we've had.

Nicole is a journalist living in Lakewood, Ohio. She writes for a small weekly paper called West Life and otherwise begs for freelance work. She also dabbles in poetry, teaching workshops at Ohio City Writers, and is really good at calling people over and over and over again (a skilled trait acquired through journalism that somewhat resembles stalking). Lauren is a tattoo artist with a natural talent for art. When she's not tattooing or becoming consumed with all things Miser, she can be found doing many of her other hobbies, like animated cartoons, experimenting with music, making dollhouse miniatures, or just plain procrastinating.

Miser Magazine

Bi-monthly, it's based on local authors, artists, and creators from the Cleveland and NEO area with our own creative touches in peculiar ways. We distribute it in fun places in Lakewood, Coventry, Gordon Square, Ohio City, Tremont, downtown and Waterloo. Once we have enough gas money to go farther than that, we will.

We made it entirely ourselves - brainstormed, collected, organized, printed in a garage, assembled, stapled, and distibuted them.

Give us money  :(

We need all the dollars we can get, in order to keep this free to our readers. We started with 300 copies, but we realized people really like it and that we need to atleast double the amount to 600. Which means we can't pay for all of that. 300 was cutting it close.
We feel it is important to keep art free. This magazine is not only a place for art to be expressed and enjoyed freely, but it helps local businesses that advertise in our magazine and helps unite our community to inspire to create. Just pick one up and see for yourself!
 
If you think our idea is really sweet, and you want to help and you can't even spare a dollar, you can atleast help spread the word and try to tell your wealthier friends about us, about our mission, and especially about this super handy donations website.

Thanks! Please share us!

story:
ABOUT THE ARTIST:

Fine artist Tommy Roberts was invited to share his talents abroad with Artists 2 Africa, participating as a teacher on this tour representing his discipline of painting. He is one of several artists throughout the U.S. invited to teach other creative mediums including: Carren Clarke-Mcadoo (VA), Shurvon Haynes(WA), Jolyn E. Gardner (WA), Karen Y. Buster (MD), Larry Poncho Brown (MD), and Ethan Holland (PA), to name a few. A noteworthy group of American artists exchanging creative education with African artists!

ABOUT A2A:

ARTISTS 2 AFRICA was birthed from decades of artists discussing the prospect of organizing a group journey to Africa tailored specifically for artists and focused on art education. On October 19-30, 2013 we will embark on our second official journey to Ghana West Africa!

The artists will journey into the art villages on the outskirts of Ghana. Various artisans including painters, sculptors, and weavers will be gathered in their workshops to create and collaborate. We will fellowship with the artists and students, visit their workshops to share technique, and explore the creative process, while exchanging our creative ideas with the artisans in the region. An exhibition will be organized featuring the works of each artist. Our focus is to educate and connect through ART.

HOW WILL YOUR FUNDS BE UTILIZED?

With your support we hope you will assist us with this unified effort. As you can see on the right...the artist has graciously donated his art for pledge rewards. The campaign is to assist us with acquiring art materials for other artists to use on our visit as we fellowship by creating art. We will be visiting 4 locations where ceramic, wood carving, fabric making and other artforms are taught and produced. We will introduce various art projects and will instruct several groups of artisans and other participants. Funds will assist with art supplies and materials, and small tools. We also plan to document this experience with photography and video as a future educational medium. We hope you will take advantage of this unique opportunity to assist with this project....thank you. Share.Teach.Create!
