story:
We are the Gray's Painters of 2015! 


We are a group of final year students studying painting at Gray's School of Art in Aberdeen. June 2015 is the month we have been working towards for four years  - it is the launch of our future careers after all. 
As fourth year students we are given the opportunity to showcase some pieces from the body of our work in a Degree Show. This is open to family, friends, prospective clients, critics and companies - with access for the community of Aberdeen as a whole. It is the biggest night not only in the Gray's School of Art  calendar but the largest exhibition of work in the North East annually. The speciality of this occasion is heightened this year as it marks the 130th year of graduates to pass through the door of Gray's!

Our goal?

Putting on a show is a time consuming and costly process and we need your help to achieve our goal - a show to gain something from. Our show will run for a week including a spectacular opening night where all departments within the school and guests embark on an evening of discussion, discovery and celebration. 

We hope to produce a high quality catalogue that is beneficial not only for us as professionals but as a way for visitors to gain a greater insight into the work being produced by emerging artists in the North East of Scotland. Your donations will allow us to create a professional catalogue, which will be a vital addition to our show for a number of reasons: 

  • All proceeds of the catalogues we sell at the show and any surplus from our fundraising will be given to two local charities. 
  • It serves as an acting memento of the show and of our work as a cohort, which visitors can take home with them. It will contain a collection of photographs alongside details of the artists and their work.
  • On a professional level, it works as a networking tool to open avenues of conversation with the potential to start dialogue about further opportunities. 
  • The catalogue works as a form of documentation that allows us, as well as future students and other artists, to reflect on the work that was produced by  final year painting students in Aberdeen, 2015. 

We need to reach a total of £3000 to put our catalogues into production. This is a lot of money but through past fundraising events we are already on route to success but need your help for a final push! 

...but what's in it for you?

As a gesture of thanks, we have created a number of perks for you too, should you wish to receive them! 
Check out some of our perks on the right hand side!

Find out what we else we have been up to! 
Exhibitions, artworks, bake sales, christmas hampers and more, keep up to date with our events! 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/grayspainters15
Twitter: grayspainters15
Instagram: grayspainters15 

A final note, 

Of course we realise that many of you would love to help us financially if you could but unfortunately can't afford to, Don't be fooled - you can still support us! We would greatly appreciate it if you could spread the word to your friends, family or anyone who you think may be interested!
We really can't do this without your help! However, no matter how big or small a donation you can give, we hope you realise the opportunities that you are opening for us! After the success of our pre-degree show in Edinburgh we can't wait to bring a show back to home ground showing what we do best - PAINTING! 
We hope you can all join us at our degree show at Gray's School of Art from the 19th-28th June 2015 where we would love to thank you all in person for your kind donations. 

Gray's Painters 2015

We are a group of final year students studying painting at Gray's School of Art in Aberdeen. June 2015 is the month we have been working towards for four years  - it is the launch of our future careers after all. 
As fourth year students we are given the opportunity to showcase some pieces from the body of our work in a Degree Show. This is open to family, friends, prospective clients, critics and companies - with access for the community of Aberdeen as a whole. It is the biggest night not only in the Gray's School of Art  calendar but the largest exhibition of work in the North East annually. The speciality of this occasion is heightened this year as it marks the 130th year of graduates to pass through the door of Gray's!
   Our goal?
Putting on a show is a time consuming and costly process and we need your help to achieve our goal - a show to gain something from. Our show will run for a week including a spectacular opening night where all departments within the school and guests embark on an evening of discussion, discovery and celebration. 
We hope to produce a high quality catalogue that is beneficial not only for us as professionals but as a way for visitors to gain a greater insight into the work being produced by emerging artists in the North East of Scotland. Your donations will allow us to create a professional catalogue, which will be a vital addition to our show for a number of reasons: 


All proceeds of the catalogues we sell at the show and any surplus from our fundraising will be given to two local charities. 
It serves as an acting memento of the show and of our work as a cohort, which visitors can take home with them. It will contain a collection of photographs alongside details of the artists and their work.
On a professional level, it works as a networking tool to open avenues of conversation with the potential to start dialogue about further opportunities. 
The catalogue works as a form of documentation that allows us, as well as future students and other artists, to reflect on the work that was produced by  final year painting students in Aberdeen, 2015. 

We need to reach a total of £3000 to put our catalogues into production. This is a lot of money but through past fundraising events we are already on route to success but need your help for a final push! 

...but what's in it for you?
As a gesture of thanks, we have created a number of perks for you too, should you wish to receive them! 
Check out some of our perks on the right hand side!


Find out what we else we have been up to! 


Exhibitions, artworks, bake sales, christmas hampers and more, keep up to date with our events! 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/grayspainters15

Twitter: grayspainters15
Instagram: grayspainters15 

A final note, 
Of course we realise that many of you would love to help us financially if you could but unfortunately can't afford to, Don't be fooled - you can still support us! We would greatly appreciate it if you could spread the word to your friends, family or anyone who you think may be interested!
We really can't do this without your help! However, no matter how big or small a donation you can give, we hope you realise the opportunities that you are opening for us! After the success of our pre-degree show in Edinburgh we can't wait to bring a show back to home ground showing what we do best - PAINTING! We hope you can all join us at our degree show at Gray's School of Art from the 19th-28th June 2015 where we would love to thank you all in person for your kind donations. 
Gray's Painters 2015

story:
What we are building and why: 

The Robot Versus Future artist collective is seeking to construct a MIDI Synthesizer out of Televisions for the 2013 Burning Man Pavilion. 

With this year's art theme being "Cargo Cult", we believed that we could generate a meaningful, and simultaneously playful, interactive art installation to be exhibited in the Pavilion. The RVF philosophy is fascinated with the antiquated machine, the borderline obsolete, thus we are dragging these arcane CRT TVs into the present to coalesce with modern technology. We believe we can redefine these obsolete objects, by making them useful again. 


The artists of RVF have been dabbling and tinkering with electronics since 2010. We are good at breaking stuff, making noises, and keeping audiences wondering. Most of the time we rely on 2nd-hand or recycled materials for our pieces, sourcing our raw goods from the Craigslist "FREE" section, and harvesting them for their usable components.

You may be thinking "Wow, that last paragraph was really loaded with a lot of links to Transmedia performances." Well, we think you are rather clever, because it was. RVF has been granted the honor to exhibit in the Man Pavilion, we are beyond honored, and it signifies that we are growing as emerging artists (that's exciting!). We see this as an opportunity to branch out from a more personalized kind of making to a community driven style of making.

Robot Versus Future has been developing and deconstructing electronic instruments for their own performances for many years. We are ready to develop for a wider audience, and believe that RVFMTV2 would be an excellent debut to the community within Black Rock City. You will be able to find the piece within the Burning Man's space-ship like effigy.  

The piece is intended to evoke nostalgia for the past, reminiscent of a glitchy space ship monitoring system. The installation and interaction will poke at a vintage, or stylized, perception of the future, while acknowledging that there is no way to understand what the future may look like, or what it may be capable of.

 

What we need funding for:

1. Transportation of:

- One artist from Canada to California and Black Rock City.  

- The entire project from The Bay Area to Black Rock City. 

2. The aquisition of a Mac computer to run the synthesizer patch program on, essentially the brain of the installation.

3. The aquisition of the odds and ends that our art grant does not cover, which should be minimal. The art is essentially funded, but we must be prepared for unforseen costs. 

 

Other ways you can help:

DONATE A COMPUTER: Ultimately we would love to aquire the comupter (see above) through donation rather than purchasing it. If you have a Mac you no longer need that is still functional we would love to take it off your hands. Please contact us at robotversusfuture@gmail.com. 

COME TO OUR PARTY! Thursday July 25th at Project One Gallery. All contributors get free entry (once you have donated we will contact you). Bring your friends! Information on the party:

Robot Versus Future and Project One Present to you the danciest night of art and music this summer. Come dressed in your most spaced-out duds and get ready to dance to the sounds of DJ Bleego (soundcloud.com/bleego). Enjoy delicious cocktails and check out the installations in Project One's gorgeous gallery. 

Facebook event page:

https://www.facebook.com/events/345267185600163/

 

 

WE WILL CONTINUE TO PUT PROGRESS UPDATES IN THE COMMENTS AREA! THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT OF ART IN THE DIGITAL AGE, COMMUNITY, AND THE FUTURE!!!!

story:
Hi there!

Thank you for checking out my campaign! My intention with this project is to harness the transformative power of art to inspire hope and compassion in Vancouver’s Downtown Eastside, an area known for its high rates of poverty and drug use. 

I hope to achieve this by turning one of my drawings into a 45" by 66" bus shelter advertisement, which will be placed near Pigeon Park at Hastings and Carrall streets for a period of one month. If money is raised beyond the intended goal, it will be used to extend the duration of the ad (the cost for advertising alone is $2,160 for 28 days). I will also be printing posters and postcards to put up and leave around the city.

The artwork in question is a colourful and energetic piece with the affirmation “Believe in Yourself” embedded amongst its visual elements (you can find the full image in the Gallery). The advertising space will not be used to credit myself as an artist, nor any other individual, organization, or institution – it is intended purely as an offering of hope and inspiration, while also functioning as an interesting social experiment that explores how ‘advertising’ might be used in more positive and constructive ways.

I have been fascinated with the idea of ‘positive advertising’ for some time now, as I believe it carries tremendous power and potential, but doesn’t really have a place in our consumer-based society. I’m intrigued by the idea of subverting the typical applications of advertising in such a way that they help to encourage internal reflection, rather than simply compel people to buy a product. Many of the struggles we face start within ourselves, and so it is within where true change must begin.

So, for as much as this project is directed at those who live in the Downtown Eastside, it truly stands to benefit everyone – myself included. After all, we could all be reminded from time to time to believe in ourselves. This is my little way (and possibly yours!) to give back to the greater community we all share.

When we help other people, we ultimately help ourselves.  By learning to love other people, regardless of any superficiality we might assign to them (like race or class), we can create the positive change in the world that we all wish to see, yet might have forgotten is possible.

Believe in the potential we all possess, and the power we hold to create a more loving, inclusive, and compassionate world for all.  We’re all in this together! 

Thank you!!

*Images:  Please visit the Gallery to see the "Believe in Yourself" drawing that will be turned into the bus shelter ad.  Please note that the four images/drawings here are the prints offered at the $75 perk level and up.

**If you can't donate, that's okay!  My gratitude to you for checking out my project anyway.  To download the drawings for free, please visit soulspark.ca

***If you would like to distribute this poster in your community, please message me!  The words “Believe in Yourself” can easily be changed into any language, so please let me know.

story:
Letters. Acronyms. What do they really mean? What happens when one man chooses three simple letters (R, W, and S) to accompany him throughout his life? These three letters will mean different things during different life stages. This year, they might represent a place of work. As David matures, they might represent a life philosophy: Run With Scissors. Or, they might become a personal maxim: Really Wicked Sweet, Regrets Wither Sooner, or Red Wing Sauce. But we'll never know unless David receives the funds to make this happen.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,000 in funding to pay for the cost of the tattoo and to show David that his friends support him in this courageous endeavor.

The Impact

David's body is ready for this lifelong commitment. Wherever life takes him, he'll take RWS.

story:
My Name is Tracey Clay.

I am graduating from the University of Northern Colorado this summer with a Bachelors in Anthropology and a Bachelors in Photo Imaging. My dream in life is to mix my two passions of photography and cultural studies into a career of travel and documentary photography. I believe that it is with this medium that change can happen in the world.

Now that you know a little bit about my background and my life dreams, you will understand why, when I learned of this trip, I just had to be a part of it!

The Giving Lens

The trip to Tanzania is with an organization called The Giving Lens. Founded by Colby Brown, a professional landscape, travel and humanitarian photographer and world-renouned photo-educator, TGL combines photography with humanitarian work around the world. By offering their cameras and their time, TGL teams help various non-profit organizations in any way needed. In addition to volunteering and participating in life changing experiences, participants are able to grow their photography skills through workshops with professionals.

Tanzania

This summer TGL is partnering with Art in Tanzania, a non profit that works for the Tanzanian public in a multitude of ways including supporting artists, building and running schools as well as offering community programs such as clean water and HIV/AIDS education. Art in Tanzania has partnered with UNICEF to create the UNICEF Children's Agenda to further their children's programs.

Our work this summer will be documenting the work of Art in Tanzania and the UNICEF Children's Agenda and teaching photo skills to Art in Tanzania staff so they will be able to continue this documentation. We will also visit the native Maasai tribe to document their way of life for cultural preservation and work in the Maasai school which offers an education to the Maasai children who may have otherwise been pressured to participate in a mainstream education that would not honor their traditional Maasai heritage.

Donations

If you donate towards my trip you will be helping me to fund this amazing experience. The cost of the program is $3600 which includes all accomodations, meals, water, ground transportation, a 3 day safari and a donation to Art in Tanzania to ensure the furthering of their important work. Program cost does not include airfare and other various expenses such as visa fees and the cost of required and recommended vaccinations and/or perscriptions.

I am greatful for any help and to show my gratitude I have offered perks for different levels of donations!

The Impact

This trip has great potential to further my phtography skill and career. I am very excited to have the opportunity to learn from some of the best photographers in a field that is of great interest to me. The environment has great potential to inspire and cultivate growing creativity and artistry through the support of other artists around me.

To be fully immersed in another culutre is a dream and passion of mine and will help to further open my eyes to all that the people of this world have to offer. The opportunity to give back in the process of all of this will be truly life changing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, don't worry about it!
Please help me by sharing my story and this link with others.

For more information on TGL or Art in Tanzania, please visit the following sites:
http://www.thegivinglens.com/
http://www.artintanzania.org/

A special thank you to Katie Siobhan Havercroft for the lovely picture of the Tanzanian children.

story:
Classicly Trained Women Takes on Future of Industry, film at 11...

I'm a Mother & Maker by nature, a Fine Metalsmith and Industrial Designer by schooling and a Professional Body Piercer by trade. Nova Metal Arts is the culmination of these traits and will benefit from all of them.

I strive to bring a crisp classic technical craft esthetic to the Body Jewlery industry. By focusing in on Niobium and high karat Golds, exotic fused metals, genuine stones and fabrications techniques from craftsmen of yesteryear, I will be offering designs not yet available and yet so desired.

She needs Bigger Tools, you need Better Pretties (even if you don't think you do, you do, trust me)

With the funds raised thru this campaign we will be getting:

  • Finishing out my beloved studio with a handful of specialty tools that will allow this type of work to happen. Including new fusion welders & heavier duty hydraulic presses.
  • Initial stock of raw materials
  • Cost associated with a vendor booth at the Association of Professional Piercers Conference Expo, where I will be debuting my initial line and securing accounts with buyers

For your contribution you get the warm fuzzy feeling for your soul and in many cases something amazing for your grubby little hands (or ears or lapel). I can't wait to send you something handmade with my new tools.

Only You Prevent Stalled Campaigns! 

Please pass this campaign on to your friends and family, so anyone who is a believer in the handmade arts, to supporting woman owned business and/or veteran families, can see it. Every set of eyes brings us that much farther!

If you happen to have access to using or selling any of the large tools I need, please contact me, including:

  • fusion or laser welders, chemical fume hood, purge box, use of a water jet cutters

story:
HAND OF THE MAN is a highly interactive, robotic gift exchange art project bound for "I, Robot"-themed Burning Man 2018!

What is it?

HAND OF THE MAN is an up-cycled arcade claw machine, with the coin mechanism removed, and devoid the standard commercial trinkets such devices normally purvey.

Instead, Burning Man participants spontaneously donate the wide variety of their typically small format, hand-made, "playa gifts" (Burners routinely bring to the event) through receptacles at the top of the machine.

Meanwhile, anyone can operate the claw mechanism to retrieve a gift.

These gifts are typically woven patches, stickers, medallions, and other jewelry/adornments that Burning Man participants hand-craft throughout the off-season in anticipation of sharing in random face-to-face encounters with other participants during the event.

HAND OF THE MAN offers a repository where gifters can share with unknown receivers some of their gifts, (when it takes the form of a physical object), across space and time.

 

A SELF-SUSTAINING GIFTING PLATFORM

An ample supply of 3” - 5” clear, egg-shaped plastic containers will allow small, oddly-shaped gifts to more easily be deposited, and then be seen and easily retrieved by other participants via the specially modified claw. Unlike commercial models in the prize prevention business, HAND OF THE MAN will be re-engineered to deliver on the first or second try.

 

A sticker affixed to each container reminds receivers to recycle the container into the attached basket for use by the next gifter. Thus, the machine is designed to be self-perpetuating gift exchange platform for the event’s duration.  

Initially, the machine will be pre-stocked with a "seed" allotment of pre-donated gifts [perhaps including a few of yours?] so as to initially “prime the gifting pump”. Thereafter, it will be an experiment seeking natural and spontaneous equilibrium between net gifters and receivers throughout the event.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP (AND PERKS!)

I am seeking a minimum funding goal of $2450 with a stretch goal to 2700, which will cover additional aesthetic treatments.    Although I have the technical, craft, and organizational skills to well-execute the project, I am going it alone on a modest personal income and need financial support to cover out-of-pocket costs such as:

  • Procuring the retired claw machine (unit already identified)
  • Restoring to working operation
  • Essential gifting device modifications (Decommodifying a formerly commercial device can be more complicated than it seems!)
  • Substantial Cabinet refinishing, "playa-proofing", and transportation to Burning Man
  • Procurement of gifting capsules, perk materials, and essential spare parts for emergency repairs on-playa, and other miscellaneous expenses.

Contribution levels are each based upon one of The 10 Principles of Burning Man.

Gifting Principle

A machine that gives must first receive.   To "prime the gifting pump" for its event debut, I'm seeking a small allotment (1 to 5) of your playa gift, with a total goal of 200 seed gifts prior to the event.   In the spirit of the Inclusion Principle,  anyone may participate at this level, whether or not you consider yourself part of the Burning Man community, and whether or not you contribute financially.    If you would like to participate, email me at Gifts4HandOfTheMan@Yahoo.com

Other Principles of Burning Man based Perks

Choose from the contribution levels to donate monetarily.   Here's a preview of just some of the perks available:

 

ULTIMATELY, AN EXAMINATION OF BURNING MAN’S “GIFTING PRINCIPLE” IN THE ROBOTIC AGE

The Burning Man 2018 Theme, “I, Robot”, which is to be the late Burning Man Co-founder Larry Harvey’s final theme challenge to the Burning Man community, invites Artists and Participants to pose questions and speculations about what humanity’s move toward a more robotic and artificial intelligence-directed world means in the face of our very organic human traditions.

HAND OF THE MAN is at once both a celebration of technology amplifying our reach, and the fearful recognition of depersonalization that seems to come along with it.

One the one “hand”, HAND OF THE MAN, amplifies the gifting principle. It allows gifters to share the gifting experience to an audience beyond the personal encounter. It is a reminder that the abundance experienced by Burning Man participants is only possible via the generosity of often-unmet strangers.

Yet, on the other "hand", HAND OF THE MAN is an instrument of intermediation in the gifting process. It deprives the face-to-face experience of gifting to another human being in the flesh. This reflects the depersonalizion and social isolation we increasingly experience with the proliferation of advanced technology, in social media, and on other fronts.

Which is more powerful? The extension of the gifting experience to the stranger you will never meet and only speculate upon his or her appreciation? Or, the indifference that seems to inevitably spring from depersonalized contact with others? How will the Gifting Principle fare in the robotic age?

This is Burning Man. We face such questions openly.

Dusty Love, 

Jeff Vetterick (a.k.a. "Sticky")

PS - If you really like this idea, please share the campaign on your preferred social network using the icons at the campaign header, above, or below (mobile).  Shares with a sincere introductory note from you will be especially appreciated.    I hope to meet you, on or off the Playa!
story_txt:
HAND OF THE MAN is a highly interactive, robotic gift exchange art project bound for "I, Robot"-themed Burning Man 2018!What is it?HAND OF THE MAN is an up-cycled arcade claw machine, with the coin mechanism removed, and devoid the standard commercial trinkets such devices normally purvey.Instead, Burning Man participants spontaneously donate the wide variety of their typically small format, hand-made, "playa gifts" (Burners routinely bring to the event) through receptacles at the top of the machine.Meanwhile, anyone can operate the claw mechanism to retrieve a gift.These gifts are typically woven patches, stickers, medallions, and other jewelry/adornments that Burning Man participants hand-craft throughout the off-season in anticipation of sharing in random face-to-face encounters with other participants during the event.HAND OF THE MAN offers a repository where gifters can share with unknown receivers some of their gifts, (when it takes the form of a physical object), across space and time. A SELF-SUSTAINING GIFTING PLATFORMAn ample supply of 3” - 5” clear, egg-shaped plastic containers will allow small, oddly-shaped gifts to more easily be deposited, and then be seen and easily retrieved by other participants via the specially modified claw. Unlike commercial models in the prize prevention business, HAND OF THE MAN will be re-engineered to deliver on the first or second try. A sticker affixed to each container reminds receivers to recycle the container into the attached basket for use by the next gifter. Thus, the machine is designed to be self-perpetuating gift exchange platform for the event’s duration.  Initially, the machine will be pre-stocked with a "seed" allotment of pre-donated gifts [perhaps including a few of yours?] so as to initially “prime the gifting pump”. Thereafter, it will be an experiment seeking natural and spontaneous equilibrium between net gifters and receivers throughout the event. HOW YOU CAN HELP (AND PERKS!)I am seeking a minimum funding goal of $2450 with a stretch goal to 2700, which will cover additional aesthetic treatments.    Although I have the technical, craft, and organizational skills to well-execute the project, I am going it alone on a modest personal income and need financial support to cover out-of-pocket costs such as:
Procuring the retired claw machine (unit already identified)
Restoring to working operation
Essential gifting device modifications (Decommodifying a formerly commercial device can be more complicated than it seems!)
Substantial Cabinet refinishing, "playa-proofing", and transportation to Burning Man
Procurement of gifting capsules, perk materials, and essential spare parts for emergency repairs on-playa, and other miscellaneous expenses.
Contribution levels are each based upon one of The 10 Principles of Burning Man.Gifting PrincipleA machine that gives must first receive.   To "prime the gifting pump" for its event debut, I'm seeking a small allotment (1 to 5) of your playa gift, with a total goal of 200 seed gifts prior to the event.   In the spirit of the Inclusion Principle,  anyone may participate at this level, whether or not you consider yourself part of the Burning Man community, and whether or not you contribute financially.    If you would like to participate, email me at Gifts4HandOfTheMan@Yahoo.comOther Principles of Burning Man based PerksChoose from the contribution levels to donate monetarily.   Here's a preview of just some of the perks available: ULTIMATELY, AN EXAMINATION OF BURNING MAN’S “GIFTING PRINCIPLE” IN THE ROBOTIC AGEThe Burning Man 2018 Theme, “I, Robot”, which is to be the late Burning Man Co-founder Larry Harvey’s final theme challenge to the Burning Man community, invites Artists and Participants to pose questions and speculations about what humanity’s move toward a more robotic and artificial intelligence-directed world means in the face of our very organic human traditions.HAND OF THE MAN is at once both a celebration of technology amplifying our reach, and the fearful recognition of depersonalization that seems to come along with it.One the one “hand”, HAND OF THE MAN, amplifies the gifting principle. It allows gifters to share the gifting experience to an audience beyond the personal encounter. It is a reminder that the abundance experienced by Burning Man participants is only possible via the generosity of often-unmet strangers.Yet, on the other "hand", HAND OF THE MAN is an instrument of intermediation in the gifting process. It deprives the face-to-face experience of gifting to another human being in the flesh. This reflects the depersonalizion and social isolation we increasingly experience with the proliferation of advanced technology, in social media, and on other fronts.Which is more powerful? The extension of the gifting experience to the stranger you will never meet and only speculate upon his or her appreciation? Or, the indifference that seems to inevitably spring from depersonalized contact with others? How will the Gifting Principle fare in the robotic age?This is Burning Man. We face such questions openly.Dusty Love, Jeff Vetterick (a.k.a. "Sticky")PS - If you really like this idea, please share the campaign on your preferred social network using the icons at the campaign header, above, or below (mobile).  Shares with a sincere introductory note from you will be especially appreciated.    I hope to meet you, on or off the Playa!

story:
Short Summary

My name is William Mueller, MFA Candidate at Ball State University in ceramics. I make functional ceramic works by 3D Printing my prototypes and casting them in plaster molds, these molds are then used to slip-cast my work. They are all cone 6 fired porcelain with underglaze applied onto the surface. All of the work is fully functional, food safe, dishwasher and microwave safe as well. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am running this campaign to help facilitate the purchase of a Shapeoko CNC Router. I am looking to expand my studio and work with other materials. The coffee stand in the image above is made with cast concrete which has had many issues with its fragility. Using a CNC Router I would be able to fabricate the stand with precision out of wood which would be much more gentle on the clay and better for a countertop. This router could help my studio practice by enabling me to create objects with wood that could not be made with traditional wood working tools. 

By purchasing one of my ceramic works, you would be contributing to a young artist and help me build up my studio. The work in this sale is all very new to me, which is why I am marketing this as a seconds sale. A second, is a perfectly fine and functional ware but may have some small errors, some of the underglaze on the bottom stuck to the kiln shelf while firing leaving a few small white specs. Because of this, the prices are reduced to compensate. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially that does not mean that you can not help this campaign. I would greatly appreciate this link being shared on any social media site as well as to friends and family!

Thank you all so much for your support!

story:
An artist, an icon, a legend: El Diablo needs you!

( en français ci-dessous)

An artist, an icon, a legend, El Diablo is cycling passionate who never miss an opportunity to encourage cyclists from all over the world and make spectators rejoice.

Since 1993, he has travelled the world dressed in his devil costume, his trident in the hand to encourage the greatest cyclists. Passion in the heart, emotions in the head and boundless energy are the three components that make El Diablo the most iconic figure in world cycling. Tour de France, Giro d´Italia, Tour d'Espagne, Critérium de Saitama in Japan, Tour de Suisse and more, DiDi is everywhere to give joy and good mood.

Today he is the one who needs us, and the whole cycling community! With more than 30,000 km per year, his bus, a faithful companion for 15 years, is running out. Difficult to keep up! His bus is more than a means of transport that takes him chugging along the roads to meet cyclists. During the summer season, it is a veritable traveling home, where he sleeps, eats and recharges his batteries. Your donations will help keep the legend alive by offering Didi a new travel companion.

An artist, a legend, an icon, let's help him pursue his dream and give him back a part of all the joy transmitted over nearly 30 years!

 

What will your donations be used for and what you get?

All your donations will be used towards the purchase of a new personalized bus in the colours of its donors. As you wish, you can be part of the adventure by engraving your name or logo on the El Diablo bus or simply donate to your good heart to support the cause. If the dream is achieved and the necessary sum raised, the additional donations will be used for his second dream: the creation of a bicycle museum displaying his spectacular works.

Several packages have been specially designed for you:

DIDI’S FAN

You are a Didi’s fan, offer him 5 euros to reach his dream and be part of the legend!

 

DIDI’S BUS FRIENDS

If you want to have your name engraved on the Didi’s Bus, this package is for you! For an amount of 20 euros you will have your name travelling the whole world to the rhythm of Didi's crazy adventures.

 

DIDI’S BUS TEAM

You are a Team and want to support Didi, this package is made for you! For an amount of 500 euros the logo of your team or your club will travel the whole world to the rhythm of Didi's crazy adventures.

Only 25 places for this package, hurry up and be part of the myth!

 

DIDI’S BUS BRAND

You are a company and want to support Didi, this package is for you! For an amount of 500 euros your logo will travel the whole world to the rhythm of Didi's crazy adventures.

Only 25 places for this package, hurry up and be part of the myth!

 

DIDI’S BUS EVENT

You are an event and wish to support Didi, this package is made for you! For an amount of 500 euros your logo will travel the whole world to the rhythm of Didi's crazy adventures.

Only 25 places for this package, hurry up and be part of the myth!

 

 

 

Learn more about the character

Dieter Senft said Didi Senft, sometimes called El Diablo, born February 7, 1952 in Reichenwalde in Brandenburg (Germany), is known as the devil of the Tour de France. His passion for cycling has become his life. He travels the world to encourage athletes and make the hearts of spectators vibrate.

He is also an outstanding inventor artist. He created many unusual and wacky bikes. He has more than 17th world records for bicycle-related inventions. According to the Guinness Book of Records, DIidi Senft built the largest movable guitar, taking the form of a bicycle, the largest rolling bicycle as well as surprising works of ingenuity like the Mickael Jackson bicycle specially made in homage to the artist or even "Football Bike" created before the Croatia-Germany match during Euro 2008.

 

 

At the source of the idea ​​a friendship like no others

At the source of the idea of ​​this fundraising is a friendship like no others. Three years ago, Diter Senft was invited to a new cycling event, the Tour des Stations. The organizers and El Diablo build a friendship. Each year the team and Didi who comes to diffuse his energy on the event always ready to encourage fans of valiant cyclists reunite themself. The team has also visited him several times in Strorkow in southern Berlin where he lives when he is not on the road. Together they are working on the creation of an international bicycle museum. This year during the 3rd edition of the Tour des Stations, El Diablo expressed his concern about his bus and his low budget. From then on, the organizing committee is committed to help DiDi to keep the myth alive.

***************************************************************************************

Un artiste, une icône, une légende : El Diablo a besoin de vous !

Un artiste, une icône, une légende, El Diablo est un passionné du vélo qui ne loupe pas une occasion pour encourager les cyclistes de monde entier et faire exulter les spectateurs.

Depuis 1993, il sillonne le monde vêtu de son costume de diable et de son trident pour encourager les plus grands cyclistes. La passion dans le cœur, des émotions plein la tête et une énergie débordante ce sont là les trois composantes qui font d’El Diablo le personnage le plus emblématique du cyclisme mondial. Tour de France, Giro d’Italia, Tour d’Espagne, Critérium de Saitama au Japon, Tour de Suisse et bien plus, DiDi est partout pour donner de la joie et de la bonne humeur.

Aujourd’hui c’est lui qui a besoin de nous, et de toute la communauté cycliste ! Avec plus de 30'000 km par année son bus, fidèle compagnon depuis 15 ans, s’épuise. Difficile de tenir le rythme ! Son bus c’est plus qu’un moyen de transport qui l’emmène cahin-caha sur les routes à la rencontre des cyclistes. Durant la saison estivale c’est une véritable maison ambulante, il y dort, mange et s’y ressource. Vos dons permettront de faire vivre la légende en offrant un nouveau compagnon de voyage à Didi.

Un artiste, une légende, une icône, aidons-le à poursuivre son rêve et rendons lui une part de toute la joie transmise durant près de 30 ans!

 

A quoi vont servir vos dons et pourquoi participer ?

Tous vos dons seront utilisés pour l’achat d’un nouveau bus personnalisé aux couleurs de ses donateurs. Selon vos envies vous pourrez faire partie de l’aventure en gravant votre nom ou votre logo sur le bus d’El Diablo ou simplement donner à votre bon cœur pour soutenir la cause. Si le rêve est atteint et la somme nécessaire récoltée, les dons supplémentaires seront utilisés pour son deuxième rêve : la création d’un musée du vélo exposant ses œuvres spectaculaires. 

Plusieurs packages ont été spécialement conçus pour vous :

DIDI’S FAN

Vous êtes un fan de Didi, offrez-lui 5 euros pour atteindre son rêve et faite partie de la légende !

DIDI’S BUS FRIENDS

Vous souhaitez avoir votre nom gravé sur le Bus de Didi, ce package est fait pour vous! Pour un montant de 20 euros votre nom parcourra le monde entier au rythme des folles aventures d'el Diablo 

DIDI’S BUS TEAM

Vous êtes une équipe et souhaitez soutenir Didi, ce package est fait pour vous ! Pour un montant de 500 euros votre logo parcourra le monde entier au rythme des folles aventures de Didi.

Uniquement 25 places pour ce package, dépêchez-vous et faite partie du mythe !

DIDI’S BUS BRAND

Vous êtes une entreprise et souhaitez soutenir Didi, ce package est fait pour vous ! Pour un montant de 500 euros votre logo parcourra le monde entier au rythme des folles aventures de Didi.

Uniquement 25 places pour ce package, dépêchez-vous et faite partie du mythe !

DIDI’S BUS EVENT

Vous êtes un évènement et souhaitez soutenir Didi, ce package est fait pour vous ! Pour un montant de 500 euros votre logo parcourra le monde entier au rythme des folles aventures de Didi.

Uniquement 25 places pour ce package, dépêchez-vous et faite partie du mythe !

 

En savoir plus sur le personnage 

Dieter Senft dit Didi Senft, parfois appelé El Diablo, né le 7 février 1952 à Reichenwalde en Brandebourg (Allemagne), est notamment connu comme le diable du Tour de France. Sa passion pour le cyclisme est devenue sa vie. Il sillonne le monde pour encourager les sportifs et faire vibrer le cœur des spectateurs.

Il est également un artiste inventeur hors pair. Il a créé de nombreux vélos inhabituels et loufoques. Il a plus de 17 records du monde d'inventions liées au vélo. Selon le livre Guinness des records, DIidi Senft a construit la plus grande guitare mobile, prenant la forme d'un vélo, le plus grand vélo roulant ainsi que des œuvres surprenantes d’ingéniosité comme le vélo Mickael Jackson spécialement réalisé en hommage à l’artiste ou encore "Football Bike" créé avant le match Croatie-Allemagne lors de l’Euro 2008.

 

A la source de l’idée une amitié pas comme les autres 

A la source de l’idée de cette récolte de fond réside une amitié pas comme les autres. Il y a trois ans Dieter Senft a été invité sur un nouvel évènement cycliste le Tour des Stations. Les organisateurs de la manifestation et El Diablo se sont liés d’amitié. Chaque année, ce sont de belles retrouvailles entre l’équipe et Didi qui vient diffuser son énergie sur l’épreuve toujours prêt à encourager les valeureux cyclistes amateurs. L’équipe est également allée le voir plusieurs fois à Storkow au sud de Berlin où il vit lorsqu’il n’est pas sur les routes. Ensemble ils travaillent à la réalisation d’un musée international du vélo. Cette année lors de la 3ème édition du Tour des Stations, El Diablo a fait part de son inquiétude concernant son bus et son petit budget. Dès lors, le comité d’organisation s’est engagé à aider DiDi dans sa recherche de fond dans le but de faire vivre le mythe.

story:
Phil Tarley, Round Hole Square Peg 2  at Photo LA 2015

 

A biennial international survey of the queer photographic gaze

2019 LGBTQ exhibitions in major museums include the Metropolitan Museum, the Samuel R. Guggenheim Museum, Museum of Modern Art (MOMA), Boston Museum of Fine Arts, Art Institute of Chicago, Brooklyn Museum, and many more.

Masculine, feminine, non-binary, gender-fluid
— help us tell our story.

And H​elp Us Take the Biggest LGBTQ International Photography Exhibition to PHOTO LA​​

ROUND HOLE SQUARE PEG 4 is an open call, juried photography competition conceived with the intent to acquire a fresh LGBTQ visual culture for the 21st century, and create a new wave of queer art and soul.

As Stonewall 50 passes, LGBTQ persecution intensifies in Trumpian America and all over the world. Through art exhibitions, queer people shout about love, visibility, and activism.   LGBTQ art exhibitions at mainstream art fairs enable queer photographers to show their love, voice their activism, and proclaim their visibility.

Photo by Austin Young

The exhibition opens at PHOTO LA, the longest-running art fair on the west coast (January 30 -February 2, 2020) then moves to West Hollywood for a one-month run (February 8-March 4, 2020). Opening night in West Hollywood will feature a  live art auction to benefit The Trevor Project: the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ youth and the ONE Archives Foundation: a vital resource for showcasing the trailblazing history and rich culture of LGBTQ communities through exhibitions that pull from the largest collection of LGBTQ materials in the world.

We need to raise $6500 and this is where your money will go.

Round Hole Square Peg is the only queer art booth at any of the major international art fairs in the USA.  In the past, a generous $5000 grant from the city of West Hollywood and our entry fees has always covered expenses, but this year Photo LA moved to a more expensive venue and so the cost of a small booth shot up to $6500. For LGBTQ artists a strong appearance at world-class art fairs is important!  Without our presence, we would become invisible.  We are at Photo LA to inspire each other, to inform the popular culture and to make sure we are not overlooked or forgotten.

Our budget for both Photo LA and The West Hollywood gallery exhibitions totals just over $14,000. This includes art installation for both venues, art takedowns, art transport, storage, wall text for both venues and back end costs.

There are three $500 dollars honorariums to three people working on this project for over four months that is also budgeted.  We have volunteers and in-kind aid. There are a few private donors and Phil Tarley has donated his own funds, as well.

The big hump is the $6500 we need for the booth at Photo LA.  This year, the director of Photo LA so believes in the importance of our presence at her art fair, she has given us an extra wall, special booth placement as well as carte blanche with her publicity staff to make sure we get our exhibition and PHOTO LA, some amazing press coverage. We are targeting the New York Times, because of their increased coverage of queer art and issues. From Huffington Post to Out Magazine, you can see a selection of press links on our website. 

Our first Round Hole Square Peg exhibition debuted at Photo LA in 2013. Round Hole Square Peg4 is curated by director Phil Tarley, associate curator Ruben Esparza, and judged by a panel of 5 presitigious  jurors. Check out the website for a short history of LGBTQ photography, interesting bios of our judges and full details on the competition.

website: RoundHoleSquarePeg4.com

Visit us on Facebook

SPONSORS INCLUDE

 

 

 

NEWSFLASH: RECENT PRESS FOR ROUND HOLE SQUARE PEG 4

Advocate Magazine - October 10, 2019

Washington Blade - December 5, 2019

story:
Our purpose in creating the Glam Camp “Glampaign” is to catapult Glam Camp to a national platform. Our initiative is to continue to encourage and empower young girls by ensuring each person a judgement free zone where they can be their most authentic self through the art of self expression and utilizing make-up as the primary tool.

 

 

Glam Camp is a summer day camp created by Celebrity Make-up Artist Aliesha Bree, targeting young girls ages 9-13. During camp each girl will learn makeup techniques from Aliesha Bree, learn to identify with self-love and confidence, and most importantly have fun! At the end of each camp, a selected number of Glampers are asked to join the Glam Camp Team. These girls are recognized as Beauty Influencers, and are known leaders amongst their peers. As part of the team these girls are given the opportunity to co-instruct each Glam Camp, and continue to grow their leadership skills as young women.  Glam Camp is a judgement free zone and we strive to make every “Glamper” feel that energy from the second they arrive at check-in, and up until the very last moment they are with us through Graduation. Each day at Glam Camp is filled with Glam inspired activities including challenges, tutorials, music and dance, and of course LOTS of makeup.

 

 

"The Glow Up is Real" and Glam Camp is coming soon to a city near you, and as part of our Glampaign initiative, we are raising capital to help our expansion for the years to come, while still maintaining the genuine core beliefs of Glam Camp.  

 

 

We love our sponsors, and during our Glam Camp Glampaign we are giving backers the opportunity to not only contribute to our Glampaign, but to also help change lives. Sponsors will receive customized branding on our 2021 Glamp Camp Shirts where shirts will be worn by over 500 Glampers (which equates to 4500 hours or more of brand exposure), and a specialized Hyper-Link on Glam Camp’s website showcasing appreciation for you and or your business. Sponsors will also have the opportunity to send one child to Glam Camp in any of our locations, and forever change a young girl’s life. Please keep in mind Limited sponsorship spaces are available each year.

 

 

  • Purchase of equipment and mass production of supplies needed to expand Glam Camp onto a national platform. This will include, the purchase of backdrops, customized flooring, transportable projector and digital screens, and professional videography and photography.
  • Glampers will receive the same personal experience of Glam Camp, but with a more uniform look in each featured city.
  • This year we are purchasing a Glam Camp trailer and developing a home base to house all of our supplies for each week of Camp.
  • Beauty Influencers will be traveling with us as we take Glam Camp National. Housing travel, and food is provided for each Beauty Influencer joining us on the road.
  • The upcoming year is all about branding! Glam Camp will be launching the first ever Glam Camp Product Line. This collection of products is inspired by a combination of our beautiful Glampers, and the Glam Camp brand itself.  It is specifically curated to fit the needs of age and social demographics within the camp year.

story: All the components of the CaliRainMaker are already proven and on the market except for the condensing compartment which is the part that I patented. I will use the money to build a prototype in order to demonstrate the concept and look for potential investors and customers. Which should not be hard, remember it is about making this kind of machines the standard of the future. To have as many as cars so that the dependency of natural rain can be washed away.

story:
Hello there! My name is JunTwei, a freelance illustrator from Malaysia. All these adorable woofers were personally hand painted and then scanned to be made into charms. Woofers in Parfait charms is my very first crowdfunding project. (^^)

You can find my works here on Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, Twitter.

Please feel free to drop by.

 

I need your help to get these 5 woofers designs made into adorable charms!

They will be 6cm, single acrylic board with a double printed image (mirrored).

Above (from clockwise) we have the Shiba Inu, Husky, German Shepherd, Samoyed, and Corgi.

– =͟͟͞͞ ( ꒪౪꒪)ฅ✧ UPDATE! NEW WOOFERS COMING THROUGH! – =͟͟͞͞ ( ꒪౪꒪)ฅ✧

˭̡̞(◞⁎˃ᆺ˂)◞*✰ You can now choose 3 new woofers designs to adopt ^-^ , from left to right we have the French Terrier , Golden Retriever and King Charles Spaniel !

Here's a design of the mock-up keychain. ╰(・∇・╰)

 

Do note that these charms might differ slightly from my mock-up.

I will be using a company that offers acrylic keychains services that produce good quality keychains for over 7 years.

Here are some of their previous samples! ヾ(｡･ω･｡)

 

Bringing these baby woofers will be pretty costly and as such, here's the breakdown of the expenses.

  • Keychains Production: $280
  • Shipment from supplier to me: $ 25 
  • Estimated Shipment to customers: $200+
  • 5% Indiegogo fee
  • 3-5% Credit card + banking fees

Feel free to message me if you have any questions about this ^-^  and I will try my best to reply you.

Here are some stretch goals I have created and am hoping to achieve!

At $300, 3 new designs will be added!

At $800, each backer will be rewarded a free die cut woofer stickers(random). ଘ(੭ˊ꒳ˋ)੭✧

For every keychain you back, you will get one random die cut sticker.

 

Q: When/How do I choose the charm I want?

A: After the campaign is over, a 'Choose your Woofie' survey will be sent to every backer. This ensures everyone can choose their favourite charms at the end of the campaign.

Q: When will I get my charm? How will it be shipped? 

A: The tentative date to ship the charms out would be August. This is inclusive of the timeline for processing/shipping + survey collection. 

All packages will be sent via POSLAJU, with a tracking number and will take about 2 weeks to arrive. I ensure to keep all our lovely backers posted if there are any updates. 

Q: Is the shipping free?

A: Yes , it is free shipping worldwide as long as you are one of the backers.

Q: What happens if I want more to adopt more than 8 Woofers ?

A: Just email me at fjtwei@gmail.com , I will make you a special perk! 

Q: Will you cancel this project if you do not hit the targeted fund?

A: No, Woofers in Parfaits will not be canceled because I'm determined to see this through. The expenses will be readjusted together with the collected amount to ensure every backer receives their baby woofers. (U・x・U)

Q: What size are the charms? 

A: They are 2.5 inch / 6cm charm. These charms will have a one-sided acrylic board and a double printed image. 

Risks & Challenges

This is my first Indiegogo campaign and I'm really excited to launch it! ୧༼◕ ᴥ ◕༽୨ 

Things might not always go the way one wants it to be but I am determined to bring these babies to life and I hope you guys are too! 

Thank you for believing in me! I hope that my woofers will be adopted into your lovely homes.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any assistance is very much appreciated, financial or non-financial wise. I would truly appreciate it if you can help share this campaign in any of your social media. Every share you help me would mean a great deal to me as a freelance illustrator.

story:
The International Museum of Art - Texas History

To Texans, there is nothing more important than preserving their history. To El Pasoans, being a city resting along the border of Texas and Mexico, our history is more unique than most. Often referred to as the Ellis Island of the south, more than 1,000,000 visitors enter into the United States each month through El Paso ports of entry to work, learn at our schools, colleges and universities, and to enjoy our beautiful city.

Who manages the Museum? The International Association for the Visual Arts, a Texas nonprofit 501 (c) 3 volunteer organization.

In the early days, the El Paso Art Museum Association, a volunteer citizen group, oversaw the museum's operations and also assisted in funding purchases for the El Paso Museum of Art's collection which was housed in the Turney home until a new museum was built closer to downtown. It was proposed to City officials by Mrs. Turney that her home remain a museum under the Association's leadership and remain separate from the City of El Paso Museum of Art. The City of El Paso currently leases the Turney home to the International Association for the Visual Arts (formerly the El Paso Art Museum Association).

Project Summary

As most of you know, the most important reason for any museum to exist is to collect and preserve a community's history. Within these confines lies the obligatory duty to keep precise records of its entire collection and to provide provenance, a place of origin or earliest known history of an object, to help tell its story. It is also important that a museum know the value of each and every object, and whether or not the object fits within their mission. It is also very important that a museum properly cares for their collection. Does the facility live up to modern museum standards regarding it being a temperature-controlled environment. 

The International Museum of Art is moving forward to assure each of these points of interest come to be. The museum is going back to its roots and examining its entire collection. That is the goal of this proposed project. What exactly do we have? Where is it located? What is its condition? How is it stored? How can we better present our collection to the citizens of El Paso and our visitors from around the globe? 

In order for us to represent El Paso, Texas in its best light we need to know everything there is to know about every object we own. This is our goal. The more we know about our history the more you will know. 

This is a huge undertaking. One that we are very excited about. We look forward to you joining our team and assisting in the unveiling of even more El Paso history.

Thank you.

What we are requesting ... and ... What you will receive

1) Cataloging the collection. The collection consists of 10,000 objects. Broken into specific categories it consists of several historical sculptures created from bronze, porcelain, wood, jade, glass, and marble. The art collection dates back to the 1700s. Additional collections consist of the Kolliker collection, African artifacts, and Western Art. There is also an impressive collection of Shakyamuni Buddha statues. Buddha, as you probably know, was an ordinary person named Siddhartha Gautama whose profound insights continue to inspire the world even today. Throughout the museum is a beautiful collection of antique furniture. A Mexican Revolution exhibit and authentic Mexican and Polish dolls. The museum is also home to Asian woodblock prints and Japanese silk screens.

Cataloging the collection is estimated to cost $5,000.

2) Estimating the value of the collection.

Under the direction of a collections assessment manager, volunteers will photograph, index and evaluate every object. Estimated cost $10,000.

3) Proper storage of the collection. Acid free boxes and paper. Museum quality shelving. Estimated cost $5,000.

Please Note: If you use Internet Explorer you will NOT be able to make a donation through this site.  We also realize there are some donors who do not wish to make their contribution online. In either case, please feel free to mail your contribution to the International Museum of Art, 1211 Montana Ave. El Paso, TX 79902. Please write Indiegogo Campaign in the memo. Thank you.

The BIG Prize!

Once our Indiegogo program has come to a close by mid-May, all participants will be invited to a private reception for the International Museum of Art's featured summer exhibit, The Reclusionist.

This abstract impressionism exhibit will feature several works from reclusive El Paso artist James Robert Murphy, featured throughout these pages. Mr. Murphy is an award winning author and singer/songwriter who has called El Paso his home since 2004. 

The Reclusionist

Mr. Murphy earned an M.A. from the University of Oklahoma. He was employed by the City of El Paso as the development director for the El Paso Museum of History for a dozen years prior to his retirement in 2017. During his employment he raised well over $1M for the museum and its foundation in support of a variety of community programs. Raising funds for their permanent collection was one of these programs. Now, after retiring, and realizing the importance of an archived collection, his focus has turned to supporting the International Museum of Art. Mr. Murphy is also the founding member of the New York State Blues Festival which began in 1992. He served as festival director for 12 years. It continues to be one of Syracuse, NY's main festivals more than 25 years after it began.

Please join the Board of Directors in this passionate plea for support. With your help we can increase public awareness to one of El Paso's most precious museum collections.

Risk and Challenges

These days it seems there are a thousand and one organizations seeking financial and volunteer support. How does one decide where to offer assistance? We all lead such busy lives and barely have time for any extra curricular activities much less providing financial support to another worthy organization. We understand exactly how you feel. We, as a volunteer Board of Directors, are in the same boat. 

But those of you who are taking the time to read through our story already have an interest in the arts and we truly appreciate that. Our goal, the big picture, the main focus of this request, is to better preserve Texas history. The goal of this campaign is to provide a true and interesting backstory about the International Museum of Art. We want to bring forward the way in which we care for and understand our permanent collection. It is so important for us to accomplish this. The Board of Directors asked themselves, "How can we better serve our El Paso community? How can we better serve our youth, our membership and our visitors?" The answer? By presenting our artifacts to the public in the most professional manner available. By providing quality information about the Museum's history and all that lies within our walls. By reaching out to the community and inviting them to experience what it is we have to offer. By encouraging our community members to use our facility for their special events. By letting our community know we are here for them. We want to be the best for you.

Other ways you can help...

We also realize that not everyone can make a financial commitment. Not everyone can volunteer. To those who are already burdened with so many other projects, we want you to know you can still help us. Help us spread the word about this very special campaign to your friends, your relatives and your colleagues. We really do look forward to hearing from you.

Thank You!

Under the direction of a collections assessment manager, volunteers will photograph, index and evaluate every object. Estimated cost $10,000.
3) Proper storage of the collection. Acid free boxes and paper. Museum quality shelving. Estimated cost $5,000.
Please Note: If you use Internet Explorer you will NOT be able to make a donation through this site.  We also realize there are some donors who do not wish to make their contribution online. In either case, please feel free to mail your contribution to the International Museum of Art, 1211 Montana Ave. El Paso, TX 79902. Please write Indiegogo Campaign in the memo. Thank you.
The BIG Prize!
Once our Indiegogo program has come to a close by mid-May, all participants will be invited to a private reception for the International Museum of Art's featured summer exhibit, The Reclusionist.
This abstract impressionism exhibit will feature several works from reclusive El Paso artist James Robert Murphy, featured throughout these pages. Mr. Murphy is an award winning author and singer/songwriter who has called El Paso his home since 2004. 

The Reclusionist

Mr. Murphy earned an M.A. from the University of Oklahoma. He was employed by the City of El Paso as the development director for the El Paso Museum of History for a dozen years prior to his retirement in 2017. During his employment he raised well over $1M for the museum and its foundation in support of a variety of community programs. Raising funds for their permanent collection was one of these programs. Now, after retiring, and realizing the importance of an archived collection, his focus has turned to supporting the International Museum of Art. Mr. Murphy is also the founding member of the New York State Blues Festival which began in 1992. He served as festival director for 12 years. It continues to be one of Syracuse, NY's main festivals more than 25 years after it began.
Please join the Board of Directors in this passionate plea for support. With your help we can increase public awareness to one of El Paso's most precious museum collections.

Risk and Challenges
These days it seems there are a thousand and one organizations seeking financial and volunteer support. How does one decide where to offer assistance? We all lead such busy lives and barely have time for any extra curricular activities much less providing financial support to another worthy organization. We understand exactly how you feel. We, as a volunteer Board of Directors, are in the same boat. 
But those of you who are taking the time to read through our story already have an interest in the arts and we truly appreciate that. Our goal, the big picture, the main focus of this request, is to better preserve Texas history. The goal of this campaign is to provide a true and interesting backstory about the International Museum of Art. We want to bring forward the way in which we care for and understand our permanent collection. It is so important for us to accomplish this. The Board of Directors asked themselves, "How can we better serve our El Paso community? How can we better serve our youth, our membership and our visitors?" The answer? By presenting our artifacts to the public in the most professional manner available. By providing quality information about the Museum's history and all that lies within our walls. By reaching out to the community and inviting them to experience what it is we have to offer. By encouraging our community members to use our facility for their special events. By letting our community know we are here for them. We want to be the best for you.

Other ways you can help...
We also realize that not everyone can make a financial commitment. Not everyone can volunteer. To those who are already burdened with so many other projects, we want you to know you can still help us. Help us spread the word about this very special campaign to your friends, your relatives and your colleagues. We really do look forward to hearing from you.
Thank You!

story:
An American Legacy

The Blue Ox Veterans Program is building an “Icon of Freedom” for our nation; the hearse that carried President Lincoln for the final leg of his national funeral procession. The hearse will be the centerpiece during the 150th anniversary commemorative ceremonies to be held in Springfield, Illinois May 1-3, 2015.

The Lincoln Funeral Coalition event mission statement is: To educate, coordinate and promote the accurate and dignified re-enactment of the historic anniversary of Abraham Lincoln’s funeral procession in Springfield, Illinois. The hearse is featured on the 2015 event tab at www.LincolnFuneralCoalition.org

The Blue Ox Veterans under the direction of Eric Hollenbeck, the founder of Blue Ox Millworks and a Vietnam Veteran, have been working from the only known photograph as the original hearse was destroyed by fire. They are recreating the hearse wooden frame and chamber which will be finished in maple. They are also recreating original molds for all the decorative details which are cast in aluminum then gold and silver leafed.

Jay Jones of Custom Wagons (CustomWagons.com) is currently fabricating the rolling chassis and is a Vietnam Veteran as well. Lead Builder and Vietnam Veteran Jack G. Feather, of Tombstone Hearse and Trike Company (TombstoneHearse.com) is the skilled finisher who will assemble the chassis, interior and finish the hearse. After the event the elaborate hearse will be in the custodial care of www.StaabFamilyLivery.com

A School For Veterans

The Blue Ox Historic Park has always been a place of healing. For the last fifteen years Blue Ox has served as a community high school program, allowing at-risk teens an opportunity to learn in a project-based environment. This newest Blue Ox Program represents a long standing commitment to create a safe haven for veterans allowing them an opportunity to develop a new self-identity through meaningful hands-on craftsmanship.

These veterans, who have served our country in Iraq and Afghanistan among other places, have found a sense of peace and of healing by working on this project. "It’s my church," says Mercedes Cangas. "My children’s children will be able to see this hearse and say ‘My daddy worked on this’," says Andrew Olufsen.

The Blue Ox Veterans Program is part of the non-profit Blue Ox Historic Village and School. We are soliciting funds to maintain the Veterans Program for the 2015 spring semester. More information about Blue Ox is available on www.blueoxmill.com as well as on Blue Ox channel on YouTube and on Facebook: Blue Ox Village

What We Need & What You Get

The Blue Ox School for Veterans is just beginning our Veterans School and need additional funds to finish out the 2015 spring semester. In appreciation donors will receive:

  • An 8 x 10 photograph of the finished hearse, signed by the Veterans

  • A commemorative casting of a detail from the Lincoln Hearse

  • A commemorative casting of the Eagle detail from the Lincoln Hearse


A Brighter Future

We have been incredibly honored by the opportunity to work with these American service men and women.  This program makes a difference, not only in their lives but in the lives of the larger community. We intend that the Lincoln Hearse will be the first step in a long-term veterans program at Blue Ox.

Please help us prove to potential sponsors that this kind of program has the support of the community at large.  Help us bring history alive and change the future at the same time.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please help share the word about this campaign.  If you are interested in learning more about Blue Ox Village or Blue Ox School for Veterans, please email us at info@blueoxmill.com.

story:
We live in a fantasy world, a world of illusion. The great task in life is to find reality.

Meet our Art Sphere Illusion lamp

This (5mm ) 2D acrylic light will force you to think that you are seeing 3D objects.

I am a product designer (Shanm- software engineer) , who spends  2/3 rd of salary to try out something new :(

I love to make 3d illusion and funny products .

Few samples ..

Book Art :

Are you able to read "Read" in the book??

I fold each and individual pages in the book and can make any name or Date or sculpture.




Have you seen this Cereal killer?

I personally engrave funny quotes in the spoon to bring smiles in dinning table :)

  • I am reaching out to help me to produce  these cool lights without outsourcing.

What makes this ArtSphere lights unique?

You can surprise or gift your friends with this cool 3D design light.

  • Interchangeable design- you can change any design you want with the same wooden base.
  • Low Power consumption-I use branded LED's which lasts upto 60-100k hours.

Available designs :




Sizes :

The size of the Artsphere lights vary from design to design.
Approximately 
Height = 12 inch (30 cm )
Width = 8 inch (20 cm)


Materials used :
  •  5 mm High quality Acrylic sheets engraved and cut with high quality CNC machines.
  • Hand crafted wooden base
  • Samsung or equivalent LED lamps - 50k hours .
Interchangeable :
I have designed this lamp to be changeable, what you need to do is take out the existing design(example skull)  from the base and replace it with a new design(Example :Bulb or spiral or Infinity).


SKULL :


BULB:


SPIRAL :


BALLOON :


INFINITY :


CHEETAH :


Risk and Challenges :

I have personally verified and created the product from the scratch to end and I personally feel there is no risk at this moment.

Estimates :


Note: The entire design is not my creativity,I got  inspired by cheha and other designers and put down my own creativity as well.

story:
10/25

Perks are coming in and we'll be shipping soon!

-Rich

 

A 40 ft. egg shaped lookout tower overlooking center camp and surrounded by an 8000 sq.ft. shaded dance floor.

We met our minimum and Caledonia will be happening!  

But... it turns out, one flatbed trailer isn't enough.  We need to purchase or borrow another.  We're also hoping to light this for night.  Your contribution will go toward the 2nd trailer expenses and lighting costs.  It's going to be a glowing beacon at night, visible from anywhere on the playa!  Help us get there!

 

8/15 Update:

Caledonia under construction!  This thing is bigger than we'd ever imagined.  We're questioning our own sanity.  The flatbed we purchased is not enough to move it.  We need another.  Anyone have one they could loan us?  

I'm hoping we raise a bit more just to keep Grant's head from exploding. :)

 The photo below is one of the small towers... that is a small tower?!  The big onemakes this guy look tiny.

For reference, Grant is a little over 6'-0".

 

We had tons of volunteers working through the night all of last weekend.  Saturday night there were 14 people working from 10pm until after sunrise!  We plan on doing that again this weekend.

 

Thanks you!

-Rich

Caledonia

Caledonia is a huge egg-shaped lookout tower that will be open to the entire Burning Man community, right next to center camp...but only if we can raise $4k to finish the guardrails and facade.  SpinCycle (theme camp for hoopers) is funding 70% of the expenses for Caledonia; we're asking for your help to raise the last 30%.  

This is SpinCycle's fourth year on the playa.  SpinCycle provides a home for hoopers at Burning Man, hosting hoopjams and other events.  Caledonia was designed by Rich Porter, an architect and one of the SpinCycle organizers.

 Where are the funds going?

The basic structure has already been funded.  The trusses, shade sails, sound system... we've been able to purchase that already.  The facades and guardrails, required for the aesthetic and safety of the project, require additional financial support.  We're out of cash, so Caldenia cannot be gifted to our beautiful community without your support.

Who is building this? 

SpinCycle is a Burning Man theme camp organized by Rich Porter and Grant Leonard and home to about a hundred others each year.  Together they've built large scale festival environments for over 6 years, recently completing Oysterfest alongside the Do Lab.  They have done shade lighting and sound for HoopCamp  every year and continue to expand the reach of their unique tensile structure environments.

 Rich's practiced architecture for 5 years before leaving the field to pursue hooping full-time.  He now runs an edtech startup with his brother Rob.  The first time he hooped as an adult was the first day he met Grant Leonard.

 Grant is a musician, contractor, and hooper from San Luis Obispo, CA.  As the bass player for Tropo, he tours california playing gigs , having opened for Random Rab and many others.  Tropo will be headlining Rise Festival and HoopCamp in 2012.  

Together, Rich and Grant have built large shadeddance floors at Burning Man for the last 5 years, anywhere from 2000 to 6000 sq. ft. 

 

What you get for your contribution:

Sticker

 

Water Bottle

Glow in the dark hoop

Dudes of Hooping Calendar 

Lasercut lamp sculpture

story:
Hello one and all! We want to announce the opening of our Indiegogo campaign to support the King Jelly Art Car. You may have seen its brilliant lights, or even reclined on its white furry cushions last burn. Or even been on it when it broke down. 
  We decided to return it to full life and health, and want to ask you for support. The rear differential needed gears reground and new bearings, the 36V electric motor needed rebuilding, and the ancient resistor coil speed controller needed replacing with a modern solid state high amperage speed controller. Last year it worked up to a point, this year we plan daily and nightly use of our machine! 
  Lighting! We have stepped up to new flexible water proof fully programmable and assignable lighting strips. Last year was gorgeous, this year is going to be out of this world! 
  Our sound system last year was small. This year we plan a four Mackie and a sub system with a DJ booth, to better create sound scenes! 
  Our trailer was open to the air last year, and required the King Jelly to be disassmbled for transport. This year we plan to enclose that trailer so the King Jelly can arrive en playa fully made and ready to go. And the trailer will serve as its home, so the King Jelly can be used to add to the vibe of any number of events, from DeCompressions to ReCompressions to Art Walks, and much more! 
    Last but not least we would love some help paying for all the fuel it takes to get it to the playa and back as well as what it takes for the generators to run the sound system and provide juice for the batteries.
  We'd like to ask you to support our venture and dream.
