Hello one and all! We want to announce the opening of our Indiegogo campaign to support the King Jelly Art Car. You may have seen its brilliant lights, or even reclined on its white furry cushions last burn. Or even been on it when it broke down. 
  We decided to return it to full life and health, and want to ask you for support. The rear differential needed gears reground and new bearings, the 36V electric motor needed rebuilding, and the ancient resistor coil speed controller needed replacing with a modern solid state high amperage speed controller. Last year it worked up to a point, this year we plan daily and nightly use of our machine! 
  Lighting! We have stepped up to new flexible water proof fully programmable and assignable lighting strips. Last year was gorgeous, this year is going to be out of this world! 
  Our sound system last year was small. This year we plan a four Mackie and a sub system with a DJ booth, to better create sound scenes! 
  Our trailer was open to the air last year, and required the King Jelly to be disassmbled for transport. This year we plan to enclose that trailer so the King Jelly can arrive en playa fully made and ready to go. And the trailer will serve as its home, so the King Jelly can be used to add to the vibe of any number of events, from DeCompressions to ReCompressions to Art Walks, and much more! 
    Last but not least we would love some help paying for all the fuel it takes to get it to the playa and back as well as what it takes for the generators to run the sound system and provide juice for the batteries.
  We'd like to ask you to support our venture and dream.

story:
About our camp:

We are happy to announce that this is our 6th year running our summer camp. The good news is that we are funded by the Status of Women to deliver the expressive art workshops. The bad news is that we can't run the camp without raising matching funds. 

This is where YOU can make a difference, we are counting on your help and support to help the youth continue to receive the benefits of the Art & Leadership summer camp.

Our camp is broken down like this:

Week 1: Understanding Equity & Social Gender Roles
Week 2: Understanding Oppression -Power and Control Tactics, Exploring the Cycle of Abuse, and Discussing Issues around Body Image
Week 3: Leadership & Empowerment- Celebrating diverse women and our achievements

Impact: 

We always strive to provide a dynamic experience to the youth by enabling them to explore these topics through the use of media, technology, expressive art (graffiti, drawling, painting, playback theatre, etc) and recreational activities.

"The summer camp was a learning experience for me. I learned to appreciate my body and that we are all unique because we all have different characteristics. My favourite part were the field trips with the other girls. Before I came to the camp I was really shy. Being able to talk to the other girls without being critiqued made me feel relaxed. I really looked forward to camp everyday!" - Yanet, 17

“When I heard about the opportunity to be a part of the PSA's for MUJER I really saw that as a chance to reach out to some of the young women in my community and tell them that they aren't alone. I thought that using this type of media was a perfect way to reach out to young Latinas. I felt really empowered about what I was a part of that day and would love to be a part of something like this in the future.” – Adriana, 18

 
Participants of MUJER's Art & Leadership Summer Camp:
- receive a fully bilingual (English/Spanish) languauge experience throughout the summer camp
- increased self-esteem (by exposing them positive Latin American rolemodels, mentors and facilitators from the community)
- gain an understanding of gender equity
- become more aware and comfortable with their bodies
- learn leadership development
 

                 Your contribution will help us do this! 

What we Need:

All the funds we raise will go directly towards recruitment and outreach, programming resources (art supplies, games, snacks, pool access, and t-shirts) and providing transportation for the participants.

Outreach $900

Transportation ($2 x 20 particpants x 15 days x 2 tickets daily) = $1200

Programming Services $700

Lunch - (tentatively) will be donated by Second Harvest (www.secondharvest.com)

Snacks $500

***if you have trouble completing contribution through paypal contact coordinator@mujer.ca directly***

Short Summary:

MUJER is a non-profit organization that promotes the integral development of Latin women and youth in Canada. 

Website: www.mujer.ca
Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/latinamericanwomen
Twitter: @MUJEROrg
Youtube:  http://www.youtube.com/user/MUJERlatinaMUJER

Objective:

To advocate for the elimination of barriers against all Latin women in Canada and to promote the representation of Latin American women at all social and political levels within Canadian society. 

We provide:

- Leadership training for women 
- workshops on topics of violence against women, self-esteem, immigration & refugee
- we provide updated information and links to appropriate services and resources for Latin-American women in Canada
- research on issues of violence and immigration related to Latin-American women

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't underestimate the power of your voice. Help us promote this campaign through your social networking sites. Tweet, post on your facebook your friends, email the link or just use good old word of mouth!!! :)

MUJER is a non-profit organization that promotes the integral development of Latin women and youth in Canada. 
Website: www.mujer.ca

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/latinamericanwomen

Twitter: @MUJEROrg
Youtube:  http://www.youtube.com/user/MUJERlatinaMUJER

Objective:
To advocate for the elimination of barriers against all Latin women in Canada and to promote the representation of Latin American women at all social and political levels within Canadian society. 
We provide:
- Leadership training for women 
- workshops on topics of violence against women, self-esteem, immigration & refugee
- we provide updated information and links to appropriate services and resources for Latin-American women in Canada
- research on issues of violence and immigration related to Latin-American women

Other Ways You Can Help


Don't underestimate the power of your voice. Help us promote this campaign through your social networking sites. Tweet, post on your facebook your friends, email the link or just use good old word of mouth!!! :)

story:
A promotional video on GAUDIYA NRITYA- the classical dance of Bengal

The story so far...

A dance form was lost in the sands of time. One individual labored hard for many years, studied the scriptures, travelled to remote locations to study the carvings on ancient temples. She persevered, gave it her all and dedicated her life to this art. The result? The art is now revived, and reborn.

All this sounds like a good plot for a movie, but it isn’t. It is true. The individual is Guru Sreemati Dr. Mahua Mukherjee. And the art form is called Gaudiya Nritya, the classical dance of Bengal, India.

When we at Gadurr Media first heard of this story, we were not too impressed. We didn’t realize the importance of this struggle. But then we met Dr. Mukherjee, we heard the story of her struggle in her own words. We learnt of her dedication and conviction, of her ventures into the unknown, pursuing a dream that not many thought possible, and of the three decades of her perseverance. And it is then that we  realized the enormity of it all.

We did our research, saw hours and hours of performances, visited  temples in remote parts of Bengal, and read through research papers and books (yes, a lot of books). We saw the efforts that the artists put in on a daily basis, in spite of having more pressing educational commitments. Here were MBBS, M.Tech and Phd students, traveling all across India and performing in less than agreeable conditions, just because of their love for this art.

Thats when we decided that we needed to do something about it. The story had to be told. The message had to be spread. The art had to get its long-due recognition. Thats why we decided to take this up as our first social responsibility initiative. Thats why we are here on Indiegogo.


What do we want to achieve?

  • Increase awareness of this classical dance form, within the Bengali community, the Indian art lovers and classical art lovers worldwide
  • Recognition for Gaudiya Nritya- the art, the artists and the pioneer Dr. Mahua Mukherjee
  • Preservation of this ancient tradition
  • Increase awareness of this wonderful journey of over thirty years of Dr. Mukherjee and celebrate her dedication to this art
  • Increase in the number of persons practicing the art, both in India and worldwide

How do we plan to go about it?

We have already swung into action. A detailed website and social media presence has been created so that our message can reach people far and wide. Please visit us at

www.gaudiyanritya.org

 and send us your comments and suggestions. 

You can stay tuned in to our facebook page at 

www.facebook.com/GaudiyaNritya

and follow us on Twitter at

www.twitter.com/GaudiyaNritya

The next stage of our campaign is to create a documentary and a promotional video for Gaudiya Nritya. We are already halfway through the documentary and in the pre-production stage for the promotional video. With your support, we can shoot this promotional video (of 180 seconds) and approach sponsors for broadcasting this video on regional and national channels in India. 

You can view our detailed plans and its progress at 

www.gaudiyanritya.org/an-appeal


How will your contribution be utilized?



The Impact

With your support, we will be able to create a medium of reaching out to a big section of art lovers both in India and abroad. Today, Bharatnatyam is a name that  is synonymous with classical dance in India; there are other classical dances too that are part of our rich tradition and heritage. Gaudiya Nritya is one of them. 

Help us realize our dream of reaching out to the masses. Of giving Gaudiya Nritya the recognition it deserves.

Help us spread the word!

It isn't only about contributing. Please help us get the word out, make some noise about our campaign and our promotional video!

Share this campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, your website, your community blog and wherever else you can!

Send us information you think we need to have. Help us ask questions we may have missed and point us in the right direction! This video is yours to build as well. (contact information at the bottom of the page) .

Every little bit you do goes a long way in helping our cause. The cause of the art, of the artists. As recognition of your generosity, we will thank you in our own special way- by sending you rewards that will always remind you that you were part of a project that helped preserve the tradition that our ancestors have left for us!

What are my payment options

International contributors (Outside India)

Option 1: via PayPal

Option 2: via Credit Card

Indian Contributors

Only via Credit Card

* If you face difficulties making a contribution or would like to choose an alternate method of payment, please feel free to contact us directly via e-mail on connect@gaudiyanritya.org. You can also give us a call on +91 98366 86668.

Payment FAQs on Indiegogo

How do people contribute via PayPal?

To make a contribution using PayPal, the contributor can either sign in to a PayPal account or elect to "Pay as a Guest." If someone chooses "Pay as a Guest", they can use a credit card without having a Paypal account. For instructions on how to Pay as a Guest on PayPal, please visit: How to Contribute via PayPal without a PayPal Account.

Which cards does Indiegogo accept?

Indiegogo accepts Visa, Mastercard, Discover, and American Express. At this time, we do not accept prepaid cards.

When is the payment charged to the contributor's account?

Contributions made by credit card are debited from the contributor's card immediately. 


Meet the team!

Gadurr Media is a NewMedia company based in Kolkata and Bangalore, India. Being a media company, we believe strongly in using the power of media to increase awareness in the masses, be it for a product or for a cause. You can read more about us at

www.gadurr.com

Social responsibility forms an integral part of Gadurr Media. We aim to bring to the forefront issues that are traditionally neglected by mainstream media. While we all appreciate fine arts, traditional art forms and handicrafts, a majority of us are unaware of the plight of the very people bringing us these traditions and keeping them alive. At Gadurr Media, we plan to take up some of these issues and assist them in all ways that we can. Gaudiya Nritya is one such social initiative of ours.

You can read about our social responsibility projects at

www.gadurr.com/responsibility

The team at Gadurr Media has worked in tandem with the artists of Gaudiya Nritya to bring to you the fantastic photos that you see on our website. We are currently working on both the documentary and the promotional video. Do visit our team page at

www.gaudiyanritya.org/team

story:
MBD Studio 

Davide "MaestroBD" La Greca is a Rope Artist and Bondage Teacher. Known for his skills and passion for ropes. He start teaching bondage in the 2006 in Rome.
He currently teachs all over Europe, performing onstage as leading fetish artist.

Beatrice "Red Lily" Gigliuto is an  italian rigger who has grown in MaestroBD's school. She cherrishs the  emotional  side in bondage art, and her shows are both passionate and tender. 

As a team, we work and perform together.
We are theBondageManagement Agency.

We are currently opening a Bondage Studio, an atelier for teaching, performing.

A place for bonding, sharing, shooting photosets, and building. 
With the help of our friends.

For that help we are currently calling upon.

We are usually independent, as in we build most of the gear we employ, on our own.
Our Studio, however, could use some extra help: a professional touch for upkeep, renovation and conditioning.

We especially value the comfort of the artists and professionals working with us.
So we put our eyes on a Daikin Air Conditioning system; never sweat the close ones.
Our plumbings could use fixing as well - and that does not come any cheaper

We need:

                1500 Euros for buy a Daikin 5kW(18.000 Btu) Air condition sistem

                  400 Euros for installation work by professional

                1100 Euros for a new idraulic sistem in the bathroom by professional

The most important things is the air conditioning, so we start with that.

Perks

Contributors: we offer Bondage video and photosets - on request. 
We can rely on several models and two renowned riggers.

We can make your Bondage Desire come true.

Think up a pose, we'll send you a photoset, or a video, for your eyes only. Of course strictly NO PORN, just art and celebration of beauty.


We put our thoughts and efforts to build upon this collective project.

Please, help us make it true.

story:
Dear Friends,

I have started this fundraiser for the purpose of raising enough money to start a new and exciting life in Berlin, Germany.  I have always known that my heart belonged in Europe, but never trusted myself enough to take such a gigantic step in my personal growth.  Now that I am nearing twenty-five years old, I have decided that I deserve to shape my life to be as enriched and beautiful as I can and let my heart lead me to Berlin, where I will pursue my career as a freelance photographer and artist.

Here are some examples of my drawings:

     

      

      

Flickr (this is new and is being updated!): Portrait Examples

Goals and Stuff!:

I am not able to pay for this ticket on my own, due to personal issues inhibiting me from being able to work at a "real job" and raise enough money in time for May, so I thought a fundraiser with perks in exchange for donations would be more "official" and the best option for raising funds.

I have set my goal to cover the majority of the cost of a round-trip plane ticket from Portland, Oregon to Berlin, Germany ($1,200). I am required to purchase a return ticket as well in order to apply for a permanent visa to work and reside in Berlin (to prove that I will be returning to America if my visa application is somehow denied). 

Other Ways You Can Help:

This is the most life-changing and monumental decision I have ever - or will ever - make, and any way you are able to help spread the word would be the loveliest thing!

I will update this section with some links within the next few days. <3

story:
What is The Picture Us Project

You’ve browsed the fashion sites and blogs, you’ve written comments, you’ve clicked the like buttons, you’ve shared the latest fashion trends with friends … now it’s time for you to be in the spotlight.  

The Picture Us is a project that blurs the fine line between art and fashion, where you (the follower of fashion and style) have an active role in the creative process. The brainchild of London based artist, luxury accessories designer and leather artisan Alexandru Adam and his sister Ruxandra Adam, it features a collaboration with internationally acclaimed blogger and photo journalist Yvan Rodic, the man behind Facehunter.

Our Story

One November afternoon, while I (Alexandru) was chatting to my sister, Ruxandra, about the role of the audience in fashion and design we came up with the idea of a project that extends the role of the audience from spectator to active participant in creating fashion pieces. Seeing how the trend of the ‘selfie’ exploded overnight, we realized that individuals like you have a creative side worthy of being seen. We contacted Yvan Rodic and presented him the concept over lunch. He loved the idea and The Picture Us Project was born.

What is the project and how can you take part?

Take a ‘Selfie’

Selfie (Plural selfies)- a genre of self-portrait photograph, typically taken with a hand-held digital camera or a smartphone camera.

Take your smartphone, tablet, camera and take a ‘selfie’ expressing one of six emotions and submit them to the project’s website www.ThePictureUsProject.com.  (Make sure you read the requirements carefully: white background, portrait only).

You have up to 6 categories of emotions you can choose from: happiness, sadness, anger, surprise, disgust (repulsion) and confusion.

The Site

Alexandru Adam and Yvan Rodic will select which photos will make it to the site and you will have a chance to see your selfies among others on the site.
 

The Print

This is not a regular digital print. It’s a fine art silk-screen print, done by hand - the same process used by pop artists such as Andy Warhol, Roy Lichtenstein and Robert Rauschemberg in their works, to name but a few. 

Your ‘Selfie’ and Your Bag

If your selfies have been selected to be shown on www.ThePictureUsProject.com then you have a chance to also purchase a bag with your face among a collage of other faces.  The bags have been designed by designer Alexandru Adam in collaboration with Yvan Rodic and can be bought here.

The Bags

You have the option of buying one of 2 designs: The Weekender and The Backpack.  Additionally you have the option of choosing from 4 colour combinations for each: salmon pink or grey for the hardwearing linen fabric and dark brown and black for the leather details. We send an email out to all those who purchase our bags to get their choice of colours.

A maximum of 50 selfies will be silkscreen printed on each bag at a time.

 

The Options for Your Contribution

Where the money goes

We need your help to organize the exhibitions, create the prints and produce the first batch of bags.

Here is how we will invest the funding we receive:

1. The Exhibitions

With your support we will secure two exhibition spaces in galleries in London and Paris and cover the costs in organizing the events – from framing the prints to transporting and insuring the works. 

2. The Production

We need your support to cover the costs of production for the first batch including the creation of the silk screen collage frames. We are very excited about this project and the impact it will have and hope that you are too.  

The Outcome

This project offers anyone the chance to become an active part of a fashion project and to be involved in its creative process. The Picture Us Project also explores the visual identity of the followers of fashion. With your help we will put together a collection, which will celebrate the individuals who have so far been represented only by a number of 'likes' and 'shares'.  

Risks and challenges

We know that timely fulfillment of rewards is extremely important. We have already identified time and resources needed to complete this project at any quantity (even if it exceeds our £20,000 goal). Relationships have already been secured with manufacturers who we will work with to deliver the production on time. 

We really hope to get your rewards to you mid-November, but we are allowing some buffer time until the end of November.

All we need now is your support. Please share our project with your friends and family. We are ready to send The Picture Us fashion pieces around the world.

story:
Short Summary

What is Beautiful Voices Art Program?

Beautiful Voices is an Art Program that The Rag Collection will begin this fall at StreetlightUSA for teen girls rescued out of sex-trafficking in Phoenix, AZ.  

The Beautiful Voices Art Program will be a consistent weekly art space where each girl will engage at her own pace with media she wants to use, and with many creative options at her disposal.  It is space, tools, materials and curriculum that invites each girl to enter the creative process, to begin to express, play, identify her personal voice, and dream about the future.  

Why start an Art Program?

The horrible truth of the effects of abuse is that the voices of these girls have been trampled on in ways that severely hinder growth, identity, and restoration. We believe that the voices of these girls are not only valuable to our community, but also to themselves.

It is our desire to provide room and resources for each girl to rediscover, uncover, and begin to unbury the beauty of her voice. This process takes time, but art is another door to the heart that encourages this process.

  • Art is a tool that makes the emotions more accessible. 
  • Art calms anxiety, fears, and the mind so that other emotions can be expressed and valued.
  • Art is fun.
  • Art creates a safe space for new connections with self and others.
  • Art is a healing tool that allows self discovery. 
  • Art is a great way to offer these girls choices for how they want to be heard, seen, and what they want for their lives!

How will this Art Program work?

  • Planning Process: We began the planning process in August 2012.
  • Art Program: We will begin art workshops the week of August 12th, 2013- ending in June 2014
  • Artist Training: We will train artists during the summer of 2014 in preparation for program expansion.
  • Timeframe:  August 2013-June 2014
  • Framework: Art Studio and Workshops We will provide weekly art space for a group dynamic.  There will also  be construct space for specific girls who want more time to create.  This is a unique program, therefore we will be working within the main programs at the shelter.  As we figure out the best times and days for the girls to engage in art, we will also be experimenting with a variety of expressive projects, themes, and tools in the form of workshops and individual art classes.  
  • Resources:  Tools and Materials  We are excited to bring in a wide range of materials including mixed media, writing, pottery, photography, painting, drawing, dance, etc. We will also be looking into connecting girls to arts resources in their community when appropriate. This resource development journey may include field trips to museums, art workshops, and art supply stores.
 

IMPACT!!!

The goals of Beautiful Voices are:

  • Create consistent Art Studio Space at the shelter 

  • Offer a variety of art tools and workshops 

  • Provide personal and group guidance with the art staff 

  • Train more artists in the community to be artist mentors in order to build the program in the following year 

What we need + What you get!

We need your support!  Without you, these girls will have to wait even longer for resources to connect to their voice.

Join us today, share the word with your friends on fb and email! Invite others to be a part of this incredible new program to bring restoration and uncover the beauty in these hard stories!

Cost Breakdown:  $20,000 - its not that much to restore voices! If 800 people give $25, we are done!

Program development + staff = $14,300 

Materials, tools, equipment = $1,300

Developmental Resources = $1,000

Indiegogo Fee + Reward Cost =  $3,400

*$16,600 goes directly to the Beautiful Voices Art Program at StreetlightUSA

Extended goal:  If we exceed our goal, the additional funds will be used to extend training hours to more artists and bring in more art staff into the current program, as we are raising the minimal amount to start this 1 year program.

If we don't meet our goal, we will have to scale back and have less art staff hours and ask for more donated supplies.

 

What YOU get!  

We are fortunate to have some really unique rewards for those of you who donate because we know alot of artists in the community who care about this project who have donated art to support the restoration of these beautiful voices!
 
Check out the Art Rewards in our Gallery!
 
 
 
 Other Ways You Can Help
*get the word out!  Share this project with your friends! Invite them to be a part :).
*email us for some flyers and pass them out to your community, business, church, circle of friends!
story_txt:
Short Summary
What is Beautiful Voices Art Program?
Beautiful Voices is an Art Program that The Rag Collection will begin this fall at StreetlightUSA for teen girls rescued out of sex-trafficking in Phoenix, AZ.  
The Beautiful Voices Art Program will be a consistent weekly art space where each girl will engage at her own pace with media she wants to use, and with many creative options at her disposal.  It is space, tools, materials and curriculum that invites each girl to enter the creative process, to begin to express, play, identify her personal voice, and dream about the future.  
Why start an Art Program?
The horrible truth of the effects of abuse is that the voices of these girls have been trampled on in ways that severely hinder growth, identity, and restoration. We believe that the voices of these girls are not only valuable to our community, but also to themselves.
It is our desire to provide room and resources for each girl to rediscover, uncover, and begin to unbury the beauty of her voice. This process takes time, but art is another door to the heart that encourages this process.


Art is a tool that makes the emotions more accessible. 


Art calms anxiety, fears, and the mind so that other emotions can be expressed and valued.


Art is fun.


Art creates a safe space for new connections with self and others.


Art is a healing tool that allows self discovery. 


Art is a great way to offer these girls choices for how they want to be heard, seen, and what they want for their lives!

How will this Art Program work?


Planning Process: We began the planning process in August 2012.



Art Program: We will begin art workshops the week of August 12th, 2013- ending in June 2014



Artist Training: We will train artists during the summer of 2014 in preparation for program expansion.



Timeframe:  August 2013-June 2014



Framework: Art Studio and Workshops We will provide weekly art space for a group dynamic.  There will also  be construct space for specific girls who want more time to create.  This is a unique program, therefore we will be working within the main programs at the shelter.  As we figure out the best times and days for the girls to engage in art, we will also be experimenting with a variety of expressive projects, themes, and tools in the form of workshops and individual art classes.  

Resources:  Tools and Materials  We are excited to bring in a wide range of materials including mixed media, writing, pottery, photography, painting, drawing, dance, etc. We will also be looking into connecting girls to arts resources in their community when appropriate. This resource development journey may include field trips to museums, art workshops, and art supply stores.

 
IMPACT!!!
The goals of Beautiful Voices are:


Create consistent Art Studio Space at the shelter 


Offer a variety of art tools and workshops 


Provide personal and group guidance with the art staff 


Train more artists in the community to be artist mentors in order to build the program in the following year 


What we need + What you get!
We need your support!  Without you, these girls will have to wait even longer for resources to connect to their voice.
Join us today, share the word with your friends on fb and email! Invite others to be a part of this incredible new program to bring restoration and uncover the beauty in these hard stories!

Cost Breakdown:  $20,000 - its not that much to restore voices! If 800 people give $25, we are done!

Program development + staff = $14,300 
Materials, tools, equipment = $1,300
Developmental Resources = $1,000
Indiegogo Fee + Reward Cost =  $3,400
*$16,600 goes directly to the Beautiful Voices Art Program at StreetlightUSA
Extended goal:  If we exceed our goal, the additional funds will be used to extend training hours to more artists and bring in more art staff into the current program, as we are raising the minimal amount to start this 1 year program.
If we don't meet our goal, we will have to scale back and have less art staff hours and ask for more donated supplies.
 
What YOU get!  
We are fortunate to have some really unique rewards for those of you who donate because we know alot of artists in the community who care about this project who have donated art to support the restoration of these beautiful voices!
 
Check out the Art Rewards in our Gallery!
 
 
 
 Other Ways You Can Help



*get the word out!  Share this project with your friends! Invite them to be a part :).*email us for some flyers and pass them out to your community, business, church, circle of friends!

story:
The Fleiss – Giacummo – McAvoy NY Contemporary Art Symposium 2013 (FGM) provides a residency on Long Island, N.Y. for 12+ international artists. FGM seeks to encourage and improve the cultural exchange between artists and collaborating communities. This program is inspired by D. Fleiss & East West Artists International (DFEWA) whose mission is to establish a working cooperation that will encourage and improve the cultural exchange between outstanding artists of varying backgrounds from eastern and western countries. DFEWA continues to achieve this aim by working in close contact with artists from all around the world. Artists who participate in the symposiums create a broader understanding of the contemporary arts in their respective communities around the world. Symposiums are held in locations throughout the Eastern and Western Hemispheres.

During FGM, artists will be provided housing, studio space, all meals, trips to cultural centers, and selected artist supplies at no cost to them.  Lifting these financial burdens for the artists provides them the opportunity to explore their creativity with themselves and others. Artists will be collaborating on Long Island from September 27 through October 7, 2013.

This program brings art professionals from around the world together to form new networks, foster international connections, develop cross-cultural understanding, and cultivate cooperation. As a FGM collaborator, the Islip Art Museum will arrange a series of events enabling the community, general public, and local artists, and art students to benefit from this exchange resulting in exposure to the various cultures and art making practices of all participating artists (please see schedule of events). The Patchogue Arts Council will be collaborating through arranging artists’ talks in Patchogue, and providing a gateway to other opportunities in the community such as exhibition.

Contact us at FGMNewYork@gmail.com

All supporters will be notified when to expect their perks.

Islip Art Museum, East Islip, NY

Works from FGM 2013

Curated By Beth Giacummo

September 22 – December 29, 2013

Reception: October 6 from 1:00-4:00 PM; Free


Islip Art Museum, East Islip, NY

New York Bound: International

Book Art Biennial

Curated By Dorothea Fleiss

September 22 – December 29,2013

Reception: October 6 from 1:00-4:00 PM; Free


Islip Art Museum, East Islip, NY

Prosecco Poppin’ Bookart Preview Party

With the FGM Residency Artists

Friday October 4 from 7:00–9:30 PM
($65pp/$100 two)


Briarcliffe College Gallery, Bethpage NY

International Living Classroom;

Artists of the Fleiss-Giacummo-McAvoy NY Contemporary Art Symposium 2013

Curated By Beth Giacummo
October 2, 2013-November 8, 2013
Reception: October 2 from 3:30-6:00 PM; Free


Second Ave Firehouse Gallery, Bay Shore, NY

Solo Exhibition of Dorothea Fleiss

October 3, 2013 - November 2, 2013

Reception: October 6 from 5:00-7:00 PM; Free


Gallery at 40 South, Patchogue, NY

Made in Poland

Curated By Beth Giacummo

October 5, 2013 - November 20, 2013

Reception October 5 from 4:00-6:00 PM; Free


Brick House Brewery, Patchogue, NY

Shand’s Loft Gallery @ BHB

Small Works from FGM 2013

September 27 – October 6, 2013

Reception: October 5, 2013 from 2:00–4:00 PM; Free


Patchogue Arts Council, Patchogue, NY

Artist Talks

October 5, 2013 from 1:00-1:45 PM

Location: Plaza Cinema & Media Arts Center, 20 Terry St., Patchogue; Free


Islip Art Museum, East Islip, NY

IAM DFEWA & FGM Artist Talks:

A night with DFEWA; An informational networking event exposing local artists and arts professionals to an international connection for possible future collaboration and participation.

Meet the artists and view new works made while in residency with FGM 2013

October 7, 6:30-8:30 pm ($20/pp)


Open Studio Days:

Visit the participating artists and

see their work in progress

Date & Time TBA (*VIP time invitation only)

story:
Above:Left- A photograph sample.>Right: My style makes it an art piece.

A Unique Project to help expand my Artwork into new gallery markets ~by artist Vesa Peltonen

CREATING AN ORIGINAL 'COOL POP' ARTWORK from your photograph.

Hi! Send me your clear digital photo, jpg. by e-mail or actual photo by mail and you will receive a painting on w/c quality paper, being a cool representation of your picture. Choose either one of two sizes. Yes, a 'painting' [meaning- mixed media, -using an appropriate combination of traditional mediums as pastel, acrylic, w/c, to pencil crayon...] on a digital format, printed on w/c quality paper. 2 sizes are: 12” x 16” or 16” x 20”

Above: Left- A photograph example.> Right: My style changes it to an art piece.

I am a well known Canadian artist/designer, Vesa Peltonen, owner of Peltonen Art & Design. I've created commissioned artworks that are unique for clients such as Dr. Jane Goodall, Ballet dancer- Karen Kain, of the National Ballet of Canada, The World Aquatic Museum, World Jr. Hockey Association, Barcelona Summer Olympics, to several well known entertainers such as the late actor David Carradine...check out my art at: http://artistprints.ca 

Above:'Buddy Guy' [expressive bold artwork.16" x 20"] Changed a lot from photo. I saw him perform/met him also & have his autograph. Very lucky & cool to see him.

   

Artist: Vesa Peltonen -30 yrs. in creating art

Bio info: https://artistrunwebsite.com/mywebsite/settings

NOTE: You don't need to e-mail or photo when you CONTRIBUTE either cost. Please wait once the 40 day campaign is done end of September.

Vesa Peltonen of Peltonen Art makes hand done/digitized paintings of images that are colourful & expressive. Only 1 is made that is your own. [No copies made].

HOW TO ORDER?

Decide on a photo you’d like made to a painted style> one of 2 size choices:

·  1]Normal photos are rectangular, so we offer a 12x16".[horizontal or vertical]   >YOU THUS CONTRIBUTE only $90. [see parks]Whalla! You are a Patron. 

· 2] If you’d like a larger image, it will be approx. 16x20". [horizontal or vertical].       >YOU THUS CONTRIBUTE only $150.[see perks] Whalla! You are a Patron. :)

~THEN- What YOU Do First...

·  1) Here on Indiegogo, Click on the CONTRIBUTE  button

·  2) Click on which 'Perk' type you’d like (amount is thus added) MC/Visa/Paypal

·  3) E-mail me your address for where you want the ‘Artwork’ shipped FREE.

Note:  Peltonen Art e-mail is: vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com

·  PAY using anyone of the ‘VERIFIED’ choices including Paypal. -It takes a minute.

Please remember:

·  You BUY 1 painting. You will receive it within 12 business days after campaign depending your location. Note: If you like it earlier e-mail a request.

My goals for this campaign are:

·  MORE exposure to Peltonen Art & Design [via website]  http://artistprints.ca

 ~Where I'll be represented-world reknowned.

~  YOU help fund further development of the ART & DESIGN New website. YOU help expand my Artwork further into well know galleries, such as Miami, Los Angeles and Europe. My artworks have recently been approved by some well known Galleries, as the Art Fusion Gallery in Miami, to be represented. It is very high profile GALLERY & as most large galleries, they do charge an agent/gallery fee. I need to pay for framing, shipping, printing & travel costs. I use my own $ as well.

~ FUNDING  plans are to market my artwork world-wide to corporations, agents,galleries and private collectors. I'm creating a good marketing plan/promo.

I'm asking for support. In return I offer YOU a painting normally 2x cost.

The Fulfillment & Process.

After you purchase your artwork choice, simply attach your photo by e-mail to me: vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com 

-Please keep in mind that your photo should not be square but more rectangular, no smaller than the normal size of 3 in. x 4 in. to  6” x 8” 

 For all 12X16" or 16X20"  paintings we are not into replicating lots of detail and specific personal features, so best to allow for a feeling of the whole image; the essence. Don’t worry, I’ll let you know if your photo is too complex.

Note: When you send by e-mail your photo, please make sure it is a clear pic. 


 < This has too much glare, lacks interest; not easy to work from.

-It will be a stylish tasteful colourful painting, ~ a signed original.  

- Please use your best judgment in choosing your photo. 

Other Ways You Can Help

3]> I also offer original art prints @ $250.which you choose from my WEBSITE [see PERK #3 first] then look at: http://www.artistprints.ca   Simply indicate which art piece you would like from the many there. Note: Mailing inc. in any of the 3 choices.

4]>You CAN ALSO CONTRIBUTE ANY AMOUNT to help expand my Art Company,~ even a $5. Donation. [again, see all perks]. 

>>>>SEND TO: My e-mail: vesa_peltonen@hotmail.com 

And that’s all there is to it.
